00027 #include <asm/page.h>
00028 #include <linux/nmi.h>
00029 #include "gnilnd.h"

00031 /* this is useful when needed to debug wire corruption. */
00032 static void
00033 kgnilnd_dump_blob(int level, char *prefix, void *buf, int len) {
00034         __u64 *ptr;
00035 
00036         ptr = (__u64 *) buf;
00037 
00038         while (len > 0) {
00039                 if (len >= 32) {
00040                         CDEBUG(level,
00041                                "%s 0x%p: 0x%16.16llx 0x%16.16llx 0x%16.16llx 0x%16.16llx\n",
00042                                prefix, ptr, *(ptr), *(ptr + 1), *(ptr + 2), *(ptr + 3));
00043                         ptr += 4;
00044                         len -= 32;
00045                 } else if (len >= 16) {
00046                         CDEBUG(level,
00047                                "%s 0x%p: 0x%16.16llx 0x%16.16llx\n",
00048                                prefix, ptr, *(ptr), *(ptr + 1));
00049                         ptr += 2;
00050                         len -= 16;
00051                 } else {
00052                         CDEBUG(level, "%s 0x%p: 0x%16.16llx\n",
00053                                prefix, ptr, *(ptr));
00054                         ptr++;
00055                         len -= 8;
00056                 }
00057         }
00058 }
00059 
00060 static void
00061 kgnilnd_dump_msg(int mask, kgn_msg_t *msg)
00062 {
00063         CDEBUG(mask, "0x%8.8x 0x%4.4x 0x%4.4x 0x%16.16llx"
00064                 " 0x%16.16llx 0x%8.8x 0x%4.4x 0x%4.4x 0x%8.8x\n",
00065                 msg->gnm_magic, msg->gnm_version,
00066                 msg->gnm_type, msg->gnm_srcnid,
00067                 msg->gnm_connstamp, msg->gnm_seq,
00068                 msg->gnm_cksum, msg->gnm_payload_cksum,
00069                 msg->gnm_payload_len);
00070 }
00071 
00072 void
00073 kgnilnd_schedule_device(kgn_device_t *dev)
00074 {
00075         short         already_live = 0;
00076 
00077         /* we'll only want to wake if the scheduler thread
00078          * has come around and set ready to zero */
00079         already_live = cmpxchg(&dev->gnd_ready, GNILND_DEV_IDLE, GNILND_DEV_IRQ);
00080 
00081         if (!already_live) {
00082                 wake_up_all(&dev->gnd_waitq);
00083         }
00084         return;
00085 }
00086 
00087 void kgnilnd_schedule_device_timer(unsigned long arg)
00088 {
00089         kgn_device_t *dev = (kgn_device_t *) arg;
00090 
00091         kgnilnd_schedule_device(dev);
00092 }
00093 
00094 void
00095 kgnilnd_device_callback(__u32 devid, __u64 arg)
00096 {
00097         kgn_device_t *dev;
00098         int           index = (int) arg;
00099 
00100         if (index >= kgnilnd_data.kgn_ndevs) {
00101                 /* use _EMERG instead of an LBUG to prevent LBUG'ing in
00102                  * interrupt context. */
00103                 LCONSOLE_EMERG("callback for unknown device %d->%d\n",
00104                                 devid, index);
00105                 return;
00106         }
00107 
00108         dev = &kgnilnd_data.kgn_devices[index];
00109         /* just basic sanity */
00110         if (dev->gnd_id == devid) {
00111                 kgnilnd_schedule_device(dev);
00112         } else {
00113                 LCONSOLE_EMERG("callback for bad device %d devid %d\n",
00114                                 dev->gnd_id, devid);
00115         }
00116 }
00117 
00118 /* sched_intent values:
00119  * < 0 : do not reschedule under any circumstances
00120  * == 0: reschedule if someone marked him WANTS_SCHED
00121  * > 0 : force a reschedule */
00122 /* Return code 0 means it did not schedule the conn, 1
00123  * means it successfully scheduled the conn.
00124  */
00125 
00126 int
00127 kgnilnd_schedule_process_conn(kgn_conn_t *conn, int sched_intent)
00128 {
00129         int     conn_sched;
00130 
00131         /* move back to IDLE but save previous state.
00132          * if we see WANTS_SCHED, we'll call kgnilnd_schedule_conn and
00133          * let the xchg there handle any racing callers to get it
00134          * onto gnd_ready_conns */
00135 
00136         conn_sched = xchg(&conn->gnc_scheduled, GNILND_CONN_IDLE);
00137         LASSERTF(conn_sched == GNILND_CONN_WANTS_SCHED ||
00138                  conn_sched == GNILND_CONN_PROCESS,
00139                  "conn %p after process in bad state: %d\n",
00140                  conn, conn_sched);
00141 
00142         if (sched_intent >= 0) {
00143                 if ((sched_intent > 0 || (conn_sched == GNILND_CONN_WANTS_SCHED))) {
00144                         return kgnilnd_schedule_conn_refheld(conn, 1);
00145                 }
00146         }
00147         return 0;
00148 }
00149 
00150 /* Return of 0 for conn not scheduled, 1 returned if conn was scheduled or marked
00151  * as scheduled */
00152 
00153 int
00154 _kgnilnd_schedule_conn(kgn_conn_t *conn, const char *caller, int line, int refheld)
00155 {
00156         kgn_device_t        *dev = conn->gnc_device;
00157         int                  sched;
00158         int                  rc;
00159 
00160         sched = xchg(&conn->gnc_scheduled, GNILND_CONN_WANTS_SCHED);
00161         /* we only care about the last person who marked want_sched since they
00162          * are most likely the culprit
00163          */
00164         memcpy(conn->gnc_sched_caller, caller, sizeof(conn->gnc_sched_caller));
00165         conn->gnc_sched_line = line;
00166         /* if we are IDLE, add to list - only one guy sees IDLE and "wins"
00167          * the chance to put it onto gnd_ready_conns.
00168          * otherwise, leave marked as WANTS_SCHED and the thread that "owns"
00169          *  the conn in process_conns will take care of moving it back to
00170          *  SCHED when it is done processing */
00171 
00172         if (sched == GNILND_CONN_IDLE) {
00173                 /* if the conn is already scheduled, we've already requested
00174                  * the scheduler thread wakeup */
00175                 if (!refheld) {
00176                         /* Add a reference to the conn if we are not holding a reference
00177                          * already from the exisiting scheduler. We now use the same
00178                          * reference if we need to reschedule a conn while in a scheduler
00179                          * thread.
00180                          */
00181                         kgnilnd_conn_addref(conn);
00182                 }
00183                 LASSERTF(list_empty(&conn->gnc_schedlist), "conn %p already sched state %d\n",
00184                          conn, sched);
00185 
00186                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "scheduling conn 0x%p caller %s:%d\n", conn, caller, line);
00187 
00188                 spin_lock(&dev->gnd_lock);
00189                 list_add_tail(&conn->gnc_schedlist, &dev->gnd_ready_conns);
00190                 spin_unlock(&dev->gnd_lock);
00191                 set_mb(conn->gnc_last_sched_ask, jiffies);
00192                 rc = 1;
00193         } else {
00194                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "not scheduling conn 0x%p: %d caller %s:%d\n", conn, sched, caller, line);
00195                 rc = 0;
00196         }
00197 
00198         /* make sure thread(s) going to process conns - but let it make
00199          * separate decision from conn schedule */
00200         kgnilnd_schedule_device(dev);
00201         return rc;
00202 }
00203 
00204 void
00205 kgnilnd_schedule_dgram(kgn_device_t *dev)
00206 {
00207         int                  wake;
00208 
00209         wake = xchg(&dev->gnd_dgram_ready, GNILND_DGRAM_SCHED);
00210         if (wake != GNILND_DGRAM_SCHED)  {
00211                 wake_up(&dev->gnd_dgram_waitq);
00212         } else {
00213                 CDEBUG(D_NETTRACE, "not waking: %d\n", wake);
00214         }
00215 }
00216 
00217 void
00218 kgnilnd_free_tx(kgn_tx_t *tx)
00219 {
00220         /* taken from kgnilnd_tx_add_state_locked */
00221 
00222         LASSERTF((tx->tx_list_p == NULL &&
00223                   tx->tx_list_state == GNILND_TX_ALLOCD) &&
00224                 list_empty(&tx->tx_list),
00225                 "tx %p with bad state %s (list_p %p) tx_list %s\n",
00226                 tx, kgnilnd_tx_state2str(tx->tx_list_state), tx->tx_list_p,
00227                 list_empty(&tx->tx_list) ? "empty" : "not empty");
00228 
00229         atomic_dec(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_ntx);
00230 
00231         /* we only allocate this if we need to */
00232         if (tx->tx_phys != NULL) {
00233                 kmem_cache_free(kgnilnd_data.kgn_tx_phys_cache, tx->tx_phys);
00234                 CDEBUG(D_MALLOC, "slab-freed 'tx_phys': %lu at %p.\n",
00235                        LNET_MAX_IOV * sizeof(gni_mem_segment_t), tx->tx_phys);
00236         }
00237 
00238         /* Only free the buffer if we used it */
00239         if (tx->tx_buffer_copy != NULL) {
00240                 vfree(tx->tx_buffer_copy);
00241                 tx->tx_buffer_copy = NULL;
00242                 CDEBUG(D_MALLOC, "vfreed buffer2\n");
00243         }
00244 #if 0
00245         KGNILND_POISON(tx, 0x5a, sizeof(kgn_tx_t));
00246 #endif
00247         CDEBUG(D_MALLOC, "slab-freed 'tx': %lu at %p.\n", sizeof(*tx), tx);
00248         kmem_cache_free(kgnilnd_data.kgn_tx_cache, tx);
00249 }
00250 
00251 kgn_tx_t *
00252 kgnilnd_alloc_tx (void)
00253 {
00254         kgn_tx_t        *tx = NULL;
00255 
00256         if (CFS_FAIL_CHECK(CFS_FAIL_GNI_ALLOC_TX))
00257                 return tx;
00258 
00259         tx = kmem_cache_alloc(kgnilnd_data.kgn_tx_cache, GFP_ATOMIC);
00260         if (tx == NULL) {
00261                 CERROR("failed to allocate tx\n");
00262                 return NULL;
00263         }
00264         CDEBUG(D_MALLOC, "slab-alloced 'tx': %lu at %p.\n",
00265                sizeof(*tx), tx);
00266 
00267         /* need this memset, cache alloc'd memory is not cleared */
00268         memset(tx, 0, sizeof(*tx));
00269 
00270         /* setup everything here to minimize time under the lock */
00271         tx->tx_buftype = GNILND_BUF_NONE;
00272         tx->tx_msg.gnm_type = GNILND_MSG_NONE;
00273         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&tx->tx_list);
00274         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&tx->tx_map_list);
00275         tx->tx_list_state = GNILND_TX_ALLOCD;
00276 
00277         atomic_inc(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_ntx);
00278 
00279         return tx;
00280 }
00281 
00282 /* csum_fold needs to be run on the return value before shipping over the wire */
00283 #define _kgnilnd_cksum(seed, ptr, nob)  csum_partial(ptr, nob, seed)
00284 
00285 /* we don't use offset as every one is passing a buffer reference that already
00286  * includes the offset into the base address -
00287  *  see kgnilnd_setup_virt_buffer and kgnilnd_setup_immediate_buffer */
00288 static inline __u16
00289 kgnilnd_cksum(void *ptr, size_t nob)
00290 {
00291         __u16   sum;
00292 
00293         sum = csum_fold(_kgnilnd_cksum(0, ptr, nob));
00294 
00295         /* don't use magic 'no checksum' value */
00296         if (sum == 0)
00297                 sum = 1;
00298 
00299         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "cksum 0x%x for ptr 0x%p sz %zu\n",
00300                sum, ptr, nob);
00301 
00302         return sum;
00303 }
00304 
00305 inline __u16
00306 kgnilnd_cksum_kiov(unsigned int nkiov, lnet_kiov_t *kiov,
00307                     unsigned int offset, unsigned int nob, int dump_blob)
00308 {
00309         __wsum             cksum = 0;
00310         __wsum             tmpck;
00311         __u16              retsum;
00312         void              *addr;
00313         unsigned int       fraglen;
00314         int                i, odd;
00315 
00316         LASSERT(nkiov > 0);
00317         LASSERT(nob > 0);
00318 
00319         CDEBUG(D_BUFFS, "calc cksum for kiov 0x%p nkiov %u offset %u nob %u, dump %d\n",
00320                kiov, nkiov, offset, nob, dump_blob);
00321 
00322         /* if loops changes, please change kgnilnd_setup_phys_buffer */
00323 
00324         while (offset >= kiov->kiov_len) {
00325                 offset -= kiov->kiov_len;
00326                 nkiov--;
00327                 kiov++;
00328                 LASSERT(nkiov > 0);
00329         }
00330 
00331         /* ignore nob here, if nob < (kiov_len - offset), kiov == 1 */
00332         odd = (unsigned long) (kiov[0].kiov_len - offset) & 1;
00333 
00334         if ((odd || *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_vmap_cksum) && nkiov > 1) {
00335                 struct page **pages = kgnilnd_data.kgn_cksum_map_pages[get_cpu()];
00336 
00337                 LASSERTF(pages != NULL, "NULL pages for cpu %d map_pages 0x%p\n",
00338                          get_cpu(), kgnilnd_data.kgn_cksum_map_pages);
00339 
00340                 CDEBUG(D_BUFFS, "odd %d len %u offset %u nob %u\n",
00341                        odd, kiov[0].kiov_len, offset, nob);
00342 
00343                 for (i = 0; i < nkiov; i++) {
00344                         pages[i] = kiov[i].kiov_page;
00345                 }
00346 
00347                 addr = vmap(pages, nkiov, VM_MAP, PAGE_KERNEL);
00348                 if (addr == NULL) {
00349                         CNETERR("Couldn't vmap %d frags on %d bytes to avoid odd length fragment in cksum\n",
00350                                 nkiov, nob);
00351                         /* return zero to avoid killing tx - we'll just get warning on console
00352                          * when remote end sees zero checksum */
00353                         RETURN(0);
00354                 }
00355                 atomic_inc(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nvmap_cksum);
00356 
00357                 tmpck = _kgnilnd_cksum(0, (void *) addr + kiov[0].kiov_offset + offset, nob);
00358                 cksum = tmpck;
00359 
00360                 if (dump_blob) {
00361                         kgnilnd_dump_blob(D_BUFFS, "flat kiov RDMA payload",
00362                                           (void *)addr + kiov[0].kiov_offset + offset, nob);
00363                 }
00364                 CDEBUG(D_BUFFS, "cksum 0x%x (+0x%x) for addr 0x%p+%u len %u offset %u\n",
00365                        cksum, tmpck, addr, kiov[0].kiov_offset, nob, offset);
00366                 vunmap(addr);
00367         } else {
00368                 do {
00369                         fraglen = min(kiov->kiov_len - offset, nob);
00370 
00371                         /* make dang sure we don't send a bogus checksum if somehow we get
00372                          * an odd length fragment on anything but the last entry in a kiov  -
00373                          * we know from kgnilnd_setup_rdma_buffer that we can't have non
00374                          * PAGE_SIZE pages in the middle, so if nob < PAGE_SIZE, it is the last one */
00375                         LASSERTF(!(fraglen&1) || (nob < PAGE_SIZE),
00376                                  "odd fraglen %u on nkiov %d, nob %u kiov_len %u offset %u kiov 0x%p\n",
00377                                  fraglen, nkiov, nob, kiov->kiov_len, offset, kiov);
00378 
00379                         addr = (void *)kmap(kiov->kiov_page) + kiov->kiov_offset + offset;
00380                         tmpck = _kgnilnd_cksum(cksum, addr, fraglen);
00381 
00382                         CDEBUG(D_BUFFS,
00383                                "cksum 0x%x (+0x%x) for page 0x%p+%u (0x%p) len %u offset %u\n",
00384                                cksum, tmpck, kiov->kiov_page, kiov->kiov_offset, addr,
00385                                fraglen, offset);
00386 
00387                         cksum = tmpck;
00388 
00389                         if (dump_blob)
00390                                 kgnilnd_dump_blob(D_BUFFS, "kiov cksum", addr, fraglen);
00391 
00392                         kunmap(kiov->kiov_page);
00393 
00394                         kiov++;
00395                         nkiov--;
00396                         nob -= fraglen;
00397                         offset = 0;
00398 
00399                         /* iov must not run out before end of data */
00400                         LASSERTF(nob == 0 || nkiov > 0, "nob %u nkiov %u\n", nob, nkiov);
00401 
00402                 } while (nob > 0);
00403         }
00404 
00405         retsum = csum_fold(cksum);
00406 
00407         /* don't use magic 'no checksum' value */
00408         if (retsum == 0)
00409                 retsum = 1;
00410 
00411         CDEBUG(D_BUFFS, "retsum 0x%x from cksum 0x%x\n", retsum, cksum);
00412 
00413         return retsum;
00414 }
00415 
00416 void
00417 kgnilnd_init_msg(kgn_msg_t *msg, int type, lnet_nid_t source)
00418 {
00419         msg->gnm_magic = GNILND_MSG_MAGIC;
00420         msg->gnm_version = GNILND_MSG_VERSION;
00421         msg->gnm_type = type;
00422         msg->gnm_payload_len = 0;
00423         msg->gnm_srcnid = source;
00424         /* gnm_connstamp gets set when FMA is sent */
00425         /* gnm_srcnid is set on creation via function argument
00426          * The right interface/net and nid is passed in when the message
00427          * is created.
00428          */
00429 }
00430 
00431 kgn_tx_t *
00432 kgnilnd_new_tx_msg(int type, lnet_nid_t source)
00433 {
00434         kgn_tx_t *tx = kgnilnd_alloc_tx();
00435 
00436         if (tx != NULL) {
00437                 kgnilnd_init_msg(&tx->tx_msg, type, source);
00438         } else {
00439                 CERROR("couldn't allocate new tx type %s!\n",
00440                        kgnilnd_msgtype2str(type));
00441         }
00442 
00443         return tx;
00444 }
00445 
00446 static void
00447 kgnilnd_nak_rdma(kgn_conn_t *conn, int rx_type, int error, __u64 cookie, lnet_nid_t source) {
00448         kgn_tx_t        *tx;
00449 
00450         int             nak_type;
00451 
00452         switch (rx_type) {
00453         case GNILND_MSG_GET_REQ:
00454         case GNILND_MSG_GET_DONE:
00455                 nak_type = GNILND_MSG_GET_NAK;
00456                 break;
00457         case GNILND_MSG_PUT_REQ:
00458         case GNILND_MSG_PUT_ACK:
00459         case GNILND_MSG_PUT_DONE:
00460                 nak_type = GNILND_MSG_PUT_NAK;
00461                 break;
00462         case GNILND_MSG_PUT_REQ_REV:
00463         case GNILND_MSG_PUT_DONE_REV:
00464                 nak_type = GNILND_MSG_PUT_NAK_REV;
00465                 break;
00466         case GNILND_MSG_GET_REQ_REV:
00467         case GNILND_MSG_GET_ACK_REV:
00468         case GNILND_MSG_GET_DONE_REV:
00469                 nak_type = GNILND_MSG_GET_NAK_REV;
00470                 break;
00471         default:
00472                 CERROR("invalid msg type %s (%d)\n",
00473                         kgnilnd_msgtype2str(rx_type), rx_type);
00474                 LBUG();
00475         }
00476         /* only allow NAK on error and truncate to zero */
00477         LASSERTF(error <= 0, "error %d conn 0x%p, cookie "LPU64"\n",
00478                  error, conn, cookie);
00479 
00480         tx = kgnilnd_new_tx_msg(nak_type, source);
00481         if (tx == NULL) {
00482                 CNETERR("can't get TX to NAK RDMA to %s\n",
00483                         libcfs_nid2str(conn->gnc_peer->gnp_nid));
00484                 return;
00485         }
00486 
00487         tx->tx_msg.gnm_u.completion.gncm_retval = error;
00488         tx->tx_msg.gnm_u.completion.gncm_cookie = cookie;
00489         kgnilnd_queue_tx(conn, tx);
00490 }
00491 
00492 int
00493 kgnilnd_setup_immediate_buffer(kgn_tx_t *tx, unsigned int niov,
00494                                struct kvec *iov, lnet_kiov_t *kiov,
00495                                unsigned int offset, unsigned int nob)
00496 {
00497         kgn_msg_t       *msg = &tx->tx_msg;
00498         int              i;
00499 
00500         /* To help save on MDDs for short messages, we'll vmap a kiov to allow
00501          * gni_smsg_send to send that as the payload */
00502 
00503         LASSERT(tx->tx_buftype == GNILND_BUF_NONE);
00504 
00505         if (nob == 0) {
00506                 tx->tx_buffer = NULL;
00507         } else if (kiov != NULL) {
00508 
00509                 if ((niov > 0) && unlikely(niov > (nob/PAGE_SIZE))) {
00510                         niov = ((nob + offset + kiov->kiov_offset + PAGE_SIZE - 1) /
00511                                 PAGE_SIZE);
00512                 }
00513 
00514                 LASSERTF(niov > 0 && niov < GNILND_MAX_IMMEDIATE/PAGE_SIZE,
00515                         "bad niov %d msg %p kiov %p iov %p offset %d nob%d\n",
00516                         niov, msg, kiov, iov, offset, nob);
00517 
00518                 while (offset >= kiov->kiov_len) {
00519                         offset -= kiov->kiov_len;
00520                         niov--;
00521                         kiov++;
00522                         LASSERT(niov > 0);
00523                 }
00524                 for (i = 0; i < niov; i++) {
00525                         /* We can't have a kiov_offset on anything but the first entry,
00526                          * otherwise we'll have a hole at the end of the mapping as we only map
00527                          * whole pages.
00528                          * Also, if we have a kiov_len < PAGE_SIZE but we need to map more
00529                          * than kiov_len, we will also have a whole at the end of that page
00530                          * which isn't allowed */
00531                         if ((kiov[i].kiov_offset != 0 && i > 0) ||
00532                             (kiov[i].kiov_offset + kiov[i].kiov_len != PAGE_SIZE && i < niov - 1)) {
00533                                 CNETERR("Can't make payload contiguous in I/O VM:"
00534                                        "page %d, offset %u, nob %u, kiov_offset %u kiov_len %u \n",
00535                                        i, offset, nob, kiov->kiov_offset, kiov->kiov_len);
00536                                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00537                         }
00538                         tx->tx_imm_pages[i] = kiov[i].kiov_page;
00539                 }
00540 
00541                 /* hijack tx_phys for the later unmap */
00542                 if (niov == 1) {
00543                         /* tx->phyx being equal to NULL is the signal for unmap to discern between kmap and vmap */
00544                         tx->tx_phys = NULL;
00545                         tx->tx_buffer = (void *)kmap(tx->tx_imm_pages[0]) + kiov[0].kiov_offset + offset;
00546                         atomic_inc(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nkmap_short);
00547                         GNIDBG_TX(D_NET, tx, "kmapped page for %d bytes for kiov 0x%p, buffer 0x%p",
00548                                 nob, kiov, tx->tx_buffer);
00549                 } else {
00550                         tx->tx_phys = vmap(tx->tx_imm_pages, niov, VM_MAP, PAGE_KERNEL);
00551                         if (tx->tx_phys == NULL) {
00552                                 CNETERR("Couldn't vmap %d frags on %d bytes\n", niov, nob);
00553                                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00554 
00555                         }
00556                         atomic_inc(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nvmap_short);
00557                         /* make sure we take into account the kiov offset as the start of the buffer */
00558                         tx->tx_buffer = (void *)tx->tx_phys + kiov[0].kiov_offset + offset;
00559                         GNIDBG_TX(D_NET, tx, "mapped %d pages for %d bytes from kiov 0x%p to 0x%p, buffer 0x%p",
00560                                 niov, nob, kiov, tx->tx_phys, tx->tx_buffer);
00561                 }
00562                 tx->tx_buftype = GNILND_BUF_IMMEDIATE_KIOV;
00563                 tx->tx_nob = nob;
00564 
00565         } else {
00566                 /* For now this is almost identical to kgnilnd_setup_virt_buffer, but we
00567                  * could "flatten" the payload into a single contiguous buffer ready
00568                  * for sending direct over an FMA if we ever needed to. */
00569 
00570                 LASSERT(niov > 0);
00571 
00572                 while (offset >= iov->iov_len) {
00573                         offset -= iov->iov_len;
00574                         niov--;
00575                         iov++;
00576                         LASSERT(niov > 0);
00577                 }
00578 
00579                 if (nob > iov->iov_len - offset) {
00580                         CERROR("Can't handle multiple vaddr fragments\n");
00581                         return -EMSGSIZE;
00582                 }
00583 
00584                 tx->tx_buffer = (void *)(((unsigned long)iov->iov_base) + offset);
00585 
00586                 tx->tx_buftype = GNILND_BUF_IMMEDIATE;
00587                 tx->tx_nob = nob;
00588         }
00589 
00590         /* checksum payload early - it shouldn't be changing after lnd_send */
00591         if (*kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_checksum >= 2) {
00592                 msg->gnm_payload_cksum = kgnilnd_cksum(tx->tx_buffer, nob);
00593                 if (CFS_FAIL_CHECK(CFS_FAIL_GNI_SMSG_CKSUM2)) {
00594                         msg->gnm_payload_cksum += 0xe00e;
00595                 }
00596                 if (*kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_checksum_dump > 1) {
00597                         kgnilnd_dump_blob(D_BUFFS, "payload checksum",
00598                                           tx->tx_buffer, nob);
00599                 }
00600         } else {
00601                 msg->gnm_payload_cksum = 0;
00602         }
00603 
00604         return 0;
00605 }
00606 
00607 int
00608 kgnilnd_setup_virt_buffer(kgn_tx_t *tx,
00609                           unsigned int niov, struct kvec *iov,
00610                           unsigned int offset, unsigned int nob)
00611 
00612 {
00613         LASSERT(nob > 0);
00614         LASSERT(niov > 0);
00615         LASSERT(tx->tx_buftype == GNILND_BUF_NONE);
00616 
00617         while (offset >= iov->iov_len) {
00618                 offset -= iov->iov_len;
00619                 niov--;
00620                 iov++;
00621                 LASSERT(niov > 0);
00622         }
00623 
00624         if (nob > iov->iov_len - offset) {
00625                 CERROR("Can't handle multiple vaddr fragments\n");
00626                 return -EMSGSIZE;
00627         }
00628 
00629         tx->tx_buftype = GNILND_BUF_VIRT_UNMAPPED;
00630         tx->tx_nob = nob;
00631         tx->tx_buffer = (void *)(((unsigned long)iov->iov_base) + offset);
00632         return 0;
00633 }
00634 
00635 int
00636 kgnilnd_setup_phys_buffer(kgn_tx_t *tx, int nkiov, lnet_kiov_t *kiov,
00637                           unsigned int offset, unsigned int nob)
00638 {
00639         gni_mem_segment_t *phys;
00640         int             rc = 0;
00641         unsigned int    fraglen;
00642 
00643         GNIDBG_TX(D_NET, tx, "niov %d kiov 0x%p offset %u nob %u", nkiov, kiov, offset, nob);
00644 
00645         LASSERT(nob > 0);
00646         LASSERT(nkiov > 0);
00647         LASSERT(tx->tx_buftype == GNILND_BUF_NONE);
00648 
00649         /* only allocate this if we are going to use it */
00650         tx->tx_phys = kmem_cache_alloc(kgnilnd_data.kgn_tx_phys_cache,
00651                                               GFP_ATOMIC);
00652         if (tx->tx_phys == NULL) {
00653                 CERROR("failed to allocate tx_phys\n");
00654                 rc = -ENOMEM;
00655                 GOTO(error, rc);
00656         }
00657 
00658         CDEBUG(D_MALLOC, "slab-alloced 'tx->tx_phys': %lu at %p.\n",
00659                LNET_MAX_IOV * sizeof(gni_mem_segment_t), tx->tx_phys);
00660 
00661         /* if loops changes, please change kgnilnd_cksum_kiov
00662          *   and kgnilnd_setup_immediate_buffer */
00663 
00664         while (offset >= kiov->kiov_len) {
00665                 offset -= kiov->kiov_len;
00666                 nkiov--;
00667                 kiov++;
00668                 LASSERT(nkiov > 0);
00669         }
00670 
00671         /* at this point, kiov points to the first page that we'll actually map
00672          * now that we've seeked into the koiv for offset and dropped any
00673          * leading pages that fall entirely within the offset */
00674         tx->tx_buftype = GNILND_BUF_PHYS_UNMAPPED;
00675         tx->tx_nob = nob;
00676 
00677         /* kiov_offset is start of 'valid' buffer, so index offset past that */
00678         tx->tx_buffer = (void *)((unsigned long)(kiov->kiov_offset + offset));
00679         phys = tx->tx_phys;
00680 
00681         CDEBUG(D_NET, "tx 0x%p buffer 0x%p map start kiov 0x%p+%u niov %d offset %u\n",
00682                tx, tx->tx_buffer, kiov, kiov->kiov_offset, nkiov, offset);
00683 
00684         do {
00685                 fraglen = min(kiov->kiov_len - offset, nob);
00686 
00687                 /* We can't have a kiov_offset on anything but the first entry,
00688                  * otherwise we'll have a hole at the end of the mapping as we only map
00689                  * whole pages. Only the first page is allowed to have an offset -
00690                  * we'll add that into tx->tx_buffer and that will get used when we
00691                  * map in the segments (see kgnilnd_map_buffer).
00692                  * Also, if we have a kiov_len < PAGE_SIZE but we need to map more
00693                  * than kiov_len, we will also have a whole at the end of that page
00694                  * which isn't allowed */
00695                 if ((phys != tx->tx_phys) &&
00696                     ((kiov->kiov_offset != 0) ||
00697                      ((kiov->kiov_len < PAGE_SIZE) && (nob > kiov->kiov_len)))) {
00698                         CERROR("Can't make payload contiguous in I/O VM:"
00699                                "page %d, offset %u, nob %u, kiov_offset %u kiov_len %u \n",
00700                                (int)(phys - tx->tx_phys),
00701                                offset, nob, kiov->kiov_offset, kiov->kiov_len);
00702                         rc = -EINVAL;
00703                         GOTO(error, rc);
00704                 }
00705 
00706                 if ((phys - tx->tx_phys) == LNET_MAX_IOV) {
00707                         CERROR ("payload too big (%d)\n", (int)(phys - tx->tx_phys));
00708                         rc = -EMSGSIZE;
00709                         GOTO(error, rc);
00710                 }
00711 
00712                 if (CFS_FAIL_CHECK(CFS_FAIL_GNI_PHYS_SETUP)) {
00713                         rc = -EINVAL;
00714                         GOTO(error, rc);
00715                 }
00716 
00717                 CDEBUG(D_BUFFS, "page 0x%p kiov_offset %u kiov_len %u nob %u "
00718                                "nkiov %u offset %u\n",
00719                       kiov->kiov_page, kiov->kiov_offset, kiov->kiov_len, nob, nkiov, offset);
00720 
00721                 phys->address = page_to_phys(kiov->kiov_page);
00722                 phys++;
00723                 kiov++;
00724                 nkiov--;
00725                 nob -= fraglen;
00726                 offset = 0;
00727 
00728                 /* iov must not run out before end of data */
00729                 LASSERTF(nob == 0 || nkiov > 0, "nob %u nkiov %u\n", nob, nkiov);
00730 
00731         } while (nob > 0);
00732 
00733         tx->tx_phys_npages = phys - tx->tx_phys;
00734 
00735         return 0;
00736 
00737 error:
00738         if (tx->tx_phys != NULL) {
00739                 kmem_cache_free(kgnilnd_data.kgn_tx_phys_cache, tx->tx_phys);
00740                 CDEBUG(D_MALLOC, "slab-freed 'tx_phys': %lu at %p.\n",
00741                        sizeof(*tx->tx_phys), tx->tx_phys);
00742                 tx->tx_phys = NULL;
00743         }
00744         return rc;
00745 }
00746 
00747 static inline int
00748 kgnilnd_setup_rdma_buffer(kgn_tx_t *tx, unsigned int niov,
00749                           struct kvec *iov, lnet_kiov_t *kiov,
00750                           unsigned int offset, unsigned int nob)
00751 {
00752         int     rc;
00753 
00754         LASSERTF((iov == NULL) != (kiov == NULL), "iov 0x%p, kiov 0x%p, tx 0x%p,"
00755                                                 " offset %d, nob %d, niov %d\n"
00756                                                 , iov, kiov, tx, offset, nob, niov);
00757 
00758         if (kiov != NULL) {
00759                 rc = kgnilnd_setup_phys_buffer(tx, niov, kiov, offset, nob);
00760         } else {
00761                 rc = kgnilnd_setup_virt_buffer(tx, niov, iov, offset, nob);
00762         }
00763         return rc;
00764 }
00765 
00766 /* kgnilnd_parse_lnet_rdma()
00767  * lntmsg - message passed in from lnet.
00768  * niov, kiov, offset - see lnd_t in lib-types.h for descriptions.
00769  * nob - actual number of bytes to in this message.
00770  * put_len - It is possible for PUTs to have a different length than the
00771  *           length stored in lntmsg->msg_len since LNET can adjust this
00772  *           length based on it's buffer size and offset.
00773  *           lnet_try_match_md() sets the mlength that we use to do the RDMA
00774  *           transfer.
00775  */
00776 static void
00777 kgnilnd_parse_lnet_rdma(lnet_msg_t *lntmsg, unsigned int *niov,
00778                         unsigned int *offset, unsigned int *nob,
00779                         lnet_kiov_t **kiov, int put_len)
00780 {
00781         /* GETs are weird, see kgnilnd_send */
00782         if (lntmsg->msg_type == LNET_MSG_GET) {
00783                 if ((lntmsg->msg_md->md_options & LNET_MD_KIOV) == 0) {
00784                         *kiov = NULL;
00785                 } else {
00786                         *kiov = lntmsg->msg_md->md_iov.kiov;
00787                 }
00788                 *niov = lntmsg->msg_md->md_niov;
00789                 *nob = lntmsg->msg_md->md_length;
00790                 *offset = 0;
00791         } else {
00792                 *kiov = lntmsg->msg_kiov;
00793                 *niov = lntmsg->msg_niov;
00794                 *nob = put_len;
00795                 *offset = lntmsg->msg_offset;
00796         }
00797 }
00798 
00799 static inline void
00800 kgnilnd_compute_rdma_cksum(kgn_tx_t *tx, int put_len)
00801 {
00802         unsigned int     niov, offset, nob;
00803         lnet_kiov_t     *kiov;
00804         lnet_msg_t      *lntmsg = tx->tx_lntmsg[0];
00805         int              dump_cksum = (*kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_checksum_dump > 1);
00806 
00807         GNITX_ASSERTF(tx, ((tx->tx_msg.gnm_type == GNILND_MSG_PUT_DONE) ||
00808                            (tx->tx_msg.gnm_type == GNILND_MSG_GET_DONE) ||
00809                            (tx->tx_msg.gnm_type == GNILND_MSG_PUT_DONE_REV) ||
00810                            (tx->tx_msg.gnm_type == GNILND_MSG_GET_DONE_REV) ||
00811                            (tx->tx_msg.gnm_type == GNILND_MSG_GET_ACK_REV) ||
00812                            (tx->tx_msg.gnm_type == GNILND_MSG_PUT_REQ_REV)),
00813                       "bad type %s", kgnilnd_msgtype2str(tx->tx_msg.gnm_type));
00814 
00815         if ((tx->tx_msg.gnm_type == GNILND_MSG_PUT_DONE_REV) ||
00816             (tx->tx_msg.gnm_type == GNILND_MSG_GET_DONE_REV)) {
00817                 tx->tx_msg.gnm_payload_cksum = 0;
00818                 return;
00819         }
00820         if (*kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_checksum < 3) {
00821                 tx->tx_msg.gnm_payload_cksum = 0;
00822                 return;
00823         }
00824 
00825         GNITX_ASSERTF(tx, lntmsg, "no LNet message!", NULL);
00826 
00827         kgnilnd_parse_lnet_rdma(lntmsg, &niov, &offset, &nob, &kiov,
00828                                 put_len);
00829 
00830         if (kiov != NULL) {
00831                 tx->tx_msg.gnm_payload_cksum = kgnilnd_cksum_kiov(niov, kiov, offset, nob, dump_cksum);
00832         } else {
00833                 tx->tx_msg.gnm_payload_cksum = kgnilnd_cksum(tx->tx_buffer, nob);
00834                 if (dump_cksum) {
00835                         kgnilnd_dump_blob(D_BUFFS, "peer RDMA payload", tx->tx_buffer, nob);
00836                 }
00837         }
00838 
00839         if (CFS_FAIL_CHECK(CFS_FAIL_GNI_SMSG_CKSUM3)) {
00840                 tx->tx_msg.gnm_payload_cksum += 0xd00d;
00841         }
00842 }
00843 
00844 /* kgnilnd_verify_rdma_cksum()
00845  * tx - PUT_DONE/GET_DONE matched tx.
00846  * rx_cksum - received checksum to compare against.
00847  * put_len - see kgnilnd_parse_lnet_rdma comments.
00848  */
00849 static inline int
00850 kgnilnd_verify_rdma_cksum(kgn_tx_t *tx, __u16 rx_cksum, int put_len)
00851 {
00852         int              rc = 0;
00853         __u16            cksum;
00854         unsigned int     niov, offset, nob;
00855         lnet_kiov_t     *kiov;
00856         lnet_msg_t      *lntmsg = tx->tx_lntmsg[0];
00857         int dump_on_err = *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_checksum_dump;
00858 
00859         /* we can only match certain requests */
00860         GNITX_ASSERTF(tx, ((tx->tx_msg.gnm_type == GNILND_MSG_GET_REQ) ||
00861                            (tx->tx_msg.gnm_type == GNILND_MSG_PUT_ACK) ||
00862                            (tx->tx_msg.gnm_type == GNILND_MSG_PUT_REQ_REV) ||
00863                            (tx->tx_msg.gnm_type == GNILND_MSG_GET_ACK_REV) ||
00864                            (tx->tx_msg.gnm_type == GNILND_MSG_GET_DONE_REV) ||
00865                            (tx->tx_msg.gnm_type == GNILND_MSG_PUT_DONE_REV)),
00866                       "bad type %s", kgnilnd_msgtype2str(tx->tx_msg.gnm_type));
00867 
00868         if ((tx->tx_msg.gnm_type == GNILND_MSG_PUT_REQ_REV) ||
00869             (tx->tx_msg.gnm_type == GNILND_MSG_GET_ACK_REV)) {
00870                 return 0;
00871         }
00872 
00873         if (rx_cksum == 0)  {
00874                 if (*kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_checksum >= 3) {
00875                         GNIDBG_MSG(D_WARNING, &tx->tx_msg,
00876                                    "no RDMA payload checksum when enabled");
00877                 }
00878                 return 0;
00879         }
00880 
00881         GNITX_ASSERTF(tx, lntmsg, "no LNet message!", NULL);
00882 
00883         kgnilnd_parse_lnet_rdma(lntmsg, &niov, &offset, &nob, &kiov, put_len);
00884 
00885         if (kiov != NULL) {
00886                 cksum = kgnilnd_cksum_kiov(niov, kiov, offset, nob, 0);
00887         } else {
00888                 cksum = kgnilnd_cksum(tx->tx_buffer, nob);
00889         }
00890 
00891         if (cksum != rx_cksum) {
00892                 GNIDBG_MSG(D_NETERROR, &tx->tx_msg,
00893                            "Bad RDMA payload checksum (%x expected %x); "
00894                            "kiov 0x%p niov %d nob %u offset %u",
00895                             cksum, rx_cksum, kiov, niov, nob, offset);
00896                 switch (dump_on_err) {
00897                 case 2:
00898                         if (kiov != NULL) {
00899                                 kgnilnd_cksum_kiov(niov, kiov, offset, nob, 1);
00900                         } else {
00901                                 kgnilnd_dump_blob(D_BUFFS, "RDMA payload",
00902                                                   tx->tx_buffer, nob);
00903                         }
00904                         /* fall through to dump log */
00905                 case 1:
00906                         libcfs_debug_dumplog();
00907                         break;
00908                 default:
00909                         break;
00910                 }
00911                 rc = -ENOKEY;
00912                 /* kgnilnd_check_fma_rx will close conn, kill tx with error */
00913         }
00914         return rc;
00915 }
00916 
00917 void
00918 kgnilnd_mem_add_map_list(kgn_device_t *dev, kgn_tx_t *tx)
00919 {
00920         int     bytes;
00921 
00922         GNITX_ASSERTF(tx, list_empty(&tx->tx_map_list),
00923                 "already mapped!", NULL);
00924 
00925         spin_lock(&dev->gnd_map_lock);
00926         switch (tx->tx_buftype) {
00927         default:
00928                 GNIDBG_TX(D_EMERG, tx,
00929                         "SOFTWARE BUG: invalid mapping %d", tx->tx_buftype);
00930                 spin_unlock(&dev->gnd_map_lock);
00931                 LBUG();
00932                 break;
00933 
00934         case GNILND_BUF_PHYS_MAPPED:
00935                 bytes = tx->tx_phys_npages * PAGE_SIZE;
00936                 dev->gnd_map_nphys++;
00937                 dev->gnd_map_physnop += tx->tx_phys_npages;
00938                 break;
00939 
00940         case GNILND_BUF_VIRT_MAPPED:
00941                 bytes = tx->tx_nob;
00942                 dev->gnd_map_nvirt++;
00943                 dev->gnd_map_virtnob += tx->tx_nob;
00944                 break;
00945         }
00946 
00947         if (tx->tx_msg.gnm_type == GNILND_MSG_PUT_ACK ||
00948             tx->tx_msg.gnm_type == GNILND_MSG_GET_REQ) {
00949                 atomic64_add(bytes, &dev->gnd_rdmaq_bytes_out);
00950                 GNIDBG_TX(D_NETTRACE, tx, "rdma ++ %d to "LPD64"",
00951                           bytes, atomic64_read(&dev->gnd_rdmaq_bytes_out));
00952         }
00953 
00954         atomic_inc(&dev->gnd_n_mdd);
00955         atomic64_add(bytes, &dev->gnd_nbytes_map);
00956 
00957         /* clear retrans to prevent any SMSG goofiness as that code uses the same counter */
00958         tx->tx_retrans = 0;
00959 
00960         /* we only get here in the valid cases */
00961         list_add_tail(&tx->tx_map_list, &dev->gnd_map_list);
00962         dev->gnd_map_version++;
00963         spin_unlock(&dev->gnd_map_lock);
00964 }
00965 
00966 void
00967 kgnilnd_mem_del_map_list(kgn_device_t *dev, kgn_tx_t *tx)
00968 {
00969         int     bytes;
00970 
00971         GNITX_ASSERTF(tx, !list_empty(&tx->tx_map_list),
00972                 "not mapped!", NULL);
00973         spin_lock(&dev->gnd_map_lock);
00974 
00975         switch (tx->tx_buftype) {
00976         default:
00977                 GNIDBG_TX(D_EMERG, tx,
00978                         "SOFTWARE BUG: invalid mapping %d", tx->tx_buftype);
00979                 spin_unlock(&dev->gnd_map_lock);
00980                 LBUG();
00981                 break;
00982 
00983         case GNILND_BUF_PHYS_UNMAPPED:
00984                 bytes = tx->tx_phys_npages * PAGE_SIZE;
00985                 dev->gnd_map_nphys--;
00986                 dev->gnd_map_physnop -= tx->tx_phys_npages;
00987                 break;
00988 
00989         case GNILND_BUF_VIRT_UNMAPPED:
00990                 bytes = tx->tx_nob;
00991                 dev->gnd_map_nvirt--;
00992                 dev->gnd_map_virtnob -= tx->tx_nob;
00993                 break;
00994         }
00995 
00996         if (tx->tx_msg.gnm_type == GNILND_MSG_PUT_ACK ||
00997             tx->tx_msg.gnm_type == GNILND_MSG_GET_REQ) {
00998                 atomic64_sub(bytes, &dev->gnd_rdmaq_bytes_out);
00999                 LASSERTF(atomic64_read(&dev->gnd_rdmaq_bytes_out) >= 0,
01000                          "bytes_out negative! %ld\n", atomic64_read(&dev->gnd_rdmaq_bytes_out));
01001                 GNIDBG_TX(D_NETTRACE, tx, "rdma -- %d to "LPD64"",
01002                           bytes, atomic64_read(&dev->gnd_rdmaq_bytes_out));
01003         }
01004 
01005         atomic_dec(&dev->gnd_n_mdd);
01006         atomic64_sub(bytes, &dev->gnd_nbytes_map);
01007 
01008         /* we only get here in the valid cases */
01009         list_del_init(&tx->tx_map_list);
01010         dev->gnd_map_version++;
01011         spin_unlock(&dev->gnd_map_lock);
01012 }
01013 
01014 int
01015 kgnilnd_map_buffer(kgn_tx_t *tx)
01016 {
01017         kgn_conn_t       *conn = tx->tx_conn;
01018         kgn_device_t     *dev = conn->gnc_device;
01019         __u32             flags = GNI_MEM_READWRITE;
01020         gni_return_t      rrc;
01021 
01022         /* The kgnilnd_mem_register(_segments) Gemini Driver functions can
01023          * be called concurrently as there are internal locks that protect
01024          * any data structures or HW resources. We just need to ensure
01025          * that our concurrency doesn't result in the kgn_device_t
01026          * getting nuked while we are in here */
01027 
01028         LASSERTF(conn != NULL, "tx %p with NULL conn, someone forgot"
01029                 " to set tx_conn before calling %s\n", tx, __FUNCTION__);
01030 
01031         if (unlikely(CFS_FAIL_CHECK(CFS_FAIL_GNI_MAP_TX)))
01032                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01033 
01034         if (*kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_bte_relaxed_ordering) {
01035                 flags |= GNI_MEM_RELAXED_PI_ORDERING;
01036         }
01037 
01038         switch (tx->tx_buftype) {
01039         default:
01040                 LBUG();
01041 
01042         case GNILND_BUF_NONE:
01043         case GNILND_BUF_IMMEDIATE:
01044         case GNILND_BUF_IMMEDIATE_KIOV:
01045         case GNILND_BUF_PHYS_MAPPED:
01046         case GNILND_BUF_VIRT_MAPPED:
01047                 return 0;
01048 
01049         case GNILND_BUF_PHYS_UNMAPPED:
01050                 GNITX_ASSERTF(tx, tx->tx_phys != NULL, "physical buffer not there!", NULL);
01051                 rrc = kgnilnd_mem_register_segments(dev->gnd_handle,
01052                         tx->tx_phys, tx->tx_phys_npages, NULL,
01053                         GNI_MEM_PHYS_SEGMENTS | flags,
01054                         &tx->tx_map_key);
01055                 /* could race with other uses of the map counts, but this is ok
01056                  * - this needs to turn into a non-fatal error soon to allow
01057                  *  GART resource, etc starvation handling */
01058                 if (rrc != GNI_RC_SUCCESS) {
01059                         GNIDBG_TX(D_NET, tx, "Can't map %d pages: dev %d "
01060                                 "phys %u pp %u, virt %u nob "LPU64"",
01061                                 tx->tx_phys_npages, dev->gnd_id,
01062                                 dev->gnd_map_nphys, dev->gnd_map_physnop,
01063                                 dev->gnd_map_nvirt, dev->gnd_map_virtnob);
01064                         RETURN(rrc == GNI_RC_ERROR_RESOURCE ? -ENOMEM : -EINVAL);
01065                 }
01066 
01067                 tx->tx_buftype = GNILND_BUF_PHYS_MAPPED;
01068                 kgnilnd_mem_add_map_list(dev, tx);
01069                 return 0;
01070 
01071         case GNILND_BUF_VIRT_UNMAPPED:
01072                 rrc = kgnilnd_mem_register(dev->gnd_handle,
01073                         (__u64)tx->tx_buffer, tx->tx_nob,
01074                         NULL, flags, &tx->tx_map_key);
01075                 if (rrc != GNI_RC_SUCCESS) {
01076                         GNIDBG_TX(D_NET, tx, "Can't map %u bytes: dev %d "
01077                                 "phys %u pp %u, virt %u nob "LPU64"",
01078                                 tx->tx_nob, dev->gnd_id,
01079                                 dev->gnd_map_nphys, dev->gnd_map_physnop,
01080                                 dev->gnd_map_nvirt, dev->gnd_map_virtnob);
01081                         RETURN(rrc == GNI_RC_ERROR_RESOURCE ? -ENOMEM : -EINVAL);
01082                 }
01083 
01084                 tx->tx_buftype = GNILND_BUF_VIRT_MAPPED;
01085                 kgnilnd_mem_add_map_list(dev, tx);
01086                 if (tx->tx_msg.gnm_type == GNILND_MSG_PUT_ACK ||
01087                     tx->tx_msg.gnm_type == GNILND_MSG_GET_REQ) {
01088                         atomic64_add(tx->tx_nob, &dev->gnd_rdmaq_bytes_out);
01089                         GNIDBG_TX(D_NETTRACE, tx, "rdma ++ %d to %ld\n",
01090                                tx->tx_nob, atomic64_read(&dev->gnd_rdmaq_bytes_out));
01091                 }
01092 
01093                 return 0;
01094         }
01095 }
01096 
01097 void
01098 kgnilnd_add_purgatory_tx(kgn_tx_t *tx)
01099 {
01100         kgn_conn_t              *conn = tx->tx_conn;
01101         kgn_mdd_purgatory_t     *gmp;
01102 
01103         LIBCFS_ALLOC(gmp, sizeof(*gmp));
01104         LASSERTF(gmp != NULL, "couldn't allocate MDD purgatory member;"
01105                 " asserting to avoid data corruption\n");
01106         if (tx->tx_buffer_copy)
01107                 gmp->gmp_map_key = tx->tx_buffer_copy_map_key;
01108         else
01109                 gmp->gmp_map_key = tx->tx_map_key;
01110 
01111         atomic_inc(&conn->gnc_device->gnd_n_mdd_held);
01112 
01113         /* ensure that we don't have a blank purgatory - indicating the
01114          * conn is not already on purgatory lists - we'd never recover these
01115          * MDD if that were the case */
01116         GNITX_ASSERTF(tx, conn->gnc_in_purgatory,
01117                 "conn 0x%p->%s with NULL purgatory",
01118                 conn, libcfs_nid2str(conn->gnc_peer->gnp_nid));
01119 
01120         /* link 'er up! - only place we really need to lock for
01121          * concurrent access */
01122         spin_lock(&conn->gnc_list_lock);
01123         list_add_tail(&gmp->gmp_list, &conn->gnc_mdd_list);
01124         spin_unlock(&conn->gnc_list_lock);
01125 }
01126 
01127 void
01128 kgnilnd_unmap_buffer(kgn_tx_t *tx, int error)
01129 {
01130         kgn_device_t     *dev;
01131         gni_return_t      rrc;
01132         int               hold_timeout = 0;
01133 
01134         /* code below relies on +1 relationship ... */
01135         CLASSERT(GNILND_BUF_PHYS_MAPPED == (GNILND_BUF_PHYS_UNMAPPED + 1));
01136         CLASSERT(GNILND_BUF_VIRT_MAPPED == (GNILND_BUF_VIRT_UNMAPPED + 1));
01137 
01138         switch (tx->tx_buftype) {
01139         default:
01140                 LBUG();
01141 
01142         case GNILND_BUF_NONE:
01143         case GNILND_BUF_IMMEDIATE:
01144         case GNILND_BUF_PHYS_UNMAPPED:
01145         case GNILND_BUF_VIRT_UNMAPPED:
01146                 break;
01147         case GNILND_BUF_IMMEDIATE_KIOV:
01148                 if (tx->tx_phys != NULL) {
01149                         vunmap(tx->tx_phys);
01150                 } else if (tx->tx_phys == NULL && tx->tx_buffer != NULL) {
01151                         kunmap(tx->tx_imm_pages[0]);
01152                 }
01153                 /* clear to prevent kgnilnd_free_tx from thinking
01154                  * this is a RDMA descriptor */
01155                 tx->tx_phys = NULL;
01156                 break;
01157 
01158         case GNILND_BUF_PHYS_MAPPED:
01159         case GNILND_BUF_VIRT_MAPPED:
01160                 LASSERT(tx->tx_conn != NULL);
01161 
01162                 dev = tx->tx_conn->gnc_device;
01163 
01164                 /* only want to hold if we are closing conn without
01165                  * verified peer notification  - the theory is that
01166                  * a TX error can be communicated in all other cases */
01167                 if (tx->tx_conn->gnc_state != GNILND_CONN_ESTABLISHED &&
01168                     error != -GNILND_NOPURG &&
01169                     kgnilnd_check_purgatory_conn(tx->tx_conn)) {
01170                         kgnilnd_add_purgatory_tx(tx);
01171 
01172                         /* The timeout we give to kgni is a deadman stop only.
01173                          *  we are setting high to ensure we don't have the kgni timer
01174                          *  fire before ours fires _and_ is handled */
01175                         hold_timeout = GNILND_TIMEOUT2DEADMAN;
01176 
01177                         GNIDBG_TX(D_NET, tx,
01178                                  "dev %p delaying MDD release for %dms key "LPX64"."LPX64"",
01179                                  tx->tx_conn->gnc_device, hold_timeout,
01180                                  tx->tx_map_key.qword1, tx->tx_map_key.qword2);
01181                 }
01182                 if (tx->tx_buffer_copy != NULL) {
01183                         rrc = kgnilnd_mem_deregister(dev->gnd_handle, &tx->tx_buffer_copy_map_key, hold_timeout);
01184                         LASSERTF(rrc == GNI_RC_SUCCESS, "rrc %d\n", rrc);
01185                         rrc = kgnilnd_mem_deregister(dev->gnd_handle, &tx->tx_map_key, 0);
01186                         LASSERTF(rrc == GNI_RC_SUCCESS, "rrc %d\n", rrc);
01187                 } else {
01188                         rrc = kgnilnd_mem_deregister(dev->gnd_handle, &tx->tx_map_key, hold_timeout);
01189                         LASSERTF(rrc == GNI_RC_SUCCESS, "rrc %d\n", rrc);
01190                 }
01191 
01192                 tx->tx_buftype--;
01193                 kgnilnd_mem_del_map_list(dev, tx);
01194                 break;
01195         }
01196 }
01197 
01198 void
01199 kgnilnd_tx_done(kgn_tx_t *tx, int completion)
01200 {
01201         lnet_msg_t      *lntmsg0, *lntmsg1;
01202         int             status0, status1;
01203         lnet_ni_t       *ni = NULL;
01204         kgn_conn_t      *conn = tx->tx_conn;
01205 
01206         LASSERT(!in_interrupt());
01207 
01208         lntmsg0 = tx->tx_lntmsg[0]; tx->tx_lntmsg[0] = NULL;
01209         lntmsg1 = tx->tx_lntmsg[1]; tx->tx_lntmsg[1] = NULL;
01210 
01211         if (completion &&
01212             !(tx->tx_state & GNILND_TX_QUIET_ERROR) &&
01213             !kgnilnd_conn_clean_errno(completion)) {
01214                 GNIDBG_TOMSG(D_NETERROR, &tx->tx_msg,
01215                        "error %d on tx 0x%p->%s id %u/%d state %s age %ds",
01216                        completion, tx, conn ?
01217                        libcfs_nid2str(conn->gnc_peer->gnp_nid) : "<?>",
01218                        tx->tx_id.txe_smsg_id, tx->tx_id.txe_idx,
01219                        kgnilnd_tx_state2str(tx->tx_list_state),
01220                        cfs_duration_sec((unsigned long)jiffies - tx->tx_qtime));
01221         }
01222 
01223         /* The error codes determine if we hold onto the MDD */
01224         kgnilnd_unmap_buffer(tx, completion);
01225 
01226         /* we have to deliver a reply on lntmsg[1] for the GET, so make sure
01227          * we play nice with the error codes to avoid delivering a failed
01228          * REQUEST and then a REPLY event as well */
01229 
01230         /* return -EIO to lnet - it is the magic value for failed sends */
01231         if (tx->tx_msg.gnm_type == GNILND_MSG_GET_REQ) {
01232                 status0 = 0;
01233                 status1 = completion;
01234         } else {
01235                 status0 = status1 = completion;
01236         }
01237 
01238         tx->tx_buftype = GNILND_BUF_NONE;
01239         tx->tx_msg.gnm_type = GNILND_MSG_NONE;
01240 
01241         /* lnet_finalize doesn't do anything with the *ni, so ok for us to
01242          * set NULL when we are a tx without a conn */
01243         if (conn != NULL) {
01244                 ni = conn->gnc_peer->gnp_net->gnn_ni;
01245 
01246                 spin_lock(&conn->gnc_tx_lock);
01247 
01248                 LASSERTF(test_and_clear_bit(tx->tx_id.txe_idx,
01249                         (volatile unsigned long *)&conn->gnc_tx_bits),
01250                         "conn %p tx %p bit %d already cleared\n",
01251                         conn, tx, tx->tx_id.txe_idx);
01252 
01253                 LASSERTF(conn->gnc_tx_ref_table[tx->tx_id.txe_idx] != NULL,
01254                          "msg_id %d already NULL\n", tx->tx_id.txe_idx);
01255 
01256                 conn->gnc_tx_ref_table[tx->tx_id.txe_idx] = NULL;
01257                 spin_unlock(&conn->gnc_tx_lock);
01258         }
01259 
01260         kgnilnd_free_tx(tx);
01261 
01262         /* finalize AFTER freeing lnet msgs */
01263 
01264         /* warning - we should hold no locks here - calling lnet_finalize
01265          * could free up lnet credits, resulting in a call chain back into
01266          * the LND via kgnilnd_send and friends */
01267 
01268         lnet_finalize(ni, lntmsg0, status0);
01269 
01270         if (lntmsg1 != NULL) {
01271                 lnet_finalize(ni, lntmsg1, status1);
01272         }
01273 }
01274 
01275 void
01276 kgnilnd_txlist_done(struct list_head *txlist, int error)
01277 {
01278         kgn_tx_t        *tx, *txn;
01279         int              err_printed = 0;
01280 
01281         if (list_empty(txlist))
01282                 return;
01283 
01284         list_for_each_entry_safe(tx, txn, txlist, tx_list) {
01285                 /* only print the first error */
01286                 if (err_printed)
01287                         tx->tx_state |= GNILND_TX_QUIET_ERROR;
01288                 list_del_init(&tx->tx_list);
01289                 kgnilnd_tx_done(tx, error);
01290                 err_printed++;
01291         }
01292 }
01293 int
01294 kgnilnd_set_tx_id(kgn_tx_t *tx, kgn_conn_t *conn)
01295 {
01296         int     id;
01297 
01298         spin_lock(&conn->gnc_tx_lock);
01299 
01300         /* ID zero is NOT ALLOWED!!! */
01301 
01302 search_again:
01303         id = find_next_zero_bit((unsigned long *)&conn->gnc_tx_bits,
01304                                  GNILND_MAX_MSG_ID, conn->gnc_next_tx);
01305         if (id == GNILND_MAX_MSG_ID) {
01306                 if (conn->gnc_next_tx != 1) {
01307                         /* we only searched from next_tx to end and didn't find
01308                          * one, so search again from start */
01309                         conn->gnc_next_tx = 1;
01310                         goto search_again;
01311                 }
01312                 /* couldn't find one! */
01313                 spin_unlock(&conn->gnc_tx_lock);
01314                 return -E2BIG;
01315         }
01316 
01317         /* bump next_tx to prevent immediate reuse */
01318         conn->gnc_next_tx = id + 1;
01319 
01320         set_bit(id, (volatile unsigned long *)&conn->gnc_tx_bits);
01321         LASSERTF(conn->gnc_tx_ref_table[id] == NULL,
01322                  "tx 0x%p already at id %d\n",
01323                  conn->gnc_tx_ref_table[id], id);
01324 
01325         /* delay these until we have a valid ID - prevents bad clear of the bit
01326          * in kgnilnd_tx_done */
01327         tx->tx_conn = conn;
01328         tx->tx_id.txe_cqid = conn->gnc_cqid;
01329 
01330         tx->tx_id.txe_idx = id;
01331         conn->gnc_tx_ref_table[id] = tx;
01332 
01333         /* Using jiffies to help differentiate against TX reuse - with
01334          * the usual minimum of a 250HZ clock, we wrap jiffies on the same TX
01335          * if we are sending to the same node faster than 256000/sec.
01336          * To help guard against this, we OR in the tx_seq - that is 32 bits */
01337 
01338         tx->tx_id.txe_chips = (__u32)(jiffies | atomic_read(&conn->gnc_tx_seq));
01339 
01340         GNIDBG_TX(D_NET, tx, "set cookie/id/bits", NULL);
01341 
01342         spin_unlock(&conn->gnc_tx_lock);
01343         return 0;
01344 }
01345 
01346 static inline int
01347 kgnilnd_tx_should_retry(kgn_conn_t *conn, kgn_tx_t *tx)
01348 {
01349         int             max_retrans = *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_max_retransmits;
01350         int             log_retrans;
01351         int             log_retrans_level;
01352 
01353         /* I need kgni credits to send this.  Replace tx at the head of the
01354          * fmaq and I'll get rescheduled when credits appear */
01355         tx->tx_state = 0;
01356         tx->tx_retrans++;
01357         conn->gnc_tx_retrans++;
01358         log_retrans = ((tx->tx_retrans < 25) || ((tx->tx_retrans % 25) == 0) ||
01359                         (tx->tx_retrans > (max_retrans / 2)));
01360         log_retrans_level = tx->tx_retrans < (max_retrans / 2) ? D_NET : D_NETERROR;
01361 
01362         /* Decision time - either error, warn or just retransmit */
01363 
01364         /* we don't care about TX timeout - it could be that the network is slower
01365          * or throttled. We'll keep retranmitting - so if the network is so slow
01366          * that we fill up our mailbox, we'll keep trying to resend that msg
01367          * until we exceed the max_retrans _or_ gnc_last_rx expires, indicating
01368          * that he hasn't send us any traffic in return */
01369 
01370         if (tx->tx_retrans > max_retrans) {
01371                 /* this means we are not backing off the retransmits
01372                  * in a healthy manner and are likely chewing up the
01373                  * CPU cycles quite badly */
01374                 GNIDBG_TOMSG(D_ERROR, &tx->tx_msg,
01375                         "SOFTWARE BUG: too many retransmits (%d) for tx id %x "
01376                         "conn 0x%p->%s\n",
01377                         tx->tx_retrans, tx->tx_id, conn,
01378                         libcfs_nid2str(conn->gnc_peer->gnp_nid));
01379 
01380                 /* yes - double errors to help debug this condition */
01381                 GNIDBG_TOMSG(D_NETERROR, &tx->tx_msg, "connection dead. "
01382                         "unable to send to %s for %lu secs (%d tries)",
01383                         libcfs_nid2str(tx->tx_conn->gnc_peer->gnp_nid),
01384                         cfs_duration_sec(jiffies - tx->tx_cred_wait),
01385                         tx->tx_retrans);
01386 
01387                 kgnilnd_close_conn(conn, -ETIMEDOUT);
01388 
01389                 /* caller should terminate */
01390                 RETURN(0);
01391         } else {
01392                 /* some reasonable throttling of the debug message */
01393                 if (log_retrans) {
01394                         unsigned long now = jiffies;
01395                         /* XXX Nic: Mystical TX debug here... */
01396                         GNIDBG_SMSG_CREDS(log_retrans_level, conn);
01397                         GNIDBG_TOMSG(log_retrans_level, &tx->tx_msg,
01398                                 "NOT_DONE on conn 0x%p->%s id %x retrans %d wait %dus"
01399                                 " last_msg %uus/%uus last_cq %uus/%uus",
01400                                 conn, libcfs_nid2str(conn->gnc_peer->gnp_nid),
01401                                 tx->tx_id, tx->tx_retrans,
01402                                 jiffies_to_usecs(now - tx->tx_cred_wait),
01403                                 jiffies_to_usecs(now - conn->gnc_last_tx),
01404                                 jiffies_to_usecs(now - conn->gnc_last_rx),
01405                                 jiffies_to_usecs(now - conn->gnc_last_tx_cq),
01406                                 jiffies_to_usecs(now - conn->gnc_last_rx_cq));
01407                 }
01408                 /* caller should retry */
01409                 RETURN(1);
01410         }
01411 }
01412 
01413 /* caller must be holding gnd_cq_mutex and not unlock it afterwards, as we need to drop it
01414  * to avoid bad ordering with state_lock */
01415 
01416 static inline int
01417 kgnilnd_sendmsg_nolock(kgn_tx_t *tx, void *immediate, unsigned int immediatenob,
01418                 spinlock_t *state_lock, kgn_tx_list_state_t state)
01419 {
01420         kgn_conn_t      *conn = tx->tx_conn;
01421         kgn_msg_t       *msg = &tx->tx_msg;
01422         int              retry_send;
01423         gni_return_t     rrc;
01424         unsigned long    newest_last_rx, timeout;
01425         unsigned long    now;
01426 
01427         LASSERTF((msg->gnm_type == GNILND_MSG_IMMEDIATE) ?
01428                 immediatenob <= *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_max_immediate :
01429                 immediatenob == 0,
01430                 "msg 0x%p type %d wrong payload size %d\n",
01431                 msg, msg->gnm_type, immediatenob);
01432 
01433         /* make sure we catch all the cases where we'd send on a dirty old mbox
01434          * but allow case for sending CLOSE. Since this check is within the CQ
01435          * mutex barrier and the close message is only sent through
01436          * kgnilnd_send_conn_close the last message out the door will be the
01437          * close message.
01438          */
01439         if (atomic_read(&conn->gnc_peer->gnp_dirty_eps) != 0 && msg->gnm_type != GNILND_MSG_CLOSE) {
01440                 kgnilnd_conn_mutex_unlock(&conn->gnc_smsg_mutex);
01441                 kgnilnd_gl_mutex_unlock(&conn->gnc_device->gnd_cq_mutex);
01442                 /* Return -ETIME, we are closing the connection already so we dont want to
01443                  * have this tx hit the wire. The tx will be killed by the calling function.
01444                  * Once the EP is marked dirty the close message will be the last
01445                  * thing to hit the wire */
01446                 return -ETIME;
01447         }
01448 
01449         now = jiffies;
01450         timeout = cfs_time_seconds(conn->gnc_timeout);
01451 
01452         newest_last_rx = GNILND_LASTRX(conn);
01453 
01454         if (CFS_FAIL_CHECK(CFS_FAIL_GNI_SEND_TIMEOUT)) {
01455                 now = now + (GNILND_TIMEOUTRX(timeout) * 2);
01456         }
01457 
01458         if (time_after_eq(now, newest_last_rx + GNILND_TIMEOUTRX(timeout))) {
01459                 GNIDBG_CONN(D_NETERROR|D_CONSOLE, conn,
01460                             "Cant send to %s after timeout lapse of %lu; TO %lu\n",
01461                 libcfs_nid2str(conn->gnc_peer->gnp_nid),
01462                 cfs_duration_sec(now - newest_last_rx),
01463                 cfs_duration_sec(GNILND_TIMEOUTRX(timeout)));
01464                 kgnilnd_conn_mutex_unlock(&conn->gnc_smsg_mutex);
01465                 kgnilnd_gl_mutex_unlock(&conn->gnc_device->gnd_cq_mutex);
01466                 return -ETIME;
01467         }
01468 
01469         GNITX_ASSERTF(tx, (conn != NULL) && (tx->tx_id.txe_idx != 0), "tx id unset!", NULL);
01470         /* msg->gnm_srcnid is set when the message is initialized by whatever function is
01471          * creating the message this allows the message to contain the correct LNET NID/NET needed
01472          * instead of the one that the peer/conn uses for sending the data.
01473          */
01474         msg->gnm_connstamp = conn->gnc_my_connstamp;
01475         msg->gnm_payload_len = immediatenob;
01476         msg->gnm_seq = atomic_read(&conn->gnc_tx_seq);
01477 
01478         /* always init here - kgn_checksum is a /sys module tunable
01479          * and can be flipped at any point, even between msg init and sending */
01480         msg->gnm_cksum = 0;
01481         if (*kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_checksum) {
01482                 /* We must set here and not in kgnilnd_init_msg,
01483                  * we could resend this msg many times
01484                  * (NOT_DONE from gni_smsg_send below) and wouldn't pass
01485                  * through init_msg again */
01486                 msg->gnm_cksum = kgnilnd_cksum(msg, sizeof(kgn_msg_t));
01487                 if (CFS_FAIL_CHECK(CFS_FAIL_GNI_SMSG_CKSUM1)) {
01488                         msg->gnm_cksum += 0xf00f;
01489                 }
01490         }
01491 
01492         GNIDBG_TOMSG(D_NET, msg, "tx 0x%p conn 0x%p->%s sending SMSG sz %u id %x/%d [%p for %u]",
01493                tx, conn, libcfs_nid2str(conn->gnc_peer->gnp_nid),
01494                sizeof(kgn_msg_t), tx->tx_id.txe_smsg_id,
01495                tx->tx_id.txe_idx, immediate, immediatenob);
01496 
01497         if (unlikely(tx->tx_state & GNILND_TX_FAIL_SMSG)) {
01498                 rrc = cfs_fail_val ? cfs_fail_val : GNI_RC_NOT_DONE;
01499         } else {
01500                 rrc = kgnilnd_smsg_send(conn->gnc_ephandle,
01501                                         msg, sizeof(*msg), immediate,
01502                                         immediatenob,
01503                                         tx->tx_id.txe_smsg_id);
01504         }
01505 
01506         switch (rrc) {
01507         case GNI_RC_SUCCESS:
01508                 atomic_inc(&conn->gnc_tx_seq);
01509                 conn->gnc_last_tx = jiffies;
01510                 /* no locking here as LIVE isn't a list */
01511                 kgnilnd_tx_add_state_locked(tx, NULL, conn, GNILND_TX_LIVE_FMAQ, 1);
01512 
01513                 /* this needs to be checked under lock as it might be freed from a completion
01514                  * event.
01515                  */
01516                 if (msg->gnm_type == GNILND_MSG_NOOP) {
01517                         set_mb(conn->gnc_last_noop_sent, jiffies);
01518                 }
01519 
01520                 /* serialize with seeing CQ events for completion on this, as well as
01521                  * tx_seq */
01522                 kgnilnd_conn_mutex_unlock(&conn->gnc_smsg_mutex);
01523                 kgnilnd_gl_mutex_unlock(&conn->gnc_device->gnd_cq_mutex);
01524 
01525                 atomic_inc(&conn->gnc_device->gnd_short_ntx);
01526                 atomic64_add(immediatenob, &conn->gnc_device->gnd_short_txbytes);
01527                 kgnilnd_peer_alive(conn->gnc_peer);
01528                 GNIDBG_SMSG_CREDS(D_NET, conn);
01529                 return 0;
01530 
01531         case GNI_RC_NOT_DONE:
01532                 /* XXX Nic: We need to figure out how to track this
01533                  * - there are bound to be good reasons for it,
01534                  * but we want to know when it happens */
01535                 kgnilnd_conn_mutex_unlock(&conn->gnc_smsg_mutex);
01536                 kgnilnd_gl_mutex_unlock(&conn->gnc_device->gnd_cq_mutex);
01537                 /* We'll handle this error inline - makes the calling logic much more
01538                  * clean */
01539 
01540                 /* If no lock, caller doesn't want us to retry */
01541                 if (state_lock == NULL) {
01542                         return -EAGAIN;
01543                 }
01544 
01545                 retry_send = kgnilnd_tx_should_retry(conn, tx);
01546                 if (retry_send) {
01547                         /* add to head of list for the state and retries */
01548                         spin_lock(state_lock);
01549                         kgnilnd_tx_add_state_locked(tx, conn->gnc_peer, conn, state, 0);
01550                         spin_unlock(state_lock);
01551 
01552                         /* We only reschedule for a certain number of retries, then
01553                          * we will wait for the CQ events indicating a release of SMSG
01554                          * credits */
01555                         if (tx->tx_retrans < (*kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_max_retransmits/4)) {
01556                                 kgnilnd_schedule_conn(conn);
01557                                 return 0;
01558                         } else {
01559                                 /* CQ event coming in signifies either TX completed or
01560                                  * RX receive. Either of these *could* free up credits
01561                                  * in the SMSG mbox and we should try sending again */
01562                                 GNIDBG_TX(D_NET, tx, "waiting for CQID %u event to resend",
01563                                          tx->tx_conn->gnc_cqid);
01564                                 /* use +ve return code to let upper layers know they
01565                                  * should stop looping on sends */
01566                                 return EAGAIN;
01567                         }
01568                 } else {
01569                         return -EAGAIN;
01570                 }
01571         default:
01572                 /* handle bad retcode gracefully */
01573                 kgnilnd_conn_mutex_unlock(&conn->gnc_smsg_mutex);
01574                 kgnilnd_gl_mutex_unlock(&conn->gnc_device->gnd_cq_mutex);
01575                 return -EIO;
01576         }
01577 }
01578 
01579 /* kgnilnd_sendmsg has hard wait on gnd_cq_mutex */
01580 static inline int
01581 kgnilnd_sendmsg(kgn_tx_t *tx, void *immediate, unsigned int immediatenob,
01582                 spinlock_t *state_lock, kgn_tx_list_state_t state)
01583 {
01584         kgn_device_t    *dev = tx->tx_conn->gnc_device;
01585         unsigned long    timestamp;
01586         int              rc;
01587 
01588         timestamp = jiffies;
01589         kgnilnd_gl_mutex_lock(&dev->gnd_cq_mutex);
01590         kgnilnd_conn_mutex_lock(&tx->tx_conn->gnc_smsg_mutex);
01591         /* delay in jiffies - we are really concerned only with things that
01592          * result in a schedule() or really holding this off for long times .
01593          * NB - mutex_lock could spin for 2 jiffies before going to sleep to wait */
01594         dev->gnd_mutex_delay += (long) jiffies - timestamp;
01595 
01596         rc = kgnilnd_sendmsg_nolock(tx, immediate, immediatenob, state_lock, state);
01597 
01598         RETURN(rc);
01599 }
01600 
01601 
01602 /* returns -EAGAIN for lock miss, anything else < 0 is hard error, >=0 for success */
01603 static inline int
01604 kgnilnd_sendmsg_trylock(kgn_tx_t *tx, void *immediate, unsigned int immediatenob,
01605                 spinlock_t *state_lock, kgn_tx_list_state_t state)
01606 {
01607         kgn_conn_t      *conn = tx->tx_conn;
01608         kgn_device_t    *dev = conn->gnc_device;
01609         unsigned long    timestamp;
01610         int              rc;
01611 
01612         timestamp = jiffies;
01613 
01614         /* technically we are doing bad things with the read_lock on the peer_conn
01615          * table, but we shouldn't be sleeping inside here - and we don't sleep/block
01616          * for the mutex. I bet lockdep is gonna flag this one though... */
01617 
01618         /* there are a few cases where we don't want the immediate send - like
01619          * when we are in the scheduler thread and it'd harm the latency of
01620          * getting messages up to LNet */
01621 
01622         /* rmb for gnd_ready */
01623         smp_rmb();
01624         if (conn->gnc_device->gnd_ready == GNILND_DEV_LOOP) {
01625                 rc = 0;
01626                 atomic_inc(&conn->gnc_device->gnd_fast_block);
01627         } else if (unlikely(kgnilnd_data.kgn_quiesce_trigger)) {
01628                /* dont hit HW during quiesce */
01629                 rc = 0;
01630         } else if (unlikely(atomic_read(&conn->gnc_peer->gnp_dirty_eps))) {
01631                /* dont hit HW if stale EPs and conns left to close */
01632                 rc = 0;
01633         } else {
01634                 atomic_inc(&conn->gnc_device->gnd_fast_try);
01635                 rc = kgnilnd_trylock(&conn->gnc_device->gnd_cq_mutex,
01636                                      &conn->gnc_smsg_mutex);
01637         }
01638         if (!rc) {
01639                 rc = -EAGAIN;
01640         } else {
01641                 /* we got the mutex and weren't blocked */
01642 
01643                 /* delay in jiffies - we are really concerned only with things that
01644                  * result in a schedule() or really holding this off for long times .
01645                  * NB - mutex_lock could spin for 2 jiffies before going to sleep to wait */
01646                 dev->gnd_mutex_delay += (long) jiffies - timestamp;
01647 
01648                 atomic_inc(&conn->gnc_device->gnd_fast_ok);
01649                 tx->tx_qtime = jiffies;
01650                 tx->tx_state = GNILND_TX_WAITING_COMPLETION;
01651                 rc = kgnilnd_sendmsg_nolock(tx, tx->tx_buffer, tx->tx_nob, &conn->gnc_list_lock, GNILND_TX_FMAQ);
01652                 /* _nolock unlocks the mutex for us */
01653         }
01654 
01655         RETURN(rc);
01656 }
01657 
01658 /* lets us know if we can push this RDMA through now */
01659 inline int
01660 kgnilnd_auth_rdma_bytes(kgn_device_t *dev, kgn_tx_t *tx)
01661 {
01662         long    bytes_left;
01663 
01664         bytes_left = atomic64_sub_return(tx->tx_nob, &dev->gnd_rdmaq_bytes_ok);
01665 
01666         if (bytes_left < 0) {
01667                 atomic64_add(tx->tx_nob, &dev->gnd_rdmaq_bytes_ok);
01668                 atomic_inc(&dev->gnd_rdmaq_nstalls);
01669                 smp_wmb();
01670 
01671                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "no bytes to send, turning on timer for %lu\n",
01672                        dev->gnd_rdmaq_deadline);
01673                 mod_timer(&dev->gnd_rdmaq_timer, dev->gnd_rdmaq_deadline);
01674                 /* we never del this timer - at worst it schedules us.. */
01675                 return -EAGAIN;
01676         } else {
01677                 return 0;
01678         }
01679 }
01680 
01681 /* this adds a TX to the queue pending throttling authorization before
01682  * we allow our remote peer to launch a PUT at us */
01683 void
01684 kgnilnd_queue_rdma(kgn_conn_t *conn, kgn_tx_t *tx)
01685 {
01686         int     rc;
01687 
01688         /* we cannot go into send_mapped_tx from here as we are holding locks
01689          * and mem registration might end up allocating memory in kgni.
01690          * That said, we'll push this as far as we can into the queue process */
01691         rc = kgnilnd_auth_rdma_bytes(conn->gnc_device, tx);
01692 
01693         if (rc < 0) {
01694                 spin_lock(&conn->gnc_device->gnd_rdmaq_lock);
01695                 kgnilnd_tx_add_state_locked(tx, NULL, conn, GNILND_TX_RDMAQ, 0);
01696                 /* lets us know how delayed RDMA is */
01697                 tx->tx_qtime = jiffies;
01698                 spin_unlock(&conn->gnc_device->gnd_rdmaq_lock);
01699         } else {
01700                 /* we have RDMA authorized, now it just needs a MDD and to hit the wire */
01701                 spin_lock(&tx->tx_conn->gnc_device->gnd_lock);
01702                 kgnilnd_tx_add_state_locked(tx, NULL, tx->tx_conn, GNILND_TX_MAPQ, 0);
01703                 /* lets us know how delayed mapping is */
01704                 tx->tx_qtime = jiffies;
01705                 spin_unlock(&tx->tx_conn->gnc_device->gnd_lock);
01706         }
01707 
01708         /* make sure we wake up sched to run this */
01709         kgnilnd_schedule_device(tx->tx_conn->gnc_device);
01710 }
01711 
01712 /* push TX through state machine */
01713 void
01714 kgnilnd_queue_tx(kgn_conn_t *conn, kgn_tx_t *tx)
01715 {
01716         int            rc = 0;
01717         int            add_tail = 1;
01718 
01719         /* set the tx_id here, we delay it until we have an actual conn
01720          * to fiddle with
01721          * in some cases, the tx_id is already set to provide for things
01722          * like RDMA completion cookies, etc */
01723         if (tx->tx_id.txe_idx == 0) {
01724                 rc = kgnilnd_set_tx_id(tx, conn);
01725                 if (rc != 0) {
01726                         kgnilnd_tx_done(tx, rc);
01727                         return;
01728                 }
01729         }
01730 
01731         CDEBUG(D_NET, "%s to conn %p for %s\n", kgnilnd_msgtype2str(tx->tx_msg.gnm_type),
01732                 conn, libcfs_nid2str(conn->gnc_peer->gnp_nid));
01733 
01734         /* Only let NOOPs to be sent while fail loc is set, otherwise kill the tx.
01735          */
01736         if (CFS_FAIL_CHECK(CFS_FAIL_GNI_ONLY_NOOP) && (tx->tx_msg.gnm_type != GNILND_MSG_NOOP)) {
01737                 kgnilnd_tx_done(tx, rc);
01738                 return;
01739         }
01740 
01741         switch (tx->tx_msg.gnm_type) {
01742         case GNILND_MSG_PUT_ACK:
01743         case GNILND_MSG_GET_REQ:
01744         case GNILND_MSG_PUT_REQ_REV:
01745         case GNILND_MSG_GET_ACK_REV:
01746                 /* hijacking time! If this messages will authorize our peer to
01747                  * send his dirty little bytes in an RDMA, we need to get permission */
01748                 kgnilnd_queue_rdma(conn, tx);
01749                 break;
01750         case GNILND_MSG_IMMEDIATE:
01751                 /* try to send right now, can help reduce latency */
01752                 rc = kgnilnd_sendmsg_trylock(tx, tx->tx_buffer, tx->tx_nob, &conn->gnc_list_lock, GNILND_TX_FMAQ);
01753 
01754                 if (rc >= 0) {
01755                         /* it was sent, break out of switch to avoid default case of queueing */
01756                         break;
01757                 }
01758                 /* needs to queue to try again, so fall through to default case */
01759         case GNILND_MSG_NOOP:
01760                 /* Just make sure this goes out first for this conn */
01761                 add_tail = 0;
01762                 /* fall through... */
01763         default:
01764                 spin_lock(&conn->gnc_list_lock);
01765                 kgnilnd_tx_add_state_locked(tx, conn->gnc_peer, conn, GNILND_TX_FMAQ, add_tail);
01766                 tx->tx_qtime = jiffies;
01767                 spin_unlock(&conn->gnc_list_lock);
01768                 kgnilnd_schedule_conn(conn);
