01769         }
01770 }
01771 
01772 void
01773 kgnilnd_launch_tx(kgn_tx_t *tx, kgn_net_t *net, lnet_process_id_t *target)
01774 {
01775         kgn_peer_t      *peer;
01776         kgn_peer_t      *new_peer = NULL;
01777         kgn_conn_t      *conn = NULL;
01778         int              rc;
01779         int              node_state;
01780 
01781         ENTRY;
01782 
01783         /* If I get here, I've committed to send, so I complete the tx with
01784          * failure on any problems */
01785 
01786         GNITX_ASSERTF(tx, tx->tx_conn == NULL,
01787                       "tx already has connection %p", tx->tx_conn);
01788 
01789         /* do all of the peer & conn searching in one swoop - this avoids
01790          * nastiness when dropping locks and needing to maintain a sane state
01791          * in the face of stack reset or something else nuking peers & conns */
01792 
01793         /* I expect to find him, so only take a read lock */
01794         read_lock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
01795 
01796         peer = kgnilnd_find_peer_locked(target->nid);
01797         if (peer != NULL) {
01798                 conn = kgnilnd_find_conn_locked(peer);
01799                 /* this could be NULL during quiesce */
01800                 if (conn != NULL)  {
01801                         /* Connection exists; queue message on it */
01802                         kgnilnd_queue_tx(conn, tx);
01803                         read_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
01804                         RETURN_EXIT;
01805                 }
01806 
01807                 /* don't create a connection if the peer is marked down */
01808                 if (peer->gnp_down == GNILND_RCA_NODE_DOWN) {
01809                         read_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
01810                         rc = -ENETRESET;
01811                         GOTO(no_peer, rc);
01812                 }
01813         }
01814 
01815         /* creating peer or conn; I'll need a write lock... */
01816         read_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
01817 
01818         CFS_RACE(CFS_FAIL_GNI_FIND_TARGET);
01819 
01820         node_state = kgnilnd_get_node_state(LNET_NIDADDR(target->nid));
01821 
01822         /* NB - this will not block during normal operations -
01823          * the only writer of this is in the startup/shutdown path. */
01824         rc = down_read_trylock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_net_rw_sem);
01825         if (!rc) {
01826                 rc = -ESHUTDOWN;
01827                 GOTO(no_peer, rc);
01828         }
01829 
01830         /* ignore previous peer entirely - we cycled the lock, so we
01831          * will create new peer and at worst drop it if peer is still
01832          * in the tables */
01833         rc = kgnilnd_create_peer_safe(&new_peer, target->nid, net, node_state);
01834         if (rc != 0) {
01835                 up_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_net_rw_sem);
01836                 GOTO(no_peer, rc);
01837         }
01838 
01839         write_lock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
01840         up_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_net_rw_sem);
01841 
01842         /* search for peer again now that we have the lock
01843          * if we don't find it, add our new one to the list */
01844         kgnilnd_add_peer_locked(target->nid, new_peer, &peer);
01845 
01846         /* don't create a connection if the peer is not up */
01847         if (peer->gnp_down != GNILND_RCA_NODE_UP) {
01848                 write_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
01849                 rc = -ENETRESET;
01850                 GOTO(no_peer, rc);
01851         }
01852 
01853         conn = kgnilnd_find_or_create_conn_locked(peer);
01854 
01855         if (CFS_FAIL_CHECK(CFS_FAIL_GNI_DGRAM_DROP_TX)) {
01856                 write_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
01857                 GOTO(no_peer, rc);
01858         }
01859 
01860         if (conn != NULL) {
01861                 /* oh hey, found a conn now... magical */
01862                 kgnilnd_queue_tx(conn, tx);
01863         } else {
01864                 /* no conn, must be trying to connect - so we queue for now */
01865                 tx->tx_qtime = jiffies;
01866                 kgnilnd_tx_add_state_locked(tx, peer, NULL, GNILND_TX_PEERQ, 1);
01867         }
01868         write_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
01869         RETURN_EXIT;
01870 no_peer:
01871         kgnilnd_tx_done(tx, rc);
01872         RETURN_EXIT;
01873 }
01874 
01875 int
01876 kgnilnd_rdma(kgn_tx_t *tx, int type,
01877             kgn_rdma_desc_t *sink, unsigned int nob, __u64 cookie)
01878 {
01879         kgn_conn_t   *conn = tx->tx_conn;
01880         unsigned long timestamp;
01881         gni_post_type_t post_type;
01882         gni_return_t  rrc;
01883         int rc = 0;
01884         unsigned int desc_nob = nob;
01885         void *desc_buffer = tx->tx_buffer;
01886         gni_mem_handle_t desc_map_key = tx->tx_map_key;
01887         LASSERTF(kgnilnd_tx_mapped(tx),
01888                 "unmapped tx %p\n", tx);
01889         LASSERTF(conn != NULL,
01890                 "NULL conn on tx %p, naughty, naughty\n", tx);
01891         LASSERTF(nob <= sink->gnrd_nob,
01892                 "nob %u > sink->gnrd_nob %d (%p)\n",
01893                 nob, sink->gnrd_nob, sink);
01894         LASSERTF(nob <= tx->tx_nob,
01895                 "nob %d > tx(%p)->tx_nob %d\n",
01896                 nob, tx, tx->tx_nob);
01897 
01898         switch (type) {
01899         case GNILND_MSG_GET_DONE:
01900         case GNILND_MSG_PUT_DONE:
01901                 post_type = GNI_POST_RDMA_PUT;
01902                 break;
01903         case GNILND_MSG_GET_DONE_REV:
01904         case GNILND_MSG_PUT_DONE_REV:
01905                 post_type = GNI_POST_RDMA_GET;
01906                 break;
01907         default:
01908                 CERROR("invalid msg type %s (%d)\n",
01909                         kgnilnd_msgtype2str(type), type);
01910                 LBUG();
01911         }
01912         if (post_type == GNI_POST_RDMA_GET) {
01913                 /* Check for remote buffer / local buffer / length alignment. All must be 4 byte
01914                  * aligned. If the local buffer is not aligned correctly using the copy buffer
01915                  * will fix that issue. If length is misaligned copy buffer will also fix the issue, we end
01916                  * up transferring extra bytes into the buffer but only copy the correct nob into the original
01917                  * buffer.  Remote offset correction is done through a combination of adjusting the offset,
01918                  * making sure the length and addr are aligned and copying the data into the correct location
01919                  * once the transfer has completed.
01920                  */
01921                 if ((((__u64)((unsigned long)tx->tx_buffer)) & 3) ||
01922                       (sink->gnrd_addr & 3) ||
01923                       (nob & 3)) {
01924 
01925                         tx->tx_offset = ((__u64)((unsigned long)sink->gnrd_addr)) & 3;
01926                         if (tx->tx_offset)
01927                                 kgnilnd_admin_addref(kgnilnd_data.kgn_rev_offset);
01928 
01929                         if ((nob + tx->tx_offset) & 3) {
01930                                 desc_nob = ((nob + tx->tx_offset) + (4 - ((nob + tx->tx_offset) & 3)));
01931                                 kgnilnd_admin_addref(kgnilnd_data.kgn_rev_length);
01932                         } else {
01933                                 desc_nob = (nob + tx->tx_offset);
01934                         }
01935 
01936                         if (tx->tx_buffer_copy == NULL) {
01937                                 /* Allocate the largest copy buffer we will need, this will prevent us from overwriting data
01938                                  * and require at most we allocate a few extra bytes. */
01939                                 tx->tx_buffer_copy = vmalloc(desc_nob);
01940 
01941                                 if (!tx->tx_buffer_copy) {
01942                                         /* allocation of buffer failed nak the rdma */
01943                                         kgnilnd_nak_rdma(tx->tx_conn, tx->tx_msg.gnm_type, -EFAULT, cookie, tx->tx_msg.gnm_srcnid);
01944                                         kgnilnd_tx_done(tx, -EFAULT);
01945                                         return 0;
01946                                 }
01947                                 kgnilnd_admin_addref(kgnilnd_data.kgn_rev_copy_buff);
01948                                 rc = kgnilnd_mem_register(conn->gnc_device->gnd_handle, (__u64)tx->tx_buffer_copy, desc_nob, NULL, GNI_MEM_READWRITE, &tx->tx_buffer_copy_map_key);
01949                                 if (rc != GNI_RC_SUCCESS) {
01950                                         /* Registration Failed nak rdma and kill the tx. */
01951                                         vfree(tx->tx_buffer_copy);
01952                                         tx->tx_buffer_copy = NULL;
01953                                         kgnilnd_nak_rdma(tx->tx_conn, tx->tx_msg.gnm_type, -EFAULT, cookie, tx->tx_msg.gnm_srcnid);
01954                                         kgnilnd_tx_done(tx, -EFAULT);
01955                                         return 0;
01956                                 }
01957                         }
01958                         desc_map_key = tx->tx_buffer_copy_map_key;
01959                         desc_buffer = tx->tx_buffer_copy;
01960                 }
01961         }
01962 
01963         memset(&tx->tx_rdma_desc, 0, sizeof(tx->tx_rdma_desc));
01964         tx->tx_rdma_desc.post_id = tx->tx_id.txe_cookie;
01965         tx->tx_rdma_desc.type = post_type;
01966         tx->tx_rdma_desc.cq_mode = GNI_CQMODE_GLOBAL_EVENT;
01967         tx->tx_rdma_desc.local_addr = (__u64)((unsigned long)desc_buffer);
01968         tx->tx_rdma_desc.local_mem_hndl = desc_map_key;
01969         tx->tx_rdma_desc.remote_addr = sink->gnrd_addr - tx->tx_offset;
01970         tx->tx_rdma_desc.remote_mem_hndl = sink->gnrd_key;
01971         tx->tx_rdma_desc.length = desc_nob;
01972         tx->tx_nob_rdma = nob;
01973         if (*kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_bte_dlvr_mode)
01974                 tx->tx_rdma_desc.dlvr_mode = *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_bte_dlvr_mode;
01975         /* prep final completion message */
01976         kgnilnd_init_msg(&tx->tx_msg, type, tx->tx_msg.gnm_srcnid);
01977         tx->tx_msg.gnm_u.completion.gncm_cookie = cookie;
01978         /* send actual size RDMA'd in retval */
01979         tx->tx_msg.gnm_u.completion.gncm_retval = nob;
01980 
01981         kgnilnd_compute_rdma_cksum(tx, nob);
01982 
01983         if (nob == 0) {
01984                 kgnilnd_queue_tx(conn, tx);
01985                 return 0;
01986         }
01987 
01988         /* Don't lie (CLOSE == RDMA idle) */
01989         LASSERTF(!conn->gnc_close_sent, "tx %p on conn %p after close sent %d\n",
01990                  tx, conn, conn->gnc_close_sent);
01991 
01992         GNIDBG_TX(D_NET, tx, "Post RDMA type 0x%02x conn %p dlvr_mode "
01993                 "0x%x cookie:"LPX64,
01994                 type, conn, tx->tx_rdma_desc.dlvr_mode, cookie);
01995 
01996         /* set CQ dedicated for RDMA */
01997         tx->tx_rdma_desc.src_cq_hndl = conn->gnc_device->gnd_snd_rdma_cqh;
01998 
01999         timestamp = jiffies;
02000         kgnilnd_conn_mutex_lock(&conn->gnc_rdma_mutex);
02001         kgnilnd_gl_mutex_lock(&conn->gnc_device->gnd_cq_mutex);
02002         /* delay in jiffies - we are really concerned only with things that
02003          * result in a schedule() or really holding this off for long times .
02004          * NB - mutex_lock could spin for 2 jiffies before going to sleep to wait */
02005         conn->gnc_device->gnd_mutex_delay += (long) jiffies - timestamp;
02006 
02007         rrc = kgnilnd_post_rdma(conn->gnc_ephandle, &tx->tx_rdma_desc);
02008 
02009         if (rrc == GNI_RC_ERROR_RESOURCE) {
02010                 kgnilnd_conn_mutex_unlock(&conn->gnc_rdma_mutex);
02011                 kgnilnd_gl_mutex_unlock(&conn->gnc_device->gnd_cq_mutex);
02012                 kgnilnd_unmap_buffer(tx, 0);
02013 
02014                 if (tx->tx_buffer_copy != NULL) {
02015                         vfree(tx->tx_buffer_copy);
02016                         tx->tx_buffer_copy = NULL;
02017                 }
02018 
02019                 spin_lock(&tx->tx_conn->gnc_device->gnd_lock);
02020                 kgnilnd_tx_add_state_locked(tx, NULL, tx->tx_conn,
02021                                             GNILND_TX_MAPQ, 0);
02022                 spin_unlock(&tx->tx_conn->gnc_device->gnd_lock);
02023                 kgnilnd_schedule_device(tx->tx_conn->gnc_device);
02024                 return -EAGAIN;
02025         }
02026 
02027         spin_lock(&conn->gnc_list_lock);
02028         kgnilnd_tx_add_state_locked(tx, conn->gnc_peer, conn, GNILND_TX_LIVE_RDMAQ, 1);
02029         tx->tx_qtime = jiffies;
02030         spin_unlock(&conn->gnc_list_lock);
02031         kgnilnd_gl_mutex_unlock(&conn->gnc_device->gnd_cq_mutex);
02032         kgnilnd_conn_mutex_unlock(&conn->gnc_rdma_mutex);
02033 
02034         /* XXX Nic: is this a place we should handle more errors for
02035          * robustness sake */
02036         LASSERT(rrc == GNI_RC_SUCCESS);
02037         return 0;
02038 }
02039 
02040 kgn_rx_t *
02041 kgnilnd_alloc_rx(void)
02042 {
02043         kgn_rx_t        *rx;
02044 
02045         rx = kmem_cache_alloc(kgnilnd_data.kgn_rx_cache, GFP_ATOMIC);
02046         if (rx == NULL) {
02047                 CERROR("failed to allocate rx\n");
02048                 return NULL;
02049         }
02050         CDEBUG(D_MALLOC, "slab-alloced 'rx': %lu at %p.\n",
02051                sizeof(*rx), rx);
02052 
02053         /* no memset to zero, we'll always fill all members */
02054         return rx;
02055 }
02056 
02057 /* release is to just free connection resources
02058  * we use this for the eager path after copying */
02059 void
02060 kgnilnd_release_msg(kgn_conn_t *conn)
02061 {
02062         gni_return_t    rrc;
02063         unsigned long   timestamp;
02064 
02065         CDEBUG(D_NET, "consuming %p\n", conn);
02066 
02067         timestamp = jiffies;
02068         kgnilnd_gl_mutex_lock(&conn->gnc_device->gnd_cq_mutex);
02069         /* delay in jiffies - we are really concerned only with things that
02070          * result in a schedule() or really holding this off for long times .
02071          * NB - mutex_lock could spin for 2 jiffies before going to sleep to wait */
02072         conn->gnc_device->gnd_mutex_delay += (long) jiffies - timestamp;
02073 
02074         rrc = kgnilnd_smsg_release(conn->gnc_ephandle);
02075         kgnilnd_gl_mutex_unlock(&conn->gnc_device->gnd_cq_mutex);
02076 
02077         LASSERTF(rrc == GNI_RC_SUCCESS, "bad rrc %d\n", rrc);
02078         GNIDBG_SMSG_CREDS(D_NET, conn);
02079 
02080         return;
02081 }
02082 
02083 void
02084 kgnilnd_consume_rx(kgn_rx_t *rx)
02085 {
02086         kgn_conn_t      *conn = rx->grx_conn;
02087         kgn_msg_t       *rxmsg = rx->grx_msg;
02088 
02089         /* if we are eager, free the cache alloc'd msg */
02090         if (unlikely(rx->grx_eager)) {
02091                 LIBCFS_FREE(rxmsg, sizeof(*rxmsg) + *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_max_immediate);
02092                 atomic_dec(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_neager_allocs);
02093 
02094                 /* release ref from eager_recv */
02095                 kgnilnd_conn_decref(conn);
02096         } else {
02097                 GNIDBG_MSG(D_NET, rxmsg, "rx %p processed", rx);
02098                 kgnilnd_release_msg(conn);
02099         }
02100 
02101         kmem_cache_free(kgnilnd_data.kgn_rx_cache, rx);
02102         CDEBUG(D_MALLOC, "slab-freed 'rx': %lu at %p.\n",
02103                sizeof(*rx), rx);
02104 
02105         return;
02106 }
02107 
02108 int
02109 kgnilnd_send(lnet_ni_t *ni, void *private, lnet_msg_t *lntmsg)
02110 {
02111         lnet_hdr_t       *hdr = &lntmsg->msg_hdr;
02112         int               type = lntmsg->msg_type;
02113         lnet_process_id_t target = lntmsg->msg_target;
02114         int               target_is_router = lntmsg->msg_target_is_router;
02115         int               routing = lntmsg->msg_routing;
02116         unsigned int      niov = lntmsg->msg_niov;
02117         struct kvec      *iov = lntmsg->msg_iov;
02118         lnet_kiov_t      *kiov = lntmsg->msg_kiov;
02119         unsigned int      offset = lntmsg->msg_offset;
02120         unsigned int      nob = lntmsg->msg_len;
02121         unsigned int      msg_vmflush = lntmsg->msg_vmflush;
02122         kgn_net_t        *net = ni->ni_data;
02123         kgn_tx_t         *tx;
02124         int               rc = 0;
02125         int               mpflag = 0;
02126         int               reverse_rdma_flag = *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_reverse_rdma;
02127 
02128         /* NB 'private' is different depending on what we're sending.... */
02129         LASSERT(!in_interrupt());
02130 
02131         CDEBUG(D_NET, "sending msg type %d with %d bytes in %d frags to %s\n",
02132                type, nob, niov, libcfs_id2str(target));
02133 
02134         LASSERTF(nob == 0 || niov > 0,
02135                 "lntmsg %p nob %d niov %d\n", lntmsg, nob, niov);
02136         LASSERTF(niov <= LNET_MAX_IOV,
02137                 "lntmsg %p niov %d\n", lntmsg, niov);
02138 
02139         /* payload is either all vaddrs or all pages */
02140         LASSERTF(!(kiov != NULL && iov != NULL),
02141                 "lntmsg %p kiov %p iov %p\n", lntmsg, kiov, iov);
02142 
02143         if (msg_vmflush)
02144                 mpflag = cfs_memory_pressure_get_and_set();
02145 
02146         switch (type) {
02147         default:
02148                 CERROR("lntmsg %p with unexpected type %d\n",
02149                         lntmsg, type);
02150                 LBUG();
02151 
02152         case LNET_MSG_ACK:
02153                 LASSERTF(nob == 0, "lntmsg %p nob %d\n",
02154                         lntmsg, nob);
02155                 break;
02156 
02157         case LNET_MSG_GET:
02158                 LASSERT(niov == 0);
02159                 LASSERT(nob == 0);
02160 
02161                 if (routing || target_is_router)
02162                         break;                  /* send IMMEDIATE */
02163 
02164                 /* it is safe to do direct GET with out mapping buffer for RDMA as we
02165                  * check the eventual sink buffer here - if small enough, remote
02166                  * end is perfectly capable of returning data in short message -
02167                  * The magic is that we call lnet_parse in kgnilnd_recv with rdma_req=0
02168                  * for IMMEDIATE messages which will have it send a real reply instead
02169                  * of doing kgnilnd_recv to have the RDMA continued */
02170                 if (lntmsg->msg_md->md_length <= *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_max_immediate)
02171                        break;
02172 
02173                 if ((reverse_rdma_flag & GNILND_REVERSE_GET) == 0)
02174                         tx = kgnilnd_new_tx_msg(GNILND_MSG_GET_REQ, ni->ni_nid);
02175                 else
02176                         tx = kgnilnd_new_tx_msg(GNILND_MSG_GET_REQ_REV, ni->ni_nid);
02177 
02178                 if (tx == NULL) {
02179                         rc = -ENOMEM;
02180                         goto out;
02181                 }
02182                 /* slightly different options as we might actually have a GET with a
02183                  * MD_KIOV set but a non-NULL md_iov.iov */
02184                 if ((lntmsg->msg_md->md_options & LNET_MD_KIOV) == 0)
02185                         rc = kgnilnd_setup_rdma_buffer(tx, lntmsg->msg_md->md_niov,
02186                                                       lntmsg->msg_md->md_iov.iov, NULL,
02187                                                       0, lntmsg->msg_md->md_length);
02188                 else
02189                         rc = kgnilnd_setup_rdma_buffer(tx, lntmsg->msg_md->md_niov,
02190                                                       NULL, lntmsg->msg_md->md_iov.kiov,
02191                                                       0, lntmsg->msg_md->md_length);
02192                 if (rc != 0) {
02193                         CERROR("unable to setup buffer: %d\n", rc);
02194                         kgnilnd_tx_done(tx, rc);
02195                         rc = -EIO;
02196                         goto out;
02197                 }
02198 
02199                 tx->tx_lntmsg[1] = lnet_create_reply_msg(ni, lntmsg);
02200                 if (tx->tx_lntmsg[1] == NULL) {
02201                         CERROR("Can't create reply for GET to %s\n",
02202                                libcfs_nid2str(target.nid));
02203                         kgnilnd_tx_done(tx, rc);
02204                         rc = -EIO;
02205                         goto out;
02206                 }
02207 
02208                 tx->tx_lntmsg[0] = lntmsg;
02209                 if ((reverse_rdma_flag & GNILND_REVERSE_GET) == 0)
02210                         tx->tx_msg.gnm_u.get.gngm_hdr = *hdr;
02211                 else
02212                         tx->tx_msg.gnm_u.putreq.gnprm_hdr = *hdr;
02213 
02214                 /* rest of tx_msg is setup just before it is sent */
02215                 kgnilnd_launch_tx(tx, net, &target);
02216                 goto out;
02217         case LNET_MSG_REPLY:
02218         case LNET_MSG_PUT:
02219                 /* to save on MDDs, we'll handle short kiov by vmap'ing
02220                  * and sending via SMSG */
02221                 if (nob <= *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_max_immediate)
02222                        break;
02223 
02224                 if ((reverse_rdma_flag & GNILND_REVERSE_PUT) == 0)
02225                         tx = kgnilnd_new_tx_msg(GNILND_MSG_PUT_REQ, ni->ni_nid);
02226                 else
02227                         tx = kgnilnd_new_tx_msg(GNILND_MSG_PUT_REQ_REV, ni->ni_nid);
02228 
02229                 if (tx == NULL) {
02230                         rc = -ENOMEM;
02231                         goto out;
02232                 }
02233 
02234                 rc = kgnilnd_setup_rdma_buffer(tx, niov, iov, kiov, offset, nob);
02235                 if (rc != 0) {
02236                         kgnilnd_tx_done(tx, rc);
02237                         rc = -EIO;
02238                         goto out;
02239                 }
02240 
02241                 tx->tx_lntmsg[0] = lntmsg;
02242                 if ((reverse_rdma_flag & GNILND_REVERSE_PUT) == 0)
02243                         tx->tx_msg.gnm_u.putreq.gnprm_hdr = *hdr;
02244                 else
02245                         tx->tx_msg.gnm_u.get.gngm_hdr = *hdr;
02246 
02247                 /* rest of tx_msg is setup just before it is sent */
02248                 kgnilnd_launch_tx(tx, net, &target);
02249                 goto out;
02250         }
02251 
02252         /* send IMMEDIATE */
02253 
02254         LASSERTF(nob <= *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_max_immediate,
02255                 "lntmsg 0x%p too large %d\n", lntmsg, nob);
02256 
02257         tx = kgnilnd_new_tx_msg(GNILND_MSG_IMMEDIATE, ni->ni_nid);
02258         if (tx == NULL) {
02259                 rc = -ENOMEM;
02260                 goto out;
02261         }
02262 
02263         rc = kgnilnd_setup_immediate_buffer(tx, niov, iov, kiov, offset, nob);
02264         if (rc != 0) {
02265                 kgnilnd_tx_done(tx, rc);
02266                 goto out;
02267         }
02268 
02269         tx->tx_msg.gnm_u.immediate.gnim_hdr = *hdr;
02270         tx->tx_lntmsg[0] = lntmsg;
02271         kgnilnd_launch_tx(tx, net, &target);
02272 
02273 out:
02274         /* use stored value as we could have already finalized lntmsg here from a failed launch */
02275         if (msg_vmflush)
02276                 cfs_memory_pressure_restore(mpflag);
02277         return rc;
02278 }
02279 
02280 void
02281 kgnilnd_setup_rdma(lnet_ni_t *ni, kgn_rx_t *rx, lnet_msg_t *lntmsg, int mlen)
02282 {
02283         kgn_conn_t    *conn = rx->grx_conn;
02284         kgn_msg_t     *rxmsg = rx->grx_msg;
02285         unsigned int   niov = lntmsg->msg_niov;
02286         struct kvec   *iov = lntmsg->msg_iov;
02287         lnet_kiov_t   *kiov = lntmsg->msg_kiov;
02288         unsigned int   offset = lntmsg->msg_offset;
02289         unsigned int   nob = lntmsg->msg_len;
02290         int            done_type;
02291         kgn_tx_t      *tx;
02292         int            rc = 0;
02293 
02294         switch (rxmsg->gnm_type) {
02295         case GNILND_MSG_PUT_REQ_REV:
02296                 done_type = GNILND_MSG_PUT_DONE_REV;
02297                 nob = mlen;
02298                 break;
02299         case GNILND_MSG_GET_REQ:
02300                 done_type = GNILND_MSG_GET_DONE;
02301                 break;
02302         default:
02303                 CERROR("invalid msg type %s (%d)\n",
02304                         kgnilnd_msgtype2str(rxmsg->gnm_type),
02305                         rxmsg->gnm_type);
02306                 LBUG();
02307         }
02308 
02309         tx = kgnilnd_new_tx_msg(done_type, ni->ni_nid);
02310         if (tx == NULL)
02311                 goto failed_0;
02312 
02313         rc = kgnilnd_set_tx_id(tx, conn);
02314         if (rc != 0)
02315                 goto failed_1;
02316 
02317         rc = kgnilnd_setup_rdma_buffer(tx, niov, iov, kiov, offset, nob);
02318         if (rc != 0)
02319                 goto failed_1;
02320 
02321         tx->tx_lntmsg[0] = lntmsg;
02322         tx->tx_getinfo = rxmsg->gnm_u.get;
02323 
02324         /* we only queue from kgnilnd_recv - we might get called from other contexts
02325          * and we don't want to block the mutex in those cases */
02326 
02327         spin_lock(&tx->tx_conn->gnc_device->gnd_lock);
02328         kgnilnd_tx_add_state_locked(tx, NULL, tx->tx_conn, GNILND_TX_MAPQ, 1);
02329         spin_unlock(&tx->tx_conn->gnc_device->gnd_lock);
02330         kgnilnd_schedule_device(tx->tx_conn->gnc_device);
02331 
02332         return;
02333 
02334  failed_1:
02335         kgnilnd_tx_done(tx, rc);
02336         kgnilnd_nak_rdma(conn, done_type, rc, rxmsg->gnm_u.get.gngm_cookie, ni->ni_nid);
02337  failed_0:
02338         lnet_finalize(ni, lntmsg, rc);
02339 }
02340 
02341 int
02342 kgnilnd_eager_recv(lnet_ni_t *ni, void *private, lnet_msg_t *lntmsg,
02343                    void **new_private)
02344 {
02345         kgn_rx_t        *rx = private;
02346         kgn_conn_t      *conn = rx->grx_conn;
02347         kgn_msg_t       *rxmsg = rx->grx_msg;
02348         kgn_msg_t       *eagermsg = NULL;
02349         kgn_peer_t      *peer = NULL;
02350         kgn_conn_t      *found_conn = NULL;
02351 
02352         GNIDBG_MSG(D_NET, rxmsg, "eager recv for conn %p, rxmsg %p, lntmsg %p",
02353                 conn, rxmsg, lntmsg);
02354 
02355         if (rxmsg->gnm_payload_len > *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_max_immediate) {
02356                 GNIDBG_MSG(D_ERROR, rxmsg, "payload too large %d",
02357                         rxmsg->gnm_payload_len);
02358                 return -EPROTO;
02359         }
02360         /* Grab a read lock so the connection doesnt disappear on us
02361          * while we look it up
02362          */
02363         read_lock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
02364 
02365         peer = kgnilnd_find_peer_locked(rxmsg->gnm_srcnid);
02366         if (peer != NULL)
02367                 found_conn = kgnilnd_find_conn_locked(peer);
02368 
02369 
02370         /* Verify the connection found is the same one that the message
02371          * is supposed to be using, if it is not output an error message
02372          * and return.
02373          */
02374         if (!peer || !found_conn
02375             || found_conn->gnc_peer_connstamp != rxmsg->gnm_connstamp) {
02376                 read_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
02377                 CERROR("Couldnt find matching peer %p or conn %p / %p\n",
02378                         peer, conn, found_conn);
02379                 if (found_conn) {
02380                         CERROR("Unexpected connstamp "LPX64"("LPX64" expected)"
02381                                 " from %s", rxmsg->gnm_connstamp,
02382                                 found_conn->gnc_peer_connstamp,
02383                                 libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid));
02384                 }
02385                 return -ENOTCONN;
02386         }
02387 
02388         /* add conn ref to ensure it doesn't go away until all eager
02389          * messages processed */
02390         kgnilnd_conn_addref(conn);
02391 
02392         /* Now that we have verified the connection is valid and added a
02393          * reference we can remove the read_lock on the peer_conn_lock */
02394         read_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
02395 
02396         /* we have no credits or buffers for this message, so copy it
02397          * somewhere for a later kgnilnd_recv */
02398         if (atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_neager_allocs) >=
02399                         *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_eager_credits) {
02400                 CERROR("Out of eager credits to %s\n",
02401                         libcfs_nid2str(conn->gnc_peer->gnp_nid));
02402                 return -ENOMEM;
02403         }
02404 
02405         atomic_inc(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_neager_allocs);
02406 
02407         LIBCFS_ALLOC(eagermsg, sizeof(*eagermsg) + *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_max_immediate);
02408         if (eagermsg == NULL) {
02409                 kgnilnd_conn_decref(conn);
02410                 CERROR("couldn't allocate eager rx message for conn %p to %s\n",
02411                         conn, libcfs_nid2str(conn->gnc_peer->gnp_nid));
02412                 return -ENOMEM;
02413         }
02414 
02415         /* copy msg and payload */
02416         memcpy(eagermsg, rxmsg, sizeof(*rxmsg) + rxmsg->gnm_payload_len);
02417         rx->grx_msg = eagermsg;
02418         rx->grx_eager = 1;
02419 
02420         /* stash this for lnet_finalize on cancel-on-conn-close */
02421         rx->grx_lntmsg = lntmsg;
02422 
02423         /* keep the same rx_t, it just has a new grx_msg now */
02424         *new_private = private;
02425 
02426         /* release SMSG buffer */
02427         kgnilnd_release_msg(conn);
02428 
02429         return 0;
02430 }
02431 
02432 int
02433 kgnilnd_recv(lnet_ni_t *ni, void *private, lnet_msg_t *lntmsg,
02434              int delayed, unsigned int niov,
02435              struct kvec *iov, lnet_kiov_t *kiov,
02436              unsigned int offset, unsigned int mlen, unsigned int rlen)
02437 {
02438         kgn_rx_t    *rx = private;
02439         kgn_conn_t  *conn = rx->grx_conn;
02440         kgn_msg_t   *rxmsg = rx->grx_msg;
02441         kgn_tx_t    *tx;
02442         int          rc = 0;
02443         __u32        pload_cksum;
02444         ENTRY;
02445 
02446         LASSERT(!in_interrupt());
02447         LASSERTF(mlen <= rlen, "%d <= %d\n", mlen, rlen);
02448         /* Either all pages or all vaddrs */
02449         LASSERTF(!(kiov != NULL && iov != NULL), "kiov %p iov %p\n",
02450                 kiov, iov);
02451 
02452         GNIDBG_MSG(D_NET, rxmsg, "conn %p, rxmsg %p, lntmsg %p"
02453                 " niov=%d kiov=%p iov=%p offset=%d mlen=%d rlen=%d",
02454                 conn, rxmsg, lntmsg,
02455                 niov, kiov, iov, offset, mlen, rlen);
02456 
02457         /* we need to lock here as recv can be called from any context */
02458         read_lock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
02459         if (rx->grx_eager && conn->gnc_state != GNILND_CONN_ESTABLISHED) {
02460                 read_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
02461 
02462                 /* someone closed the conn after we copied this out, nuke it */
02463                 kgnilnd_consume_rx(rx);
02464                 lnet_finalize(ni, lntmsg, conn->gnc_error);
02465                 RETURN(0);
02466         }
02467         read_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
02468 
02469         switch (rxmsg->gnm_type) {
02470         default:
02471                 GNIDBG_MSG(D_NETERROR, rxmsg, "conn %p, rx %p, rxmsg %p, lntmsg %p"
02472                 " niov=%d kiov=%p iov=%p offset=%d mlen=%d rlen=%d",
02473                 conn, rx, rxmsg, lntmsg, niov, kiov, iov, offset, mlen, rlen);
02474                 LBUG();
02475 
02476         case GNILND_MSG_IMMEDIATE:
02477                 if (mlen > rxmsg->gnm_payload_len) {
02478                         GNIDBG_MSG(D_ERROR, rxmsg,
02479                                 "Immediate message from %s too big: %d > %d",
02480                                 libcfs_nid2str(conn->gnc_peer->gnp_nid), mlen,
02481                                 rxmsg->gnm_payload_len);
02482                         rc = -EINVAL;
02483                         kgnilnd_consume_rx(rx);
02484                         RETURN(rc);
02485                 }
02486 
02487                 /* rxmsg[1] is a pointer to the payload, sitting in the buffer
02488                  * right after the kgn_msg_t header - so just 'cute' way of saying
02489                  * rxmsg + sizeof(kgn_msg_t) */
02490 
02491                 /* check payload checksum if sent */
02492 
02493                 if (*kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_checksum >= 2 &&
02494                         !rxmsg->gnm_payload_cksum &&
02495                         rxmsg->gnm_payload_len != 0)
02496                         GNIDBG_MSG(D_WARNING, rxmsg, "no msg payload checksum when enabled");
02497 
02498                 if (rxmsg->gnm_payload_cksum != 0) {
02499                         /* gnm_payload_len set in kgnilnd_sendmsg from tx->tx_nob,
02500                          * which is what is used to calculate the cksum on the TX side */
02501                         pload_cksum = kgnilnd_cksum(&rxmsg[1], rxmsg->gnm_payload_len);
02502 
02503                         if (rxmsg->gnm_payload_cksum != pload_cksum) {
02504                                 GNIDBG_MSG(D_NETERROR, rxmsg,
02505                                            "Bad payload checksum (%x expected %x)",
02506                                             pload_cksum, rxmsg->gnm_payload_cksum);
02507                                 switch (*kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_checksum_dump) {
02508                                 case 2:
02509                                         kgnilnd_dump_blob(D_BUFFS, "bad payload checksum",
02510                                                           &rxmsg[1], rxmsg->gnm_payload_len);
02511                                         /* fall through to dump */
02512                                 case 1:
02513                                         libcfs_debug_dumplog();
02514                                         break;
02515                                 default:
02516                                         break;
02517                                 }
02518                                 rc = -ENOKEY;
02519                                 /* checksum problems are fatal, kill the conn */
02520                                 kgnilnd_consume_rx(rx);
02521                                 kgnilnd_close_conn(conn, rc);
02522                                 RETURN(rc);
02523                         }
02524                 }
02525 
02526                 if (kiov != NULL)
02527                         lnet_copy_flat2kiov(
02528                                 niov, kiov, offset,
02529                                 *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_max_immediate,
02530                                 &rxmsg[1], 0, mlen);
02531                 else
02532                         lnet_copy_flat2iov(
02533                                 niov, iov, offset,
02534                                 *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_max_immediate,
02535                                 &rxmsg[1], 0, mlen);
02536 
02537                 kgnilnd_consume_rx(rx);
02538                 lnet_finalize(ni, lntmsg, 0);
02539                 RETURN(0);
02540 
02541         case GNILND_MSG_PUT_REQ:
02542                 /* LNET wants to truncate or drop transaction, sending NAK */
02543                 if (mlen == 0) {
02544                         kgnilnd_consume_rx(rx);
02545                         lnet_finalize(ni, lntmsg, 0);
02546 
02547                         /* only error if lntmsg == NULL, otherwise we are just
02548                          * short circuiting the rdma process of 0 bytes */
02549                         kgnilnd_nak_rdma(conn, rxmsg->gnm_type,
02550                                         lntmsg == NULL ? -ENOENT : 0,
02551                                         rxmsg->gnm_u.get.gngm_cookie,
02552                                         ni->ni_nid);
02553                         RETURN(0);
02554                 }
02555                 /* sending ACK with sink buff. info */
02556                 tx = kgnilnd_new_tx_msg(GNILND_MSG_PUT_ACK, ni->ni_nid);
02557                 if (tx == NULL) {
02558                         kgnilnd_consume_rx(rx);
02559                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
02560                 }
02561 
02562                 rc = kgnilnd_set_tx_id(tx, conn);
02563                 if (rc != 0) {
02564                         GOTO(nak_put_req, rc);
02565                 }
02566 
02567                 rc = kgnilnd_setup_rdma_buffer(tx, niov, iov, kiov, offset, mlen);
02568                 if (rc != 0) {
02569                         GOTO(nak_put_req, rc);
02570                 }
02571 
02572                 tx->tx_msg.gnm_u.putack.gnpam_src_cookie =
02573                         rxmsg->gnm_u.putreq.gnprm_cookie;
02574                 tx->tx_msg.gnm_u.putack.gnpam_dst_cookie = tx->tx_id.txe_cookie;
02575                 tx->tx_msg.gnm_u.putack.gnpam_desc.gnrd_addr =
02576                         (__u64)((unsigned long)tx->tx_buffer);
02577                 tx->tx_msg.gnm_u.putack.gnpam_desc.gnrd_nob = mlen;
02578 
02579                 tx->tx_lntmsg[0] = lntmsg; /* finalize this on RDMA_DONE */
02580                 tx->tx_qtime = jiffies;
02581                 /* we only queue from kgnilnd_recv - we might get called from other contexts
02582                  * and we don't want to block the mutex in those cases */
02583 
02584                 spin_lock(&tx->tx_conn->gnc_device->gnd_lock);
02585                 kgnilnd_tx_add_state_locked(tx, NULL, tx->tx_conn, GNILND_TX_MAPQ, 1);
02586                 spin_unlock(&tx->tx_conn->gnc_device->gnd_lock);
02587                 kgnilnd_schedule_device(tx->tx_conn->gnc_device);
02588 
02589                 kgnilnd_consume_rx(rx);
02590                 RETURN(0);
02591 
02592 nak_put_req:
02593                 /* make sure we send an error back when the PUT fails */
02594                 kgnilnd_nak_rdma(conn, rxmsg->gnm_type, rc, rxmsg->gnm_u.get.gngm_cookie, ni->ni_nid);
02595                 kgnilnd_tx_done(tx, rc);
02596                 kgnilnd_consume_rx(rx);
02597 
02598                 /* return magic LNet network error */
02599                 RETURN(-EIO);
02600         case GNILND_MSG_GET_REQ_REV:
02601                 /* LNET wants to truncate or drop transaction, sending NAK */
02602                 if (mlen == 0) {
02603                         kgnilnd_consume_rx(rx);
02604                         lnet_finalize(ni, lntmsg, 0);
02605 
02606                         /* only error if lntmsg == NULL, otherwise we are just
02607                          * short circuiting the rdma process of 0 bytes */
02608                         kgnilnd_nak_rdma(conn, rxmsg->gnm_type,
02609                                         lntmsg == NULL ? -ENOENT : 0,
02610                                         rxmsg->gnm_u.get.gngm_cookie,
02611                                         ni->ni_nid);
02612                         RETURN(0);
02613                 }
02614                 /* lntmsg can be null when parsing a LNET_GET */
02615                 if (lntmsg != NULL) {
02616                         /* sending ACK with sink buff. info */
02617                         tx = kgnilnd_new_tx_msg(GNILND_MSG_GET_ACK_REV, ni->ni_nid);
02618                         if (tx == NULL) {
02619                                 kgnilnd_consume_rx(rx);
02620                                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
02621                         }
02622 
02623                         rc = kgnilnd_set_tx_id(tx, conn);
02624                         if (rc != 0)
02625                                 GOTO(nak_get_req_rev, rc);
02626 
02627 
02628                         rc = kgnilnd_setup_rdma_buffer(tx, niov, iov, kiov, offset, mlen);
02629                         if (rc != 0)
02630                                 GOTO(nak_get_req_rev, rc);
02631 
02632 
02633                         tx->tx_msg.gnm_u.putack.gnpam_src_cookie =
02634                                 rxmsg->gnm_u.putreq.gnprm_cookie;
02635                         tx->tx_msg.gnm_u.putack.gnpam_dst_cookie = tx->tx_id.txe_cookie;
02636                         tx->tx_msg.gnm_u.putack.gnpam_desc.gnrd_addr =
02637                                 (__u64)((unsigned long)tx->tx_buffer);
02638                         tx->tx_msg.gnm_u.putack.gnpam_desc.gnrd_nob = mlen;
02639 
02640                         tx->tx_lntmsg[0] = lntmsg; /* finalize this on RDMA_DONE */
02641 
02642                         /* we only queue from kgnilnd_recv - we might get called from other contexts
02643                          * and we don't want to block the mutex in those cases */
02644 
02645                         spin_lock(&tx->tx_conn->gnc_device->gnd_lock);
02646                         kgnilnd_tx_add_state_locked(tx, NULL, tx->tx_conn, GNILND_TX_MAPQ, 1);
02647                         spin_unlock(&tx->tx_conn->gnc_device->gnd_lock);
02648                         kgnilnd_schedule_device(tx->tx_conn->gnc_device);
02649                 } else {
02650                         /* No match */
02651                         kgnilnd_nak_rdma(conn, rxmsg->gnm_type,
02652                                         -ENOENT,
02653                                         rxmsg->gnm_u.get.gngm_cookie,
02654                                         ni->ni_nid);
02655                 }
02656 
02657                 kgnilnd_consume_rx(rx);
02658                 RETURN(0);
02659 
02660 nak_get_req_rev:
02661                 /* make sure we send an error back when the GET fails */
02662                 kgnilnd_nak_rdma(conn, rxmsg->gnm_type, rc, rxmsg->gnm_u.get.gngm_cookie, ni->ni_nid);
02663                 kgnilnd_tx_done(tx, rc);
02664                 kgnilnd_consume_rx(rx);
02665 
02666                 /* return magic LNet network error */
02667                 RETURN(-EIO);
02668 
02669 
02670         case GNILND_MSG_PUT_REQ_REV:
02671                 /* LNET wants to truncate or drop transaction, sending NAK */
02672                 if (mlen == 0) {
02673                         kgnilnd_consume_rx(rx);
02674                         lnet_finalize(ni, lntmsg, 0);
02675 
02676                         /* only error if lntmsg == NULL, otherwise we are just
02677                          * short circuiting the rdma process of 0 bytes */
02678                         kgnilnd_nak_rdma(conn, rxmsg->gnm_type,
02679                                         lntmsg == NULL ? -ENOENT : 0,
02680                                         rxmsg->gnm_u.get.gngm_cookie,
02681                                         ni->ni_nid);
02682                         RETURN(0);
02683                 }
02684 
02685                 if (lntmsg != NULL) {
02686                         /* Matched! */
02687                         kgnilnd_setup_rdma(ni, rx, lntmsg, mlen);
02688                 } else {
02689                         /* No match */
02690                         kgnilnd_nak_rdma(conn, rxmsg->gnm_type,
02691                                         -ENOENT,
02692                                         rxmsg->gnm_u.get.gngm_cookie,
02693                                         ni->ni_nid);
02694                 }
02695                 kgnilnd_consume_rx(rx);
02696                 RETURN(0);
02697         case GNILND_MSG_GET_REQ:
02698                 if (lntmsg != NULL) {
02699                         /* Matched! */
02700                         kgnilnd_setup_rdma(ni, rx, lntmsg, mlen);
02701                 } else {
02702                         /* No match */
02703                         kgnilnd_nak_rdma(conn, rxmsg->gnm_type,
02704                                         -ENOENT,
02705                                         rxmsg->gnm_u.get.gngm_cookie,
02706                                         ni->ni_nid);
02707                 }
02708                 kgnilnd_consume_rx(rx);
02709                 RETURN(0);
02710         }
02711         RETURN(0);
02712 }
02713 
02714 /* needs write_lock on kgn_peer_conn_lock held */
02715 int
02716 kgnilnd_check_conn_timeouts_locked(kgn_conn_t *conn)
02717 {
02718         unsigned long      timeout, keepalive;
02719         unsigned long      now = jiffies;
02720         unsigned long      newest_last_rx;
02721         kgn_tx_t          *tx;
02722 
02723         /* given that we found this conn hanging off a peer, it better damned
02724          * well be connected */
02725         LASSERTF(conn->gnc_state == GNILND_CONN_ESTABLISHED,
02726                  "conn 0x%p->%s with bad state%s\n", conn,
02727                  conn->gnc_peer ? libcfs_nid2str(conn->gnc_peer->gnp_nid)
02728                                : "<?>",
02729                  kgnilnd_conn_state2str(conn));
02730 
02731         CDEBUG(D_NET, "checking conn %p->%s timeout %d keepalive %d "
02732                       "rx_diff %lu tx_diff %lu\n",
02733                 conn, libcfs_nid2str(conn->gnc_peer->gnp_nid),
02734                 conn->gnc_timeout, GNILND_TO2KA(conn->gnc_timeout),
02735                 cfs_duration_sec(now - conn->gnc_last_rx_cq),
02736                 cfs_duration_sec(now - conn->gnc_last_tx));
02737 
02738         timeout = cfs_time_seconds(conn->gnc_timeout);
02739         keepalive = cfs_time_seconds(GNILND_TO2KA(conn->gnc_timeout));
02740 
02741         /* just in case our lack of RX msg processing is gumming up the works - give the
02742          * remove an extra chance */
02743 
02744         newest_last_rx = GNILND_LASTRX(conn);
02745 
02746         if (time_after_eq(now, newest_last_rx + timeout)) {
02747                 uint32_t level = D_CONSOLE|D_NETERROR;
02748 
02749                 if (conn->gnc_peer->gnp_down == GNILND_RCA_NODE_DOWN) {
02750                         level = D_NET;
02751                 }
02752                         GNIDBG_CONN(level, conn,
02753                         "No gnilnd traffic received from %s for %lu "
02754                         "seconds, terminating connection. Is node down? ",
02755                         libcfs_nid2str(conn->gnc_peer->gnp_nid),
02756                         cfs_duration_sec(now - newest_last_rx));
02757                 return -ETIMEDOUT;
02758         }
02759 
02760         /* we don't timeout on last_tx stalls - we are going to trust the
02761          * underlying network to let us know when sends are failing.
02762          * At worst, the peer will timeout our RX stamp and drop the connection
02763          * at that point. We'll then see his CLOSE or at worst his RX
02764          * stamp stop and drop the connection on our end */
02765 
02766         if (time_after_eq(now, conn->gnc_last_tx + keepalive)) {
02767                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "sending NOOP -> %s (%p idle %lu(%lu)) "
02768                        "last %lu/%lu/%lu %lus/%lus/%lus\n",
02769                        libcfs_nid2str(conn->gnc_peer->gnp_nid), conn,
02770                        cfs_duration_sec(jiffies - conn->gnc_last_tx),
02771                        keepalive,
02772                        conn->gnc_last_noop_want, conn->gnc_last_noop_sent,
02773                        conn->gnc_last_noop_cq,
02774                        cfs_duration_sec(jiffies - conn->gnc_last_noop_want),
02775                        cfs_duration_sec(jiffies - conn->gnc_last_noop_sent),
02776                        cfs_duration_sec(jiffies - conn->gnc_last_noop_cq));
02777                 set_mb(conn->gnc_last_noop_want, jiffies);
02778                 atomic_inc(&conn->gnc_reaper_noop);
02779                 if (CFS_FAIL_CHECK(CFS_FAIL_GNI_NOOP_SEND))
02780                         return 0;
02781 
02782                 tx = kgnilnd_new_tx_msg(GNILND_MSG_NOOP, conn->gnc_peer->gnp_net->gnn_ni->ni_nid);
02783                 if (tx == NULL)
02784                         return 0;
02785                 kgnilnd_queue_tx(conn, tx);
02786         }
02787 
02788         return 0;
02789 }
02790 
02791 /* needs write_lock on kgn_peer_conn_lock held */
02792 void
02793 kgnilnd_check_peer_timeouts_locked(kgn_peer_t *peer, struct list_head *todie,
02794                                     struct list_head *souls)
02795 {
02796         unsigned long           timeout;
02797         kgn_conn_t             *conn, *connN = NULL;
02798         kgn_tx_t               *tx, *txN;
02799         int                     rc = 0;
02800         int                     count = 0;
02801         int                     reconnect;
02802         int                     to_reconn;
02803         short                   releaseconn = 0;
02804         unsigned long           first_rx = 0;
02805         int                     purgatory_conn_cnt = 0;
02806 
02807         CDEBUG(D_NET, "checking peer 0x%p->%s for timeouts; interval %lus\n",
02808                 peer, libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid),
02809                 peer->gnp_reconnect_interval);
02810 
02811         timeout = cfs_time_seconds(MAX(*kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_timeout,
02812                                        GNILND_MIN_TIMEOUT));
02813 
02814         conn = kgnilnd_find_conn_locked(peer);
02815         if (conn) {
02816                 /* if there is a valid conn, check the queues for timeouts */
02817                 rc = kgnilnd_check_conn_timeouts_locked(conn);
02818                 if (rc) {
02819                         if (CFS_FAIL_CHECK(CFS_FAIL_GNI_RX_CLOSE_CLOSING)) {
02820                                 /* simulate a RX CLOSE after the timeout but before
02821                                  * the scheduler thread gets it */
02822                                 conn->gnc_close_recvd = GNILND_CLOSE_INJECT1;
02823                                 conn->gnc_peer_error = -ETIMEDOUT;
02824                         }
02825                         /* Once we mark closed, any of the scheduler threads could
02826                          * get it and move through before we hit the fail loc code */
02827                         kgnilnd_close_conn_locked(conn, rc);
02828                 } else {
02829                         /* first_rx is used to decide when to release a conn from purgatory.
02830                          */
02831                         first_rx = conn->gnc_first_rx;
02832                 }
02833         }
02834 
02835         /* now regardless of starting new conn, find tx on peer queue that
02836          * are old and smell bad - do this first so we don't trigger
02837          * reconnect on empty queue if we timeout all */
02838         list_for_each_entry_safe(tx, txN, &peer->gnp_tx_queue, tx_list) {
02839                 if (time_after_eq(jiffies, tx->tx_qtime + timeout)) {
02840                         if (count == 0) {
02841                                 LCONSOLE_INFO("could not send to %s due to connection"
02842                                        " setup failure after %lu seconds\n",
02843                                        libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid),
02844                                        cfs_duration_sec(jiffies - tx->tx_qtime));
02845                         }
02846                         kgnilnd_tx_del_state_locked(tx, peer, NULL,
02847                                                    GNILND_TX_ALLOCD);
02848                         list_add_tail(&tx->tx_list, todie);
02849                         count++;
02850                 }
02851         }
02852 
02853         if (count || peer->gnp_connecting == GNILND_PEER_KILL) {
02854                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "canceling %d tx for peer 0x%p->%s\n",
02855                         count, peer, libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid));
02856                 /* if we nuked all the TX, stop peer connection attempt (if there is one..) */
02857                 if (list_empty(&peer->gnp_tx_queue) ||
02858                         peer->gnp_connecting == GNILND_PEER_KILL) {
02859                         /* we pass down todie to use a common function - but we know there are
02860                          * no TX to add */
02861                         kgnilnd_cancel_peer_connect_locked(peer, todie);
02862                 }
02863         }
02864 
02865         /* Don't reconnect if we are still trying to clear out old conns.
02866          * This prevents us sending traffic on the new mbox before ensuring we are done
02867          * with the old one */
02868         reconnect = (peer->gnp_down == GNILND_RCA_NODE_UP) &&
02869                     (atomic_read(&peer->gnp_dirty_eps) == 0);
02870 
02871         /* fast reconnect after a timeout */
02872         to_reconn = !conn &&
02873                     (peer->gnp_last_errno == -ETIMEDOUT) &&
02874                     *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_fast_reconn;
02875 
02876         /* if we are not connected and there are tx on the gnp_tx_queue waiting
02877          * to be sent, we'll check the reconnect interval and fire up a new
02878          * connection request */
02879 
02880         if (reconnect &&
02881             (peer->gnp_connecting == GNILND_PEER_IDLE) &&
02882             (time_after_eq(jiffies, peer->gnp_reconnect_time)) &&
02883             (!list_empty(&peer->gnp_tx_queue) || to_reconn)) {
02884 
02885                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "starting connect to %s\n",
02886                         libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid));
02887                 LASSERTF(peer->gnp_connecting == GNILND_PEER_IDLE, "Peer was idle and we"
02888                         "have a write_lock, state issue %d\n", peer->gnp_connecting);
02889 
02890                 peer->gnp_connecting = GNILND_PEER_CONNECT;
02891                 kgnilnd_peer_addref(peer); /* extra ref for connd */
02892 
02893                 spin_lock(&peer->gnp_net->gnn_dev->gnd_connd_lock);
02894                 list_add_tail(&peer->gnp_connd_list,
02895                               &peer->gnp_net->gnn_dev->gnd_connd_peers);
02896                 spin_unlock(&peer->gnp_net->gnn_dev->gnd_connd_lock);
02897 
02898                 kgnilnd_schedule_dgram(peer->gnp_net->gnn_dev);
02899         }
02900 
02901         /* fail_loc to allow us to delay release of purgatory */
02902         if (CFS_FAIL_CHECK(CFS_FAIL_GNI_PURG_REL_DELAY))
02903                 return;
02904 
02905         /* This check allows us to verify that the new conn is actually being used. This allows us to
02906          * pull the old conns out of purgatory if they have actually seen traffic.
02907          * We only release a conn from purgatory during stack reset, admin command, or when a peer reconnects
02908          */
02909         if (first_rx &&
02910                 time_after(jiffies, first_rx + cfs_time_seconds(*kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_hardware_timeout))) {
02911                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "We can release peer %s conn's from purgatory %lu\n",
02912                         libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid), first_rx + cfs_time_seconds(*kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_hardware_timeout));
02913                 releaseconn = 1;
02914         }
02915 
02916         list_for_each_entry_safe (conn, connN, &peer->gnp_conns, gnc_list) {
02917         /* check for purgatory timeouts */
02918                 if (conn->gnc_in_purgatory) {
02919                         /* We cannot detach this conn from purgatory if it has not been closed so we reschedule it
02920                          * that way the next time we check it we can detach it from purgatory
02921                          */
02922 
02923                         if (conn->gnc_state != GNILND_CONN_DONE) {
02924                                 /* Skip over conns that are currently not DONE. If they arent already scheduled
02925                                  * for completion something in the state machine is broken.
02926                                  */
02927                                 continue;
02928                         }
02929 
02930                         /* We only detach a conn that is in purgatory if we have received a close message,
02931                          * we have a new valid connection that has successfully received data, or an admin
02932                          * command tells us we need to detach.
02933                          */
02934 
02935                         if (conn->gnc_close_recvd || releaseconn || conn->gnc_needs_detach) {
02936                                 unsigned long   waiting;
02937 
02938                                 waiting = (long) jiffies - conn->gnc_last_rx_cq;
02939 
02940                                 /* C.E: The remote peer is expected to close the
02941                                  * connection (see kgnilnd_check_conn_timeouts)
02942                                  * via the reaper thread and nuke out the MDD and
02943                                  * FMA resources after conn->gnc_timeout has expired
02944                                  * without an FMA RX */
02945                                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "Reconnected to %s in %lds or admin forced detach, dropping "
02946                                         " held resources\n",
02947                                         libcfs_nid2str(conn->gnc_peer->gnp_nid),
02948                                         cfs_duration_sec(waiting));
02949 
02950                                 kgnilnd_detach_purgatory_locked(conn, souls);
02951                         } else {
02952                                 purgatory_conn_cnt++;
02953                         }
02954                 }
02955         }
02956 
02957         /* If we have too many connections in purgatory we could run out of
02958          * resources. Limit the number of connections to a tunable number,
02959          * clean up to the minimum all in one fell swoop... there are
02960          * situations where dvs will retry tx's and we can eat up several
02961          * hundread connection requests at once.
02962          */
02963         if (purgatory_conn_cnt > *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_max_purgatory) {
02964                 list_for_each_entry_safe(conn, connN, &peer->gnp_conns,
02965                                          gnc_list) {
02966                         if (conn->gnc_in_purgatory &&
02967                             conn->gnc_state == GNILND_CONN_DONE) {
02968                                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "Dropping Held resource due to"
02969                                               " resource limits being hit\n");
02970                                 kgnilnd_detach_purgatory_locked(conn, souls);
02971 
02972                                 if (purgatory_conn_cnt-- <
02973                                     *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_max_purgatory)
02974                                         break;
02975                         }
02976                 }
02977         }
02978 
02979         return;
02980 }
02981 
02982 void
02983 kgnilnd_reaper_check(int idx)
02984 {
02985         struct list_head  *peers = &kgnilnd_data.kgn_peers[idx];
02986         struct list_head  *ctmp, *ctmpN;
02987         struct list_head   geriatrics;
02988         struct list_head   souls;
02989 
02990         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&geriatrics);
02991         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&souls);
02992 
02993         write_lock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
02994 
02995         list_for_each_safe(ctmp, ctmpN, peers) {
02996                 kgn_peer_t        *peer = NULL;
02997 
02998                 /* don't timeout stuff if the network is mucked or shutting down */
02999                 if (kgnilnd_check_hw_quiesce()) {
03000                         break;
03001                 }
03002                 peer = list_entry(ctmp, kgn_peer_t, gnp_list);
03003 
03004                 kgnilnd_check_peer_timeouts_locked(peer, &geriatrics, &souls);
03005         }
03006 
03007         write_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
03008 
03009         kgnilnd_txlist_done(&geriatrics, -EHOSTUNREACH);
03010         kgnilnd_release_purgatory_list(&souls);
03011 }
03012 
03013 void
03014 kgnilnd_update_reaper_timeout(long timeout)
03015 {
03016         LASSERT(timeout > 0);
03017 
03018         spin_lock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_reaper_lock);
03019 
03020         if (timeout < kgnilnd_data.kgn_new_min_timeout)
03021                 kgnilnd_data.kgn_new_min_timeout = timeout;
03022 
03023         spin_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_reaper_lock);
03024 }
03025 
03026 static void
03027 kgnilnd_reaper_poke_with_stick(unsigned long arg)
03028 {
03029         wake_up(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_reaper_waitq);
03030 }
03031 
03032 int
03033 kgnilnd_reaper(void *arg)
03034 {
03035         long               timeout;
03036         int                i;
03037         int                hash_index = 0;
03038         unsigned long      next_check_time = jiffies;
03039         long               current_min_timeout = MAX_SCHEDULE_TIMEOUT;
03040         struct timer_list  timer;
03041         DEFINE_WAIT(wait);
03042 
03043         cfs_block_allsigs();
03044 
03045         /* all gnilnd threads need to run fairly urgently */
03046         set_user_nice(current, *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_nice);
03047         spin_lock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_reaper_lock);
03048 
03049         while (!kgnilnd_data.kgn_shutdown) {
03050                 /* I wake up every 'p' seconds to check for timeouts on some
03051                  * more peers.  I try to check every connection 'n' times
03052                  * within the global minimum of all keepalive and timeout
03053                  * intervals, to ensure I attend to every connection within
03054                  * (n+1)/n times its timeout intervals. */
03055                 const int     p = GNILND_REAPER_THREAD_WAKE;
03056                 const int     n = GNILND_REAPER_NCHECKS;
03057                 int           chunk;
03058                 /* to quiesce or to not quiesce, that is the question */
03059                 if (unlikely(kgnilnd_data.kgn_quiesce_trigger)) {
03060                         spin_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_reaper_lock);
03061                         KGNILND_SPIN_QUIESCE;
03062                         spin_lock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_reaper_lock);
03063                 }
03064 
03065                 /* careful with the jiffy wrap... */
03066                 timeout = (long)(next_check_time - jiffies);
03067 
03068                 if (timeout > 0) {
03069                         prepare_to_wait(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_reaper_waitq, &wait,
03070                                         TASK_INTERRUPTIBLE);
03071                         spin_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_reaper_lock);
03072                         setup_timer(&timer, kgnilnd_reaper_poke_with_stick,
03073                                     next_check_time);
03074                         mod_timer(&timer, (long) jiffies + timeout);
03075 
03076                         /* check flag variables before committing */
03077                         if (!kgnilnd_data.kgn_shutdown &&
03078                             !kgnilnd_data.kgn_quiesce_trigger) {
03079                                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "schedule timeout %ld (%lu sec)\n",
03080                                        timeout, cfs_duration_sec(timeout));
03081                                 schedule();
03082                                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "awake after schedule\n");
03083                         }
03084 
03085                         del_singleshot_timer_sync(&timer);
03086                         spin_lock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_reaper_lock);
03087                         finish_wait(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_reaper_waitq, &wait);
03088                         continue;
03089                 }
03090 
03091                 /* new_min_timeout is set from the conn timeouts and keepalive
03092                  * this should end up with a min timeout of
03093                  * GNILND_TIMEOUT2KEEPALIVE(t) or roughly LND_TIMEOUT/2 */
03094                 if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_new_min_timeout < current_min_timeout) {
03095                         current_min_timeout = kgnilnd_data.kgn_new_min_timeout;
03096                         CDEBUG(D_NET, "Set new min timeout %ld\n",
03097                                current_min_timeout);
03098                 }
03099 
03100                 spin_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_reaper_lock);
03101 
03102                 /* Compute how many table entries to check now so I get round
03103                  * the whole table fast enough given that I do this at fixed
03104                  * intervals of 'p' seconds) */
03105                 chunk = *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_peer_hash_size;
03106                 if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_new_min_timeout > n * p)
03107                         chunk = (chunk * n * p) /
03108                                 kgnilnd_data.kgn_new_min_timeout;
03109                 if (chunk == 0)
03110                         chunk = 1;
03111                 for (i = 0; i < chunk; i++) {
03112                         kgnilnd_reaper_check(hash_index);
03113                         hash_index = (hash_index + 1) %
03114                                 *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_peer_hash_size;
03115                 }
03116                 next_check_time = (long) jiffies + cfs_time_seconds(p);
03117                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "next check at %lu or in %d sec\n", next_check_time, p);
03118 
03119                 spin_lock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_reaper_lock);
03120         }
03121 
03122         spin_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_reaper_lock);
03123 
03124         kgnilnd_thread_fini();
03125         return 0;
03126 }
03127 
03128 int
03129 kgnilnd_recv_bte_get(kgn_tx_t *tx) {
03130         unsigned niov, offset, nob;
03131         lnet_kiov_t     *kiov;
03132         lnet_msg_t *lntmsg = tx->tx_lntmsg[0];
03133         kgnilnd_parse_lnet_rdma(lntmsg, &niov, &offset, &nob, &kiov, tx->tx_nob_rdma);
03134 
03135         if (kiov != NULL) {
03136                 lnet_copy_flat2kiov(
03137                         niov, kiov, offset,
03138                         nob,
03139                         tx->tx_buffer_copy + tx->tx_offset, 0, nob);
03140         } else {
03141                 memcpy(tx->tx_buffer, tx->tx_buffer_copy + tx->tx_offset, nob);
03142         }
03143         return 0;
03144 }
03145 
03146 
03147 int
03148 kgnilnd_check_rdma_cq(kgn_device_t *dev)
03149 {
03150         gni_return_t           rrc;
03151         gni_post_descriptor_t *desc;
03152         __u64                  event_data;
03153         kgn_tx_ev_id_t         ev_id;
03154         char                   err_str[256];
03155         int                    should_retry, rc;
03156         long                   num_processed = 0;
03157         kgn_conn_t            *conn = NULL;
03158         kgn_tx_t              *tx = NULL;
03159         kgn_rdma_desc_t       *rdesc;
03160         unsigned int           rnob;
03161         __u64                  rcookie;
03162 
03163         for (;;) {
03164                 /* make sure we don't keep looping if we need to reset */
03165                 if (unlikely(kgnilnd_data.kgn_quiesce_trigger)) {
03166                         return num_processed;
03167                 }
03168                 rc = kgnilnd_mutex_trylock(&dev->gnd_cq_mutex);
03169                 if (!rc) {
03170                         /* we didn't get the mutex, so return that there is still work
03171                          * to be done */
03172                         return 1;
03173                 }
03174                 if (CFS_FAIL_CHECK(CFS_FAIL_GNI_DELAY_RDMA)) {
03175                         /* a bit gross - but we need a good way to test for
03176                          * delayed RDMA completions and the easiest way to do
03177                          * that is to delay the RDMA CQ events */
03178                         rrc = GNI_RC_NOT_DONE;
03179                 } else {
03180                         rrc = kgnilnd_cq_get_event(dev->gnd_snd_rdma_cqh, &event_data);
03181                 }
03182 
03183                 if (rrc == GNI_RC_NOT_DONE) {
03184                         kgnilnd_gl_mutex_unlock(&dev->gnd_cq_mutex);
03185                         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "SEND RDMA CQ %d empty processed %ld\n",
03186                                dev->gnd_id, num_processed);
03187                         return num_processed;
03188                 }
03189                 dev->gnd_sched_alive = jiffies;
03190                 num_processed++;
03191 
03192                 LASSERTF(!GNI_CQ_OVERRUN(event_data),
03193                         "this is bad, somehow our credits didn't protect us"
03194                         " from CQ overrun\n");
03195                 LASSERTF(GNI_CQ_GET_TYPE(event_data) == GNI_CQ_EVENT_TYPE_POST,
03196                         "rrc %d, GNI_CQ_GET_TYPE("LPX64") = "LPX64"\n", rrc,
03197                         event_data, GNI_CQ_GET_TYPE(event_data));
03198 
03199                 rrc = kgnilnd_get_completed(dev->gnd_snd_rdma_cqh, event_data,
03200                                             &desc);
03201                 kgnilnd_gl_mutex_unlock(&dev->gnd_cq_mutex);
03202 
03203                 /* XXX Nic: Need better error handling here... */
03204                 LASSERTF((rrc == GNI_RC_SUCCESS) ||
03205                           (rrc == GNI_RC_TRANSACTION_ERROR),
03206                          "rrc %d\n", rrc);
03207 
03208                 ev_id.txe_cookie = desc->post_id;
03209 
03210                 kgnilnd_validate_tx_ev_id(&ev_id, &tx, &conn);
03211 
03212                 if (conn == NULL || tx == NULL) {
03213                         /* either conn or tx was already nuked and this is a "late"
03214                          * completion, so drop it */
03215                         continue;
03216                 }
03217 
03218                 GNITX_ASSERTF(tx, tx->tx_msg.gnm_type == GNILND_MSG_PUT_DONE ||
03219                         tx->tx_msg.gnm_type == GNILND_MSG_GET_DONE ||
03220                         tx->tx_msg.gnm_type == GNILND_MSG_PUT_DONE_REV ||
03221                         tx->tx_msg.gnm_type == GNILND_MSG_GET_DONE_REV,
03222                         "tx %p with type %d\n", tx, tx->tx_msg.gnm_type);
03223 
03224                 GNIDBG_TX(D_NET, tx, "RDMA completion for %d bytes", tx->tx_nob);
03225 
03226                 if (tx->tx_msg.gnm_type == GNILND_MSG_GET_DONE_REV) {
03227                         lnet_set_reply_msg_len(NULL, tx->tx_lntmsg[1],
03228                                                tx->tx_msg.gnm_u.completion.gncm_retval);
03229                 }
03230 
03231                 rc = 0;
03232                 if (tx->tx_msg.gnm_type == GNILND_MSG_GET_DONE_REV && desc->status == GNI_RC_SUCCESS) {
03233                         if (tx->tx_buffer_copy != NULL)
03234                                 kgnilnd_recv_bte_get(tx);
03235                         rc = kgnilnd_verify_rdma_cksum(tx, tx->tx_putinfo.gnpam_payload_cksum, tx->tx_nob_rdma);
03236                 }
03237 
03238                 if (tx->tx_msg.gnm_type == GNILND_MSG_PUT_DONE_REV && desc->status == GNI_RC_SUCCESS) {
03239                         if (tx->tx_buffer_copy != NULL)
03240                                 kgnilnd_recv_bte_get(tx);
03241                         rc = kgnilnd_verify_rdma_cksum(tx, tx->tx_getinfo.gngm_payload_cksum, tx->tx_nob_rdma);
03242                 }
03243 
03244                 /* remove from rdmaq */
03245                 kgnilnd_conn_mutex_lock(&conn->gnc_rdma_mutex);
03246                 spin_lock(&conn->gnc_list_lock);
03247                 kgnilnd_tx_del_state_locked(tx, NULL, conn, GNILND_TX_ALLOCD);
03248                 spin_unlock(&conn->gnc_list_lock);
03249                 kgnilnd_conn_mutex_unlock(&conn->gnc_rdma_mutex);
03250 
03251                 if (CFS_FAIL_CHECK(CFS_FAIL_GNI_RDMA_CQ_ERROR)) {
03252                         event_data = 1LL << 48;
03253                         rc = 1;
03254                 }
03255 
03256                 if (likely(desc->status == GNI_RC_SUCCESS) && rc == 0) {
03257                         atomic_inc(&dev->gnd_rdma_ntx);
03258                         atomic64_add(tx->tx_nob, &dev->gnd_rdma_txbytes);
03259                         /* transaction succeeded, add into fmaq */
03260                         kgnilnd_queue_tx(conn, tx);
03261                         kgnilnd_peer_alive(conn->gnc_peer);
03262 
03263                         /* drop ref from kgnilnd_validate_tx_ev_id */
03264                         kgnilnd_admin_decref(conn->gnc_tx_in_use);
03265                         kgnilnd_conn_decref(conn);
03266 
03267                         continue;
03268                 }
03269 
03270                 /* fall through to the TRANSACTION_ERROR case */
03271                 tx->tx_retrans++;
03272 
03273                 /* get stringified version for log messages */
03274                 kgnilnd_cq_error_str(event_data, &err_str, 256);
03275                 kgnilnd_cq_error_recoverable(event_data, &should_retry);
03276 
03277                 /* make sure we are not off in the weeds with this tx */
03278                 if (tx->tx_retrans >
03279                         *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_max_retransmits) {
03280                         GNIDBG_TX(D_NETERROR, tx,
03281                                "giving up on TX, too many retries", NULL);
03282                         should_retry = 0;
03283                 }
03284 
03285                 GNIDBG_TX(D_NETERROR, tx, "RDMA %s error (%s)",
03286                         should_retry ? "transient" : "unrecoverable", err_str);
03287 
03288                 if (tx->tx_msg.gnm_type == GNILND_MSG_PUT_DONE ||
03289                     tx->tx_msg.gnm_type == GNILND_MSG_GET_DONE_REV) {
03290                         rdesc    = &tx->tx_putinfo.gnpam_desc;
03291                         rnob     = tx->tx_putinfo.gnpam_desc.gnrd_nob;
03292                         rcookie  = tx->tx_putinfo.gnpam_dst_cookie;
03293                 } else {
03294                         rdesc    = &tx->tx_getinfo.gngm_desc;
03295                         rnob     = tx->tx_lntmsg[0]->msg_len;
03296                         rcookie  = tx->tx_getinfo.gngm_cookie;
03297                 }
03298 
03299                 if (should_retry) {
03300                         kgnilnd_rdma(tx,
03301                                      tx->tx_msg.gnm_type,
03302                                      rdesc,
03303                                      rnob, rcookie);
03304                 } else {
03305                         kgnilnd_nak_rdma(conn,
03306                                          tx->tx_msg.gnm_type,
03307                                          -EFAULT,
03308                                          rcookie,
03309                                          tx->tx_msg.gnm_srcnid);
03310                         kgnilnd_tx_done(tx, -GNILND_NOPURG);
03311                         kgnilnd_close_conn(conn, -ECOMM);
03312                 }
03313 
03314                 /* drop ref from kgnilnd_validate_tx_ev_id */
03315                 kgnilnd_admin_decref(conn->gnc_tx_in_use);
03316                 kgnilnd_conn_decref(conn);
03317         }
03318 }
03319 
03320 int
03321 kgnilnd_check_fma_send_cq(kgn_device_t *dev)
03322 {
03323         gni_return_t           rrc;
03324         __u64                  event_data;
03325         kgn_tx_ev_id_t         ev_id;
03326         kgn_tx_t              *tx = NULL;
03327         kgn_conn_t            *conn = NULL;
03328         int                    queued_fma, saw_reply, rc;
03329         long                   num_processed = 0;
03330 
03331         for (;;) {
03332                 /* make sure we don't keep looping if we need to reset */
03333                 if (unlikely(kgnilnd_data.kgn_quiesce_trigger)) {
03334                         return num_processed;
03335                 }
03336 
03337                 rc = kgnilnd_mutex_trylock(&dev->gnd_cq_mutex);
03338                 if (!rc) {
03339                         /* we didn't get the mutex, so return that there is still work
03340                          * to be done */
03341                         return 1;
03342                 }
03343 
03344                 rrc = kgnilnd_cq_get_event(dev->gnd_snd_fma_cqh, &event_data);
03345                 kgnilnd_gl_mutex_unlock(&dev->gnd_cq_mutex);
03346 
03347                 if (rrc == GNI_RC_NOT_DONE) {
03348                         CDEBUG(D_INFO,
03349                                "SMSG send CQ %d not ready (data "LPX64") "
03350                                "processed %ld\n", dev->gnd_id, event_data,
03351                                num_processed);
03352                         return num_processed;
03353                 }
03354 
03355                 dev->gnd_sched_alive = jiffies;
03356                 num_processed++;
03357 
03358                 LASSERTF(!GNI_CQ_OVERRUN(event_data),
03359                         "this is bad, somehow our credits didn't "
03360                         "protect us from CQ overrun\n");
03361                 LASSERTF(GNI_CQ_GET_TYPE(event_data) == GNI_CQ_EVENT_TYPE_SMSG,
03362                         "rrc %d, GNI_CQ_GET_TYPE("LPX64") = "LPX64"\n", rrc,
03363                         event_data, GNI_CQ_GET_TYPE(event_data));
03364 
03365                 /* if SMSG couldn't handle an error, time for conn to die */
03366                 if (unlikely(rrc == GNI_RC_TRANSACTION_ERROR)) {
03367                         char            err_str[256];
03368 
03369                         /* need to take the write_lock to ensure atomicity
03370                          * on the conn state if we need to close it */
03371                         write_lock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
03372                         conn = kgnilnd_cqid2conn_locked(GNI_CQ_GET_INST_ID(event_data));
03373                         if (conn == NULL) {
03374                                 /* Conn was destroyed? */
03375                                 CDEBUG(D_NET,
03376                                         "SMSG CQID lookup "LPX64" failed\n",
03377                                         GNI_CQ_GET_INST_ID(event_data));
03378                                 write_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
03379                                 continue;
03380                         }
03381 
03382                         kgnilnd_cq_error_str(event_data, &err_str, 256);
03383                         CNETERR("SMSG send error to %s: rc %d (%s)\n",
03384                                libcfs_nid2str(conn->gnc_peer->gnp_nid),
03385                                rrc, err_str);
03386                         kgnilnd_close_conn_locked(conn, -ECOMM);
03387 
03388                         write_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
03389 
03390                         /* no need to process rest of this tx -
03391                          * it is getting canceled */
03392                         continue;
03393                 }
03394 
03395                 /* fall through to GNI_RC_SUCCESS case */
03396                 ev_id.txe_smsg_id = GNI_CQ_GET_MSG_ID(event_data);
03397 
03398                 kgnilnd_validate_tx_ev_id(&ev_id, &tx, &conn);
03399                 if (conn == NULL || tx == NULL) {
