03400                         /* either conn or tx was already nuked and this is a "late"
03401                          * completion, so drop it */
03402                         continue;
03403                 }
03404 
03405                 tx->tx_conn->gnc_last_tx_cq = jiffies;
03406                 if (tx->tx_msg.gnm_type == GNILND_MSG_NOOP) {
03407                         set_mb(conn->gnc_last_noop_cq, jiffies);
03408                 }
03409 
03410                 /* lock tx_list_state and tx_state */
03411                 kgnilnd_conn_mutex_lock(&conn->gnc_smsg_mutex);
03412                 spin_lock(&tx->tx_conn->gnc_list_lock);
03413 
03414                 GNITX_ASSERTF(tx, tx->tx_list_state == GNILND_TX_LIVE_FMAQ,
03415                                 "state not GNILND_TX_LIVE_FMAQ", NULL);
03416                 GNITX_ASSERTF(tx, tx->tx_state & GNILND_TX_WAITING_COMPLETION,
03417                         "not waiting for completion", NULL);
03418 
03419                 GNIDBG_TX(D_NET, tx, "SMSG complete tx_state %x rc %d",
03420                         tx->tx_state, rrc);
03421 
03422                 tx->tx_state &= ~GNILND_TX_WAITING_COMPLETION;
03423 
03424                 /* This will trigger other FMA sends that were
03425                  * pending this completion */
03426                 queued_fma = !list_empty(&tx->tx_conn->gnc_fmaq);
03427 
03428                 /* we either did not expect reply or we already got it */
03429                 saw_reply = !(tx->tx_state & GNILND_TX_WAITING_REPLY);
03430 
03431                 spin_unlock(&tx->tx_conn->gnc_list_lock);
03432                 kgnilnd_conn_mutex_unlock(&conn->gnc_smsg_mutex);
03433 
03434                 if (queued_fma) {
03435                         CDEBUG(D_NET, "scheduling conn 0x%p->%s for fmaq\n",
03436                                conn,
03437                                libcfs_nid2str(conn->gnc_peer->gnp_nid));
03438                         kgnilnd_schedule_conn(conn);
03439                 }
03440 
03441                 /* If saw_reply is false as soon as gnc_list_lock is dropped the tx could be nuked
03442                  * If saw_reply is true we know that the tx is safe to use as the other thread
03443                  * is already finished with it.
03444                  */
03445 
03446                 if (saw_reply) {
03447                         /* no longer need to track on the live_fmaq */
03448                         kgnilnd_tx_del_state_locked(tx, NULL, tx->tx_conn, GNILND_TX_ALLOCD);
03449 
03450                         if (tx->tx_state & GNILND_TX_PENDING_RDMA) {
03451                                 /* we already got reply & were waiting for
03452                                  * completion of initial send */
03453                                 /* to initiate RDMA transaction */
03454                                 GNIDBG_TX(D_NET, tx,
03455                                          "Pending RDMA 0x%p type 0x%02x",
03456                                          tx->tx_msg.gnm_type);
03457                                 tx->tx_state &= ~GNILND_TX_PENDING_RDMA;
03458                                 rc = kgnilnd_send_mapped_tx(tx, 0);
03459                                 GNITX_ASSERTF(tx, rc == 0, "RDMA send failed: %d\n", rc);
03460                         } else {
03461                                 /* we are done with this tx */
03462                                 GNIDBG_TX(D_NET, tx,
03463                                          "Done with tx type 0x%02x",
03464                                          tx->tx_msg.gnm_type);
03465                                 kgnilnd_tx_done(tx, tx->tx_rc);
03466                         }
03467                 }
03468 
03469                 /* drop ref from kgnilnd_validate_tx_ev_id */
03470                 kgnilnd_admin_decref(conn->gnc_tx_in_use);
03471                 kgnilnd_conn_decref(conn);
03472 
03473                 /* if we are waiting for a REPLY, we'll handle the tx then */
03474         } /* end for loop */
03475 }
03476 
03477 int
03478 kgnilnd_check_fma_rcv_cq(kgn_device_t *dev)
03479 {
03480         kgn_conn_t         *conn;
03481         gni_return_t        rrc;
03482         __u64               event_data;
03483         long                num_processed = 0;
03484         struct list_head   *conns;
03485         struct list_head   *tmp;
03486         int                 rc;
03487 
03488         for (;;) {
03489                 /* make sure we don't keep looping if we need to reset */
03490                 if (unlikely(kgnilnd_data.kgn_quiesce_trigger)) {
03491                         return num_processed;
03492                 }
03493 
03494                 rc = kgnilnd_mutex_trylock(&dev->gnd_cq_mutex);
03495                 if (!rc) {
03496                         /* we didn't get the mutex, so return that there is still work
03497                          * to be done */
03498                         return 1;
03499                 }
03500                 rrc = kgnilnd_cq_get_event(dev->gnd_rcv_fma_cqh, &event_data);
03501                 kgnilnd_gl_mutex_unlock(&dev->gnd_cq_mutex);
03502 
03503                 if (rrc == GNI_RC_NOT_DONE) {
03504                         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "SMSG RX CQ %d empty data "LPX64" "
03505                                 "processed %ld\n",
03506                                 dev->gnd_id, event_data, num_processed);
03507                         return num_processed;
03508                 }
03509                 dev->gnd_sched_alive = jiffies;
03510                 num_processed++;
03511 
03512                 /* this is the only CQ that can really handle transient
03513                  * CQ errors */
03514                 if (CFS_FAIL_CHECK(CFS_FAIL_GNI_CQ_GET_EVENT)) {
03515                         rrc = cfs_fail_val ? cfs_fail_val
03516                                            : GNI_RC_ERROR_RESOURCE;
03517                         if (rrc == GNI_RC_ERROR_RESOURCE) {
03518                                 /* set overrun too */
03519                                 event_data |= (1UL << 63);
03520                                 LASSERTF(GNI_CQ_OVERRUN(event_data),
03521                                          "(1UL << 63) is no longer the bit to"
03522                                          "set to indicate CQ_OVERRUN\n");
03523                         }
03524                 }
03525                 /* sender should get error event too and take care
03526                 of failed transaction by re-transmitting */
03527                 if (rrc == GNI_RC_TRANSACTION_ERROR) {
03528                         CDEBUG(D_NET, "SMSG RX CQ error "LPX64"\n", event_data);
03529                         continue;
03530                 }
03531 
03532                 if (likely(!GNI_CQ_OVERRUN(event_data))) {
03533                         read_lock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
03534                         conn = kgnilnd_cqid2conn_locked(
03535                                                  GNI_CQ_GET_INST_ID(event_data));
03536                         if (conn == NULL) {
03537                                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "SMSG RX CQID lookup "LPU64" "
03538                                         "failed, dropping event "LPX64"\n",
03539                                         GNI_CQ_GET_INST_ID(event_data),
03540                                         event_data);
03541                         } else {
03542                                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "SMSG RX: CQID "LPU64" "
03543                                        "conn %p->%s\n",
03544                                         GNI_CQ_GET_INST_ID(event_data),
03545                                         conn, conn->gnc_peer ?
03546                                         libcfs_nid2str(conn->gnc_peer->gnp_nid) :
03547                                         "<?>");
03548 
03549                                 conn->gnc_last_rx_cq = jiffies;
03550 
03551                                 /* stash first rx so we can clear out purgatory.
03552                                  */
03553                                 if (conn->gnc_first_rx == 0) {
03554                                         conn->gnc_first_rx = jiffies;
03555                                 }
03556                                 kgnilnd_peer_alive(conn->gnc_peer);
03557                                 kgnilnd_schedule_conn(conn);
03558                         }
03559                         read_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
03560                         continue;
03561                 }
03562 
03563                 /* FMA CQ has overflowed: check ALL conns */
03564                 CNETERR("SMSG RX CQ overflow: scheduling ALL "
03565                        "conns on device %d\n", dev->gnd_id);
03566 
03567                 for (rc = 0; rc < *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_peer_hash_size; rc++) {
03568 
03569                         read_lock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
03570                         conns = &kgnilnd_data.kgn_conns[rc];
03571 
03572                         list_for_each(tmp, conns) {
03573                                 conn = list_entry(tmp, kgn_conn_t,
03574                                                   gnc_hashlist);
03575 
03576                                 if (conn->gnc_device == dev) {
03577                                         kgnilnd_schedule_conn(conn);
03578                                         conn->gnc_last_rx_cq = jiffies;
03579                                 }
03580                         }
03581 
03582                         /* don't block write lockers for too long... */
03583                         read_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
03584                 }
03585         }
03586 }
03587 
03588 /* try_map_if_full should only be used when processing TX from list of
03589  * backlog TX waiting on mappings to free up
03590  *
03591  * Return Codes:
03592  *  try_map_if_full = 0: 0 (sent or queued), (-|+)errno failure of kgnilnd_sendmsg
03593  *  try_map_if_full = 1: 0 (sent), -ENOMEM for caller to requeue, (-|+)errno failure of kgnilnd_sendmsg */
03594 
03595 int
03596 kgnilnd_send_mapped_tx(kgn_tx_t *tx, int try_map_if_full)
03597 {
03598         /* slight bit of race if multiple people calling, but at worst we'll have
03599          * order altered just a bit... which would not be determenistic anyways */
03600         int     rc = atomic_read(&tx->tx_conn->gnc_device->gnd_nq_map);
03601 
03602         GNIDBG_TX(D_NET, tx, "try %d nq_map %d", try_map_if_full, rc);
03603 
03604         /* We know that we have a GART reservation that should guarantee forward progress.
03605          * This means we don't need to take any extraordinary efforts if we are failing
03606          * mappings here - even if we are holding a very small number of these. */
03607 
03608         if (try_map_if_full || (rc == 0)) {
03609                 rc = kgnilnd_map_buffer(tx);
03610         }
03611 
03612         /* rc should be 0 if we mapped successfully here, if non-zero
03613          * we are queueing */
03614         if (rc != 0) {
03615                 /* if try_map_if_full set, they handle requeuing */
03616                 if (unlikely(try_map_if_full)) {
03617                         RETURN(rc);
03618                 } else {
03619                         spin_lock(&tx->tx_conn->gnc_device->gnd_lock);
03620                         kgnilnd_tx_add_state_locked(tx, NULL, tx->tx_conn, GNILND_TX_MAPQ, 1);
03621                         spin_unlock(&tx->tx_conn->gnc_device->gnd_lock);
03622                         /* make sure we wake up sched to run this */
03623                         kgnilnd_schedule_device(tx->tx_conn->gnc_device);
03624                         /* return 0 as this is now queued for later sending */
03625                         RETURN(0);
03626                 }
03627         }
03628 
03629         switch (tx->tx_msg.gnm_type) {
03630         default:
03631                 LBUG();
03632                 break;
03633         /* GET_REQ and PUT_ACK are outbound messages sending our mapping key to
03634          * remote node where the RDMA will be started
03635          * Special case -EAGAIN logic - this should just queued as if the mapping couldn't
03636          * be satisified. The rest of the errors are "hard" errors that require
03637          * upper layers to handle themselves.
03638          * If kgnilnd_post_rdma returns a resource error, kgnilnd_rdma will put
03639          * the tx back on the TX_MAPQ. When this tx is pulled back off the MAPQ,
03640          * it's gnm_type will now be GNILND_MSG_PUT_DONE or
03641          * GNILND_MSG_GET_DONE_REV.
03642          */
03643         case GNILND_MSG_GET_REQ:
03644                 tx->tx_msg.gnm_u.get.gngm_desc.gnrd_key = tx->tx_map_key;
03645                 tx->tx_msg.gnm_u.get.gngm_cookie = tx->tx_id.txe_cookie;
03646                 tx->tx_msg.gnm_u.get.gngm_desc.gnrd_addr = (__u64)((unsigned long)tx->tx_buffer);
03647                 tx->tx_msg.gnm_u.get.gngm_desc.gnrd_nob = tx->tx_nob;
03648                 tx->tx_state = GNILND_TX_WAITING_COMPLETION | GNILND_TX_WAITING_REPLY;
03649                 if (CFS_FAIL_CHECK(CFS_FAIL_GNI_GET_REQ_AGAIN)) {
03650                         tx->tx_state |= GNILND_TX_FAIL_SMSG;
03651                 }
03652                 /* redirect to FMAQ on failure, no need to infinite loop here in MAPQ */
03653                 rc = kgnilnd_sendmsg(tx, NULL, 0, &tx->tx_conn->gnc_list_lock, GNILND_TX_FMAQ);
03654                 break;
03655         case GNILND_MSG_PUT_ACK:
03656                 tx->tx_msg.gnm_u.putack.gnpam_desc.gnrd_key = tx->tx_map_key;
03657                 tx->tx_state = GNILND_TX_WAITING_COMPLETION | GNILND_TX_WAITING_REPLY;
03658                 if (CFS_FAIL_CHECK(CFS_FAIL_GNI_PUT_ACK_AGAIN)) {
03659                         tx->tx_state |= GNILND_TX_FAIL_SMSG;
03660                 }
03661                 /* redirect to FMAQ on failure, no need to infinite loop here in MAPQ */
03662                 rc = kgnilnd_sendmsg(tx, NULL, 0, &tx->tx_conn->gnc_list_lock, GNILND_TX_FMAQ);
03663                 break;
03664 
03665         /* PUT_REQ and GET_DONE are where we do the actual RDMA */
03666         case GNILND_MSG_PUT_DONE:
03667         case GNILND_MSG_PUT_REQ:
03668                 rc = kgnilnd_rdma(tx, GNILND_MSG_PUT_DONE,
03669                              &tx->tx_putinfo.gnpam_desc,
03670                              tx->tx_putinfo.gnpam_desc.gnrd_nob,
03671                              tx->tx_putinfo.gnpam_dst_cookie);
03672                 RETURN(try_map_if_full ? rc : 0);
03673                 break;
03674         case GNILND_MSG_GET_DONE:
03675                 rc = kgnilnd_rdma(tx, GNILND_MSG_GET_DONE,
03676                              &tx->tx_getinfo.gngm_desc,
03677                              tx->tx_lntmsg[0]->msg_len,
03678                              tx->tx_getinfo.gngm_cookie);
03679                 RETURN(try_map_if_full ? rc : 0);
03680                 break;
03681         case GNILND_MSG_PUT_REQ_REV:
03682                 tx->tx_msg.gnm_u.get.gngm_desc.gnrd_key = tx->tx_map_key;
03683                 tx->tx_msg.gnm_u.get.gngm_cookie = tx->tx_id.txe_cookie;
03684                 tx->tx_msg.gnm_u.get.gngm_desc.gnrd_addr = (__u64)((unsigned long)tx->tx_buffer);
03685                 tx->tx_msg.gnm_u.get.gngm_desc.gnrd_nob = tx->tx_nob;
03686                 tx->tx_state = GNILND_TX_WAITING_COMPLETION | GNILND_TX_WAITING_REPLY;
03687                 kgnilnd_compute_rdma_cksum(tx, tx->tx_nob);
03688                 tx->tx_msg.gnm_u.get.gngm_payload_cksum = tx->tx_msg.gnm_payload_cksum;
03689 
03690                 rc = kgnilnd_sendmsg(tx, NULL, 0, &tx->tx_conn->gnc_list_lock, GNILND_TX_FMAQ);
03691                 break;
03692         case GNILND_MSG_PUT_DONE_REV:
03693                 rc = kgnilnd_rdma(tx, GNILND_MSG_PUT_DONE_REV,
03694                              &tx->tx_getinfo.gngm_desc,
03695                              tx->tx_nob,
03696                              tx->tx_getinfo.gngm_cookie);
03697                 RETURN(try_map_if_full ? rc : 0);
03698                 break;
03699         case GNILND_MSG_GET_ACK_REV:
03700                 tx->tx_msg.gnm_u.putack.gnpam_desc.gnrd_key = tx->tx_map_key;
03701                 tx->tx_state = GNILND_TX_WAITING_COMPLETION | GNILND_TX_WAITING_REPLY;
03702                 /* LNET_GETS are a special case for parse */
03703                 kgnilnd_compute_rdma_cksum(tx, tx->tx_msg.gnm_u.putack.gnpam_desc.gnrd_nob);
03704                 tx->tx_msg.gnm_u.putack.gnpam_payload_cksum = tx->tx_msg.gnm_payload_cksum;
03705 
03706                 if (CFS_FAIL_CHECK(CFS_FAIL_GNI_PUT_ACK_AGAIN))
03707                         tx->tx_state |= GNILND_TX_FAIL_SMSG;
03708 
03709                 /* redirect to FMAQ on failure, no need to infinite loop here in MAPQ */
03710                 rc = kgnilnd_sendmsg(tx, NULL, 0, &tx->tx_conn->gnc_list_lock, GNILND_TX_FMAQ);
03711                 break;
03712         case GNILND_MSG_GET_DONE_REV:
03713         case GNILND_MSG_GET_REQ_REV:
03714                 rc = kgnilnd_rdma(tx, GNILND_MSG_GET_DONE_REV,
03715                                 &tx->tx_putinfo.gnpam_desc,
03716                                 tx->tx_putinfo.gnpam_desc.gnrd_nob,
03717                                 tx->tx_putinfo.gnpam_dst_cookie);
03718                 RETURN(try_map_if_full ? rc : 0);
03719                 break;
03720         }
03721 
03722         RETURN(rc);
03723 }
03724 
03725 void
03726 kgnilnd_process_fmaq(kgn_conn_t *conn)
03727 {
03728         int           more_to_do = 0;
03729         kgn_tx_t     *tx = NULL;
03730         void         *buffer = NULL;
03731         unsigned int  nob = 0;
03732         int           rc;
03733 
03734         /* NB 1. kgnilnd_sendmsg() may fail if I'm out of credits right now.
03735          *       However I will be rescheduled by an FMA completion event
03736          *       when I eventually get some.
03737          * NB 2. Sampling gnc_state here races with setting it elsewhere.
03738          *       But it doesn't matter if I try to send a "real" message just
03739          *       as I start closing because I'll get scheduled to send the
03740          *       close anyway. */
03741 
03742         /* Short circuit if the ep_handle is null we cant send anyway. */
03743         if (conn->gnc_ephandle == NULL)
03744                 return;
03745 
03746         LASSERTF(!conn->gnc_close_sent, "Conn %p close was sent\n", conn);
03747 
03748         spin_lock(&conn->gnc_list_lock);
03749 
03750         if (list_empty(&conn->gnc_fmaq)) {
03751                 int     keepalive = GNILND_TO2KA(conn->gnc_timeout);
03752 
03753                 spin_unlock(&conn->gnc_list_lock);
03754 
03755                 if (time_after_eq(jiffies, conn->gnc_last_tx + cfs_time_seconds(keepalive))) {
03756                         CDEBUG(D_NET, "sending NOOP -> %s (%p idle %lu(%d)) "
03757                                "last %lu/%lu/%lu %lus/%lus/%lus\n",
03758                                libcfs_nid2str(conn->gnc_peer->gnp_nid), conn,
03759                                cfs_duration_sec(jiffies - conn->gnc_last_tx),
03760                                keepalive,
03761                                conn->gnc_last_noop_want, conn->gnc_last_noop_sent,
03762                                conn->gnc_last_noop_cq,
03763                                cfs_duration_sec(jiffies - conn->gnc_last_noop_want),
03764                                cfs_duration_sec(jiffies - conn->gnc_last_noop_sent),
03765                                cfs_duration_sec(jiffies - conn->gnc_last_noop_cq));
03766                         atomic_inc(&conn->gnc_sched_noop);
03767                         set_mb(conn->gnc_last_noop_want, jiffies);
03768 
03769                         if (CFS_FAIL_CHECK(CFS_FAIL_GNI_NOOP_SEND))
03770                                 return;
03771 
03772                         tx = kgnilnd_new_tx_msg(GNILND_MSG_NOOP, conn->gnc_peer->gnp_net->gnn_ni->ni_nid);
03773                         if (tx != NULL) {
03774                                 int     rc;
03775 
03776                                 rc = kgnilnd_set_tx_id(tx, conn);
03777                                 if (rc != 0) {
03778                                         kgnilnd_tx_done(tx, rc);
03779                                         return;
03780                                 }
03781                         }
03782                 }
03783         } else {
03784                 tx = list_first_entry(&conn->gnc_fmaq, kgn_tx_t, tx_list);
03785                 /* move from fmaq to allocd, kgnilnd_sendmsg will move to live_fmaq */
03786                 kgnilnd_tx_del_state_locked(tx, NULL, conn, GNILND_TX_ALLOCD);
03787                 more_to_do = !list_empty(&conn->gnc_fmaq);
03788                 spin_unlock(&conn->gnc_list_lock);
03789         }
03790 
03791         /* if there is no real TX or no NOOP to send, bail */
03792         if (tx == NULL) {
03793                 return;
03794         }
03795 
03796         if (!tx->tx_retrans)
03797                 tx->tx_cred_wait = jiffies;
03798 
03799         GNITX_ASSERTF(tx, tx->tx_id.txe_smsg_id != 0,
03800                       "tx with zero id", NULL);
03801 
03802         CDEBUG(D_NET, "sending regular msg: %p, type %s(0x%02x), cookie "LPX64"\n",
03803                tx, kgnilnd_msgtype2str(tx->tx_msg.gnm_type),
03804                tx->tx_msg.gnm_type, tx->tx_id.txe_cookie);
03805 
03806         rc = 0;
03807 
03808         switch (tx->tx_msg.gnm_type) {
03809         default:
03810                 LBUG();
03811 
03812         case GNILND_MSG_NOOP:
03813         case GNILND_MSG_CLOSE:
03814         case GNILND_MSG_IMMEDIATE:
03815                 tx->tx_state = GNILND_TX_WAITING_COMPLETION;
03816                 buffer = tx->tx_buffer;
03817                 nob = tx->tx_nob;
03818                 break;
03819 
03820         case GNILND_MSG_GET_DONE:
03821         case GNILND_MSG_PUT_DONE:
03822         case GNILND_MSG_PUT_DONE_REV:
03823         case GNILND_MSG_GET_DONE_REV:
03824         case GNILND_MSG_PUT_NAK:
03825         case GNILND_MSG_GET_NAK:
03826         case GNILND_MSG_GET_NAK_REV:
03827         case GNILND_MSG_PUT_NAK_REV:
03828                 tx->tx_state = GNILND_TX_WAITING_COMPLETION;
03829                 break;
03830 
03831         case GNILND_MSG_PUT_REQ:
03832         case GNILND_MSG_GET_REQ_REV:
03833                 tx->tx_msg.gnm_u.putreq.gnprm_cookie = tx->tx_id.txe_cookie;
03834 
03835         case GNILND_MSG_PUT_ACK:
03836         case GNILND_MSG_PUT_REQ_REV:
03837         case GNILND_MSG_GET_ACK_REV:
03838         case GNILND_MSG_GET_REQ:
03839                 /* This is really only to handle the retransmit of SMSG once these
03840                  * two messages are setup in send_mapped_tx */
03841                 tx->tx_state = GNILND_TX_WAITING_COMPLETION | GNILND_TX_WAITING_REPLY;
03842                 break;
03843         }
03844 
03845         if (likely(rc == 0)) {
03846                 rc = kgnilnd_sendmsg(tx, buffer, nob, &conn->gnc_list_lock, GNILND_TX_FMAQ);
03847         }
03848 
03849         if (rc > 0) {
03850                 /* don't explicitly reschedule here - we are short credits and will rely on
03851                  * kgnilnd_sendmsg to resched the conn if need be */
03852                 more_to_do = 0;
03853         } else if (rc < 0) {
03854                 /* bail: it wasn't sent and we didn't get EAGAIN indicating we should retrans
03855                  * almost certainly a software bug, but lets play nice with the other kids */
03856                 kgnilnd_tx_done(tx, rc);
03857                 /* just for fun, kick peer in arse - resetting conn might help to correct
03858                  * this almost certainly buggy software caused return code */
03859                 kgnilnd_close_conn(conn, rc);
03860         }
03861 
03862         if (more_to_do) {
03863                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "Rescheduling %p (more to do)\n", conn);
03864                 kgnilnd_schedule_conn(conn);
03865         }
03866 }
03867 
03868 int
03869 kgnilnd_process_rdmaq(kgn_device_t *dev)
03870 {
03871         int               found_work = 0;
03872         kgn_tx_t         *tx;
03873 
03874         if (CFS_FAIL_CHECK(CFS_FAIL_GNI_DELAY_RDMAQ)) {
03875                 RETURN(found_work);
03876         }
03877 
03878         if (time_after_eq(jiffies, dev->gnd_rdmaq_deadline)) {
03879                 unsigned long           dead_bump;
03880                 long                    new_ok;
03881 
03882                 /* if we think we need to adjust, take lock to serialize and recheck */
03883                 spin_lock(&dev->gnd_rdmaq_lock);
03884                 if (time_after_eq(jiffies, dev->gnd_rdmaq_deadline)) {
03885                         del_singleshot_timer_sync(&dev->gnd_rdmaq_timer);
03886 
03887                         dead_bump = cfs_time_seconds(1) / *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_rdmaq_intervals;
03888 
03889                         /* roll the bucket forward */
03890                         dev->gnd_rdmaq_deadline = jiffies + dead_bump;
03891 
03892                         if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_rdmaq_override &&
03893                                 (*kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_rdmaq_intervals != 0)) {
03894                                 new_ok = kgnilnd_data.kgn_rdmaq_override / *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_rdmaq_intervals;
03895                         }  else {
03896                                 new_ok = ~0UL >> 1;
03897                         }
03898 
03899                         /* roll current outstanding forward to make sure we carry outstanding
03900                          * committment forward
03901                          * new_ok starts out as the whole interval value
03902                          *  - first subtract bytes_out from last interval, as that would push us over
03903                          *    strict limits for this interval
03904                          *  - second, set bytes_ok to new_ok to ensure it doesn't exceed the current auth
03905                          *
03906                          * there is a small race here if someone is actively processing mappings and
03907                          * adding to rdmaq_bytes_out, but it should be small as the mappings are triggered
03908                          * quite quickly after kgnilnd_auth_rdma_bytes gives us the go-ahead
03909                          * - if this gives us problems in the future, we could use a read/write lock
03910                          * to protect the resetting of these values */
03911                         new_ok -= atomic64_read(&dev->gnd_rdmaq_bytes_out);
03912                         atomic64_set(&dev->gnd_rdmaq_bytes_ok, new_ok);
03913 
03914                         CDEBUG(D_NET, "resetting rdmaq bytes to %ld, deadline +%lu -> %lu, "
03915                                        "current out %ld\n",
03916                                atomic64_read(&dev->gnd_rdmaq_bytes_ok), dead_bump, dev->gnd_rdmaq_deadline,
03917                                atomic64_read(&dev->gnd_rdmaq_bytes_out));
03918                 }
03919                 spin_unlock(&dev->gnd_rdmaq_lock);
03920         }
03921 
03922         spin_lock(&dev->gnd_rdmaq_lock);
03923         while (!list_empty(&dev->gnd_rdmaq)) {
03924                 int     rc;
03925 
03926                 /* make sure we break out early on quiesce */
03927                 if (unlikely(kgnilnd_data.kgn_quiesce_trigger)) {
03928                         /* always break with lock held - we unlock outside loop */
03929                         break;
03930                 }
03931 
03932                 tx = list_first_entry(&dev->gnd_rdmaq, kgn_tx_t, tx_list);
03933                 kgnilnd_tx_del_state_locked(tx, NULL, tx->tx_conn, GNILND_TX_ALLOCD);
03934                 found_work++;
03935 
03936                 /* sample with lock held, serializing with kgnilnd_complete_closed_conn */
03937                 if (tx->tx_conn->gnc_state != GNILND_CONN_ESTABLISHED) {
03938                         /* if conn is dying, mark tx in tx_ref_table for
03939                          * kgnilnd_complete_closed_conn to finish up */
03940                         kgnilnd_tx_add_state_locked(tx, NULL, tx->tx_conn, GNILND_TX_DYING, 1);
03941 
03942                         /* tx was moved to DYING, get next */
03943                         continue;
03944                 }
03945                 spin_unlock(&dev->gnd_rdmaq_lock);
03946 
03947                 rc = kgnilnd_auth_rdma_bytes(dev, tx);
03948                 spin_lock(&dev->gnd_rdmaq_lock);
03949 
03950                 if (rc < 0) {
03951                         /* no ticket! add back to head */
03952                         kgnilnd_tx_add_state_locked(tx, NULL, tx->tx_conn, GNILND_TX_RDMAQ, 0);
03953                         /* clear found_work so scheduler threads wait for timer */
03954                         found_work = 0;
03955                         break;
03956                 } else {
03957                         /* TX is GO for launch */
03958                         tx->tx_qtime = jiffies;
03959                         kgnilnd_send_mapped_tx(tx, 0);
03960                         found_work++;
03961                 }
03962         }
03963         spin_unlock(&dev->gnd_rdmaq_lock);
03964 
03965         RETURN(found_work);
03966 }
03967 
03968 static inline void
03969 kgnilnd_swab_rdma_desc(kgn_rdma_desc_t *d)
03970 {
03971         __swab64s(&d->gnrd_key.qword1);
03972         __swab64s(&d->gnrd_key.qword2);
03973         __swab64s(&d->gnrd_addr);
03974         __swab32s(&d->gnrd_nob);
03975 }
03976 
03977 #define kgnilnd_match_reply_either(w, x, y, z) _kgnilnd_match_reply(w, x, y, z)
03978 #define kgnilnd_match_reply(x, y, z) _kgnilnd_match_reply(x, y, GNILND_MSG_NONE, z)
03979 
03980 kgn_tx_t *
03981 _kgnilnd_match_reply(kgn_conn_t *conn, int type1, int type2, __u64 cookie)
03982 {
03983         kgn_tx_ev_id_t    ev_id;
03984         kgn_tx_t         *tx;
03985 
03986         /* we use the cookie from the original TX, so we can find the match
03987          * by parsing that and using the txe_idx */
03988         ev_id.txe_cookie = cookie;
03989 
03990         tx = conn->gnc_tx_ref_table[ev_id.txe_idx];
03991 
03992         if (tx != NULL) {
03993                 /* check tx to make sure kgni didn't eat it */
03994                 GNITX_ASSERTF(tx, tx->tx_msg.gnm_magic == GNILND_MSG_MAGIC,
03995                               "came back from kgni with bad magic %x\n", tx->tx_msg.gnm_magic);
03996 
03997                 GNITX_ASSERTF(tx, ((tx->tx_id.txe_idx == ev_id.txe_idx) &&
03998                                   (tx->tx_id.txe_cookie = cookie)),
03999                               "conn 0x%p->%s tx_ref_table hosed: wanted "
04000                               "txe_cookie "LPX64" txe_idx %d "
04001                               "found tx %p cookie "LPX64" txe_idx %d\n",
04002                               conn, libcfs_nid2str(conn->gnc_peer->gnp_nid),
04003                               cookie, ev_id.txe_idx,
04004                               tx, tx->tx_id.txe_cookie, tx->tx_id.txe_idx);
04005 
04006                 LASSERTF((((tx->tx_msg.gnm_type == type1) || (tx->tx_msg.gnm_type == type2)) &&
04007                         (tx->tx_state & GNILND_TX_WAITING_REPLY)),
04008                         "Unexpected TX type (%x, %x or %x) "
04009                         "or state (%x, expected +%x) "
04010                         "matched reply from %s\n",
04011                         tx->tx_msg.gnm_type, type1, type2,
04012                         tx->tx_state, GNILND_TX_WAITING_REPLY,
04013                         libcfs_nid2str(conn->gnc_peer->gnp_nid));
04014         } else {
04015                 CWARN("Unmatched reply %02x, or %02x/"LPX64" from %s\n",
04016                       type1, type2, cookie, libcfs_nid2str(conn->gnc_peer->gnp_nid));
04017         }
04018         return tx;
04019 }
04020 
04021 static inline void
04022 kgnilnd_complete_tx(kgn_tx_t *tx, int rc)
04023 {
04024         int             complete = 0;
04025         kgn_conn_t      *conn = tx->tx_conn;
04026         __u64 nob = tx->tx_nob;
04027         __u32 physnop = tx->tx_phys_npages;
04028         int   id = tx->tx_id.txe_smsg_id;
04029         int buftype = tx->tx_buftype;
04030         gni_mem_handle_t hndl;
04031         hndl.qword1 = tx->tx_map_key.qword1;
04032         hndl.qword2 = tx->tx_map_key.qword2;
04033 
04034         spin_lock(&conn->gnc_list_lock);
04035 
04036         GNITX_ASSERTF(tx, tx->tx_state & GNILND_TX_WAITING_REPLY,
04037                 "not waiting for reply", NULL);
04038 
04039         tx->tx_rc = rc;
04040         tx->tx_state &= ~GNILND_TX_WAITING_REPLY;
04041 
04042         if (rc == -EFAULT) {
04043                 CDEBUG(D_NETERROR, "Error %d TX data: TX %p tx_id %x nob %16"LPF64"u physnop %8d buffertype %#8x MemHandle "LPX64"."LPX64"x\n",
04044                         rc, tx, id, nob, physnop, buftype, hndl.qword1, hndl.qword2);
04045 
04046                 if(*kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_efault_lbug) {
04047                         GNIDBG_TOMSG(D_NETERROR, &tx->tx_msg,
04048                         "error %d on tx 0x%p->%s id %u/%d state %s age %ds",
04049                         rc, tx, conn ?
04050                         libcfs_nid2str(conn->gnc_peer->gnp_nid) : "<?>",
04051                         tx->tx_id.txe_smsg_id, tx->tx_id.txe_idx,
04052                         kgnilnd_tx_state2str(tx->tx_list_state),
04053                         cfs_duration_sec((unsigned long) jiffies - tx->tx_qtime));
04054                         LBUG();
04055                 }
04056         }
04057 
04058         if (!(tx->tx_state & GNILND_TX_WAITING_COMPLETION)) {
04059                 kgnilnd_tx_del_state_locked(tx, NULL, conn, GNILND_TX_ALLOCD);
04060                 /* sample under lock as follow on steps require gnc_list_lock
04061                  * - or call kgnilnd_tx_done which requires no locks held over
04062                  *   call to lnet_finalize */
04063                 complete = 1;
04064         }
04065         spin_unlock(&conn->gnc_list_lock);
04066 
04067         if (complete) {
04068                 kgnilnd_tx_done(tx, tx->tx_rc);
04069         }
04070 }
04071 
04072 static inline void
04073 kgnilnd_finalize_rx_done(kgn_tx_t *tx, kgn_msg_t *msg)
04074 {
04075         int              rc;
04076         kgn_conn_t      *conn = tx->tx_conn;
04077 
04078         atomic_inc(&conn->gnc_device->gnd_rdma_nrx);
04079         atomic64_add(tx->tx_nob, &conn->gnc_device->gnd_rdma_rxbytes);
04080 
04081         /* the gncm_retval is passed in for PUTs */
04082         rc = kgnilnd_verify_rdma_cksum(tx, msg->gnm_payload_cksum,
04083                                        msg->gnm_u.completion.gncm_retval);
04084 
04085         kgnilnd_complete_tx(tx, rc);
04086 }
04087 
04088 void
04089 kgnilnd_check_fma_rx(kgn_conn_t *conn)
04090 {
04091         __u32         seq;
04092         kgn_tx_t     *tx;
04093         kgn_rx_t     *rx;
04094         kgn_msg_t    *msg;
04095         void         *prefix;
04096         gni_return_t  rrc;
04097         kgn_peer_t   *peer = conn->gnc_peer;
04098         kgn_net_t    *net;
04099         int           rc = 0;
04100         __u16         tmp_cksum = 0, msg_cksum = 0;
04101         int           repost = 1, saw_complete;
04102         unsigned long timestamp, newest_last_rx, timeout;
04103         int           last_seq;
04104         ENTRY;
04105 
04106         /* Short circuit if the ep_handle is null.
04107          * It's likely that its about to be closed as stale.
04108          */
04109         if (conn->gnc_ephandle == NULL)
04110                 RETURN_EXIT;
04111 
04112         timestamp = jiffies;
04113         kgnilnd_gl_mutex_lock(&conn->gnc_device->gnd_cq_mutex);
04114         /* delay in jiffies - we are really concerned only with things that
04115          * result in a schedule() or really holding this off for long times .
04116          * NB - mutex_lock could spin for 2 jiffies before going to sleep to wait */
04117         conn->gnc_device->gnd_mutex_delay += (long) jiffies - timestamp;
04118 
04119         /* Resample current time as we have no idea how long it took to get the mutex */
04120         timestamp = jiffies;
04121 
04122         /* We check here when the last time we received an rx, we do this before
04123          * we call getnext in case the thread has been blocked for a while. If we
04124          * havent received an rx since our timeout value we close the connection
04125          * as we should assume the other side has closed the connection. This will
04126          * stop us from sending replies to a mailbox that is already in purgatory.
04127          */
04128 
04129         timeout = cfs_time_seconds(conn->gnc_timeout);
04130         newest_last_rx = GNILND_LASTRX(conn);
04131 
04132         /* Error injection to validate that timestamp checking works and closing the conn */
04133         if (CFS_FAIL_CHECK(CFS_FAIL_GNI_RECV_TIMEOUT)) {
04134                 timestamp = timestamp + (GNILND_TIMEOUTRX(timeout) * 2);
04135         }
04136 
04137         if (time_after_eq(timestamp, newest_last_rx + (GNILND_TIMEOUTRX(timeout)))) {
04138                 GNIDBG_CONN(D_NETERROR|D_CONSOLE, conn, "Cant receive from %s after timeout lapse of %lu; TO %lu",
04139                 libcfs_nid2str(conn->gnc_peer->gnp_nid),
04140                 cfs_duration_sec(timestamp - newest_last_rx),
04141                 cfs_duration_sec(GNILND_TIMEOUTRX(timeout)));
04142                 kgnilnd_gl_mutex_unlock(&conn->gnc_device->gnd_cq_mutex);
04143                 rc = -ETIME;
04144                 kgnilnd_close_conn(conn, rc);
04145                 RETURN_EXIT;
04146         }
04147 
04148         rrc = kgnilnd_smsg_getnext(conn->gnc_ephandle, &prefix);
04149 
04150         if (rrc == GNI_RC_NOT_DONE) {
04151                 kgnilnd_gl_mutex_unlock(&conn->gnc_device->gnd_cq_mutex);
04152                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "SMSG RX empty conn 0x%p\n", conn);
04153                 RETURN_EXIT;
04154         }
04155 
04156         /* Instead of asserting when we get mailbox corruption lets attempt to
04157          * close the conn and recover. We can put the conn/mailbox into
04158          * purgatory and let purgatory deal with the problem. If we see
04159          * this NETTERROR reported on production systems in large amounts
04160          * we will need to revisit the state machine to see if we can tighten
04161          * it up further to improve data protection.
04162          */
04163 
04164         if (rrc == GNI_RC_INVALID_STATE) {
04165                 kgnilnd_gl_mutex_unlock(&conn->gnc_device->gnd_cq_mutex);
04166                 GNIDBG_CONN(D_NETERROR | D_CONSOLE, conn, "Mailbox corruption "
04167                         "detected closing conn %p from peer %s\n", conn,
04168                         libcfs_nid2str(conn->gnc_peer->gnp_nid));
04169                 rc = -EIO;
04170                 kgnilnd_close_conn(conn, rc);
04171                 RETURN_EXIT;
04172         }
04173 
04174         LASSERTF(rrc == GNI_RC_SUCCESS,
04175                 "bad rc %d on conn %p from peer %s\n",
04176                 rrc, conn, libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid));
04177 
04178         msg = (kgn_msg_t *)prefix;
04179 
04180         rx = kgnilnd_alloc_rx();
04181         if (rx == NULL) {
04182                 kgnilnd_gl_mutex_unlock(&conn->gnc_device->gnd_cq_mutex);
04183                 kgnilnd_release_msg(conn);
04184                 GNIDBG_MSG(D_NETERROR, msg, "Dropping SMSG RX from 0x%p->%s, no RX memory",
04185                            conn, libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid));
04186                 RETURN_EXIT;
04187         }
04188 
04189         GNIDBG_MSG(D_INFO, msg, "SMSG RX on %p", conn);
04190 
04191         timestamp = conn->gnc_last_rx;
04192         seq = last_seq = atomic_read(&conn->gnc_rx_seq);
04193         atomic_inc(&conn->gnc_rx_seq);
04194 
04195         conn->gnc_last_rx = jiffies;
04196         /* stash first rx so we can clear out purgatory
04197          */
04198         if (conn->gnc_first_rx == 0)
04199                 conn->gnc_first_rx = jiffies;
04200 
04201         /* needs to linger to protect gnc_rx_seq like we do with gnc_tx_seq */
04202         kgnilnd_gl_mutex_unlock(&conn->gnc_device->gnd_cq_mutex);
04203         kgnilnd_peer_alive(conn->gnc_peer);
04204 
04205         rx->grx_msg = msg;
04206         rx->grx_conn = conn;
04207         rx->grx_eager = 0;
04208         rx->grx_received = current_kernel_time();
04209 
04210         if (CFS_FAIL_CHECK(CFS_FAIL_GNI_NET_LOOKUP)) {
04211                 rc = -ENONET;
04212         } else {
04213                 rc = kgnilnd_find_net(msg->gnm_srcnid, &net);
04214         }
04215 
04216         if (rc < 0) {
04217                 GOTO(out, rc);
04218         } else {
04219                 kgnilnd_net_decref(net);
04220         }
04221 
04222         if (*kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_checksum && !msg->gnm_cksum)
04223                 GNIDBG_MSG(D_WARNING, msg, "no msg header checksum when enabled");
04224 
04225         /* XXX Nic: Do we need to swab cksum */
04226         if (msg->gnm_cksum != 0) {
04227                 msg_cksum = msg->gnm_cksum;
04228                 msg->gnm_cksum = 0;
04229                 tmp_cksum = kgnilnd_cksum(msg, sizeof(kgn_msg_t));
04230 
04231                 if (tmp_cksum != msg_cksum) {
04232                         GNIDBG_MSG(D_NETERROR, msg, "Bad hdr checksum (%x expected %x)",
04233                                         tmp_cksum, msg_cksum);
04234                         kgnilnd_dump_msg(D_BUFFS, msg);
04235                         rc = -ENOKEY;
04236                         GOTO(out, rc);
04237                 }
04238         }
04239         /* restore checksum for future debug messages */
04240         msg->gnm_cksum = tmp_cksum;
04241 
04242         if (msg->gnm_magic != GNILND_MSG_MAGIC) {
04243                 if (__swab32(msg->gnm_magic) != GNILND_MSG_MAGIC) {
04244                         GNIDBG_MSG(D_NETERROR, msg, "Unexpected magic %08x from %s",
04245                                msg->gnm_magic, libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid));
04246                         rc = -EPROTO;
04247                         GOTO(out, rc);
04248                 }
04249 
04250                 __swab32s(&msg->gnm_magic);
04251                 __swab16s(&msg->gnm_version);
04252                 __swab16s(&msg->gnm_type);
04253                 __swab64s(&msg->gnm_srcnid);
04254                 __swab64s(&msg->gnm_connstamp);
04255                 __swab32s(&msg->gnm_seq);
04256 
04257                 /* NB message type checked below; NOT here... */
04258                 switch (msg->gnm_type) {
04259                 case GNILND_MSG_GET_ACK_REV:
04260                 case GNILND_MSG_PUT_ACK:
04261                         kgnilnd_swab_rdma_desc(&msg->gnm_u.putack.gnpam_desc);
04262                         break;
04263 
04264                 case GNILND_MSG_PUT_REQ_REV:
04265                 case GNILND_MSG_GET_REQ:
04266                         kgnilnd_swab_rdma_desc(&msg->gnm_u.get.gngm_desc);
04267                         break;
04268 
04269                 default:
04270                         break;
04271                 }
04272         }
04273 
04274         if (msg->gnm_version != GNILND_MSG_VERSION) {
04275                 GNIDBG_MSG(D_NETERROR, msg, "Unexpected protocol version %d from %s",
04276                        msg->gnm_version, libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid));
04277                 rc = -EPROTO;
04278                 GOTO(out, rc);
04279         }
04280 
04281         if (LNET_NIDADDR(msg->gnm_srcnid) != LNET_NIDADDR(peer->gnp_nid)) {
04282                 GNIDBG_MSG(D_NETERROR, msg, "Unexpected peer %s from %s",
04283                        libcfs_nid2str(msg->gnm_srcnid),
04284                        libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid));
04285                 rc = -EPROTO;
04286                 GOTO(out, rc);
04287         }
04288 
04289         if (msg->gnm_connstamp != conn->gnc_peer_connstamp) {
04290                 GNIDBG_MSG(D_NETERROR, msg, "Unexpected connstamp "LPX64"("LPX64
04291                        " expected) from %s",
04292                        msg->gnm_connstamp, conn->gnc_peer_connstamp,
04293                        libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid));
04294                 rc = -EPROTO;
04295                 GOTO(out, rc);
04296         }
04297 
04298         if (msg->gnm_seq != seq) {
04299                 GNIDBG_MSG(D_NETERROR, msg, "Unexpected sequence number %d(%d expected) from %s",
04300                        msg->gnm_seq, seq, libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid));
04301                 rc = -EPROTO;
04302                 GOTO(out, rc);
04303         }
04304 
04305         atomic_inc(&conn->gnc_device->gnd_short_nrx);
04306 
04307         if (msg->gnm_type == GNILND_MSG_CLOSE) {
04308                 CDEBUG(D_NETTRACE, "%s sent us CLOSE msg\n",
04309                               libcfs_nid2str(conn->gnc_peer->gnp_nid));
04310                 write_lock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
04311                 conn->gnc_close_recvd = GNILND_CLOSE_RX;
04312                 conn->gnc_peer_error = msg->gnm_u.completion.gncm_retval;
04313                 /* double check state with lock held */
04314                 if (conn->gnc_state == GNILND_CONN_ESTABLISHED) {
04315                         /* only error if we are not already closing */
04316                         if (conn->gnc_peer_error == -ETIMEDOUT) {
04317                                 unsigned long           now = jiffies;
04318                                 CNETERR("peer 0x%p->%s closed connection 0x%p due to timeout. "
04319                                        "Is node down? "
04320                                        "RX %d @ %lus/%lus; TX %d @ %lus/%lus; "
04321                                        "NOOP %lus/%lus/%lus; sched %lus/%lus/%lus ago\n",
04322                                        conn->gnc_peer, libcfs_nid2str(conn->gnc_peer->gnp_nid),
04323                                        conn, last_seq,
04324                                        cfs_duration_sec(now - timestamp),
04325                                        cfs_duration_sec(now - conn->gnc_last_rx_cq),
04326                                        atomic_read(&conn->gnc_tx_seq),
04327                                        cfs_duration_sec(now - conn->gnc_last_tx),
04328                                        cfs_duration_sec(now - conn->gnc_last_tx_cq),
04329                                        cfs_duration_sec(now - conn->gnc_last_noop_want),
04330                                        cfs_duration_sec(now - conn->gnc_last_noop_sent),
04331                                        cfs_duration_sec(now - conn->gnc_last_noop_cq),
04332                                        cfs_duration_sec(now - conn->gnc_last_sched_ask),
04333                                        cfs_duration_sec(now - conn->gnc_last_sched_do),
04334                                        cfs_duration_sec(now - conn->gnc_device->gnd_sched_alive));
04335                         }
04336                         kgnilnd_close_conn_locked(conn, -ECONNRESET);
04337                 }
04338                 write_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
04339                 GOTO(out, rc);
04340         }
04341 
04342         if (conn->gnc_close_recvd) {
04343                 GNIDBG_MSG(D_NETERROR, msg, "Unexpected message %s(%d/%d) after CLOSE from %s",
04344                        kgnilnd_msgtype2str(msg->gnm_type),
04345                        msg->gnm_type, conn->gnc_close_recvd,
04346                        libcfs_nid2str(conn->gnc_peer->gnp_nid));
04347                 rc = -EPROTO;
04348                 GOTO(out, rc);
04349         }
04350 
04351         if (conn->gnc_state != GNILND_CONN_ESTABLISHED) {
04352                 /* XXX Nic: log message received on bad connection state */
04353                 GOTO(out, rc);
04354         }
04355 
04356         switch (msg->gnm_type) {
04357         case GNILND_MSG_NOOP:
04358                 /* Nothing to do; just a keepalive */
04359                 break;
04360 
04361         case GNILND_MSG_IMMEDIATE:
04362                 /* only get SMSG payload for IMMEDIATE */
04363                 atomic64_add(msg->gnm_payload_len, &conn->gnc_device->gnd_short_rxbytes);
04364                 rc = lnet_parse(net->gnn_ni, &msg->gnm_u.immediate.gnim_hdr,
04365                                 msg->gnm_srcnid, rx, 0);
04366                 repost = rc < 0;
04367                 break;
04368         case GNILND_MSG_GET_REQ_REV:
04369         case GNILND_MSG_PUT_REQ:
04370                 rc = lnet_parse(net->gnn_ni, &msg->gnm_u.putreq.gnprm_hdr,
04371                                 msg->gnm_srcnid, rx, 1);
04372                 repost = rc < 0;
04373                 break;
04374         case GNILND_MSG_GET_NAK_REV:
04375                 tx = kgnilnd_match_reply_either(conn, GNILND_MSG_GET_REQ_REV, GNILND_MSG_GET_ACK_REV,
04376                                         msg->gnm_u.completion.gncm_cookie);
04377                 if (tx == NULL)
04378                         break;
04379 
04380                 kgnilnd_complete_tx(tx, msg->gnm_u.completion.gncm_retval);
04381                 break;
04382         case GNILND_MSG_PUT_NAK:
04383                 tx = kgnilnd_match_reply_either(conn, GNILND_MSG_PUT_REQ, GNILND_MSG_PUT_ACK,
04384                                         msg->gnm_u.completion.gncm_cookie);
04385                 if (tx == NULL)
04386                         break;
04387 
04388                 kgnilnd_complete_tx(tx, msg->gnm_u.completion.gncm_retval);
04389                 break;
04390         case GNILND_MSG_PUT_ACK:
04391                 tx = kgnilnd_match_reply(conn, GNILND_MSG_PUT_REQ,
04392                                         msg->gnm_u.putack.gnpam_src_cookie);
04393                 if (tx == NULL)
04394                         break;
04395 
04396                 /* store putack data for later: deferred rdma or re-try */
04397                 tx->tx_putinfo = msg->gnm_u.putack;
04398 
04399                 saw_complete = 0;
04400                 spin_lock(&tx->tx_conn->gnc_list_lock);
04401 
04402                 GNITX_ASSERTF(tx, tx->tx_state & GNILND_TX_WAITING_REPLY,
04403                         "not waiting for reply", NULL);
04404 
04405                 tx->tx_state &= ~GNILND_TX_WAITING_REPLY;
04406 
04407                 if (likely(!(tx->tx_state & GNILND_TX_WAITING_COMPLETION))) {
04408                         kgnilnd_tx_del_state_locked(tx, NULL, conn, GNILND_TX_ALLOCD);
04409                         /* sample under lock as follow on steps require gnc_list_lock
04410                          * - or call kgnilnd_tx_done which requires no locks held over
04411                          *   call to lnet_finalize */
04412                         saw_complete = 1;
04413                 } else {
04414                         /* cannot launch rdma if still waiting for fma-msg completion */
04415                         CDEBUG(D_NET, "tx 0x%p type 0x%02x will need to "
04416                                        "wait for SMSG completion\n", tx, tx->tx_msg.gnm_type);
04417                         tx->tx_state |= GNILND_TX_PENDING_RDMA;
04418                 }
04419                 spin_unlock(&tx->tx_conn->gnc_list_lock);
04420 
04421                 if (saw_complete) {
04422                         rc = kgnilnd_send_mapped_tx(tx, 0);
04423                         if (rc < 0)
04424                                 kgnilnd_tx_done(tx, rc);
04425                 }
04426                 break;
04427         case GNILND_MSG_GET_ACK_REV:
04428                 tx = kgnilnd_match_reply(conn, GNILND_MSG_GET_REQ_REV,
04429                                         msg->gnm_u.putack.gnpam_src_cookie);
04430                 if (tx == NULL)
04431                         break;
04432 
04433                 /* store putack data for later: deferred rdma or re-try */
04434                 tx->tx_putinfo = msg->gnm_u.putack;
04435                 saw_complete = 0;
04436                 spin_lock(&tx->tx_conn->gnc_list_lock);
04437 
04438                 GNITX_ASSERTF(tx, tx->tx_state & GNILND_TX_WAITING_REPLY,
04439                         "not waiting for reply", NULL);
04440 
04441                 tx->tx_state &= ~GNILND_TX_WAITING_REPLY;
04442 
04443                 if (likely(!(tx->tx_state & GNILND_TX_WAITING_COMPLETION))) {
04444                         kgnilnd_tx_del_state_locked(tx, NULL, conn, GNILND_TX_ALLOCD);
04445                         /* sample under lock as follow on steps require gnc_list_lock
04446                          * - or call kgnilnd_tx_done which requires no locks held over
04447                          *   call to lnet_finalize */
04448                         saw_complete = 1;
04449                 } else {
04450                         /* cannot launch rdma if still waiting for fma-msg completion */
04451                         CDEBUG(D_NET, "tx 0x%p type 0x%02x will need to "
04452                                         "wait for SMSG completion\n", tx, tx->tx_msg.gnm_type);
04453                         tx->tx_state |= GNILND_TX_PENDING_RDMA;
04454                 }
04455                 spin_unlock(&tx->tx_conn->gnc_list_lock);
04456 
04457                 if (saw_complete) {
04458                         rc = kgnilnd_send_mapped_tx(tx, 0);
04459                         if (rc < 0)
04460                                 kgnilnd_tx_done(tx, rc);
04461                 }
04462                 break;
04463         case GNILND_MSG_PUT_DONE:
04464                 tx = kgnilnd_match_reply(conn, GNILND_MSG_PUT_ACK,
04465                                         msg->gnm_u.completion.gncm_cookie);
04466                 if (tx == NULL)
04467                         break;
04468 
04469                 GNITX_ASSERTF(tx, tx->tx_buftype == GNILND_BUF_PHYS_MAPPED ||
04470                                tx->tx_buftype == GNILND_BUF_VIRT_MAPPED,
04471                                "bad tx buftype %d", tx->tx_buftype);
04472 
04473                 kgnilnd_finalize_rx_done(tx, msg);
04474                 break;
04475         case GNILND_MSG_PUT_REQ_REV:
04476         case GNILND_MSG_GET_REQ:
04477                 rc = lnet_parse(net->gnn_ni, &msg->gnm_u.get.gngm_hdr,
04478                                 msg->gnm_srcnid, rx, 1);
04479                 repost = rc < 0;
04480                 break;
04481 
04482         case GNILND_MSG_GET_NAK:
04483                 tx = kgnilnd_match_reply(conn, GNILND_MSG_GET_REQ,
04484                                         msg->gnm_u.completion.gncm_cookie);
04485                 if (tx == NULL)
04486                         break;
04487 
04488                 GNITX_ASSERTF(tx, tx->tx_buftype == GNILND_BUF_PHYS_MAPPED ||
04489                                tx->tx_buftype == GNILND_BUF_VIRT_MAPPED,
04490                                "bad tx buftype %d", tx->tx_buftype);
04491 
04492                 kgnilnd_complete_tx(tx, msg->gnm_u.completion.gncm_retval);
04493                 break;
04494 
04495         case GNILND_MSG_GET_DONE:
04496                 tx = kgnilnd_match_reply(conn, GNILND_MSG_GET_REQ,
04497                                         msg->gnm_u.completion.gncm_cookie);
04498                 if (tx == NULL)
04499                         break;
04500 
04501                 GNITX_ASSERTF(tx, tx->tx_buftype == GNILND_BUF_PHYS_MAPPED ||
04502                                tx->tx_buftype == GNILND_BUF_VIRT_MAPPED,
04503                                "bad tx buftype %d", tx->tx_buftype);
04504 
04505                 lnet_set_reply_msg_len(net->gnn_ni, tx->tx_lntmsg[1],
04506                                        msg->gnm_u.completion.gncm_retval);
04507 
04508                 kgnilnd_finalize_rx_done(tx, msg);
04509                 break;
04510         case GNILND_MSG_GET_DONE_REV:
04511                 tx = kgnilnd_match_reply(conn, GNILND_MSG_GET_ACK_REV,
04512                                         msg->gnm_u.completion.gncm_cookie);
04513                 if (tx == NULL)
04514                         break;
04515 
04516                 GNITX_ASSERTF(tx, tx->tx_buftype == GNILND_BUF_PHYS_MAPPED ||
04517                                 tx->tx_buftype == GNILND_BUF_VIRT_MAPPED,
04518                                 "bad tx buftype %d", tx->tx_buftype);
04519 
04520                 kgnilnd_finalize_rx_done(tx, msg);
04521                 break;
04522 
04523         case GNILND_MSG_PUT_DONE_REV:
04524                 tx = kgnilnd_match_reply(conn, GNILND_MSG_PUT_REQ_REV,
04525                                         msg->gnm_u.completion.gncm_cookie);
04526 
04527                 if (tx == NULL)
04528                         break;
04529 
04530                 GNITX_ASSERTF(tx, tx->tx_buftype == GNILND_BUF_PHYS_MAPPED ||
04531                                tx->tx_buftype == GNILND_BUF_VIRT_MAPPED,
04532                                "bad tx buftype %d", tx->tx_buftype);
04533 
04534                 kgnilnd_finalize_rx_done(tx, msg);
04535                 break;
04536         case GNILND_MSG_PUT_NAK_REV:
04537                 tx = kgnilnd_match_reply(conn, GNILND_MSG_PUT_REQ_REV,
04538                                         msg->gnm_u.completion.gncm_cookie);
04539 
04540                 if (tx == NULL)
04541                         break;
04542 
04543                 GNITX_ASSERTF(tx, tx->tx_buftype == GNILND_BUF_PHYS_MAPPED ||
04544                                tx->tx_buftype == GNILND_BUF_VIRT_MAPPED,
04545                                 "bad tx buftype %d", tx->tx_buftype);
04546 
04547                 kgnilnd_complete_tx(tx, msg->gnm_u.completion.gncm_retval);
04548                 break;
04549         }
04550 
04551  out:
04552         if (rc < 0)                             /* protocol/comms error */
04553                 kgnilnd_close_conn(conn, rc);
04554 
04555         if (repost && rx != NULL) {
04556                 kgnilnd_consume_rx(rx);
04557         }
04558 
04559         /* we got an event so assume more there and call for reschedule */
04560         if (rc >= 0)
04561                 kgnilnd_schedule_conn(conn);
04562         EXIT;
04563 }
04564 
04565 /* Do the failure injections that we need to affect conn processing in the following function.
04566  * When writing tests that use this function make sure to use a fail_loc with a fail mask.
04567  * If you dont you can cause the scheduler threads to spin on the conn without it leaving
04568  * process_conns.
04569  *
04570  * intent is used to signal the calling function whether or not the conn needs to be rescheduled.
04571  */
04572 
04573 static inline int
04574 kgnilnd_check_conn_fail_loc(kgn_device_t *dev, kgn_conn_t *conn, int *intent)
04575 {
04576         int     rc = 0;
04577 
04578         /* short circuit out when not set */
04579         if (likely(!cfs_fail_loc)) {
04580                 RETURN(rc);
04581         }
04582 
04583         /* failure injection to test for stack reset clean ups */
04584         if (CFS_FAIL_CHECK(CFS_FAIL_GNI_DROP_CLOSING)) {
04585                 /* we can't rely on busy loops being nice enough to get the
04586                  *  stack reset triggered - it'd just spin on this conn */
04587                 CFS_RACE(CFS_FAIL_GNI_DROP_CLOSING);
04588                 rc = 1;
04589                 *intent = 1;
04590                 GOTO(did_fail_loc, rc);
04591         }
04592 
04593         if (conn->gnc_state == GNILND_CONN_DESTROY_EP) {
04594                 /* DESTROY_EP set in kgnilnd_conn_decref on gnc_refcount = 1 */
04595 
04596                 if (CFS_FAIL_CHECK(CFS_FAIL_GNI_DROP_DESTROY_EP)) {
04597                         CFS_RACE(CFS_FAIL_GNI_DROP_DESTROY_EP);
04598                         rc = 1;
04599                         *intent = 1;
04600                         GOTO(did_fail_loc, rc);
04601                 }
04602         }
04603 
04604         /* CFS_FAIL_GNI_FINISH_PURG2 is used to stop a connection from fully closing. This scheduler
04605          * will spin on the CFS_FAIL_TIMEOUT until the fail_loc is cleared at which time the connection
04606          * will be closed by kgnilnd_complete_closed_conn.
04607          */
04608         if ((conn->gnc_state == GNILND_CONN_CLOSED) && CFS_FAIL_CHECK(CFS_FAIL_GNI_FINISH_PURG2)) {
04609                 while (CFS_FAIL_TIMEOUT(CFS_FAIL_GNI_FINISH_PURG2, 1)) {};
04610                 rc = 1;
04611                 *intent = 1;
04612                 GOTO(did_fail_loc, rc);
04613         }
04614 
04615         /* this one is a bit gross - we can't hold the mutex from process_conns
04616          * across a CFS_RACE here - it'd block the conn threads from doing an ep_bind
04617          * and moving onto finish_connect
04618          * so, we'll just set the rc - kgnilnd_process_conns will clear
04619          * found_work on a fail_loc, getting the scheduler thread to call schedule()
04620          * and effectively getting this thread to sleep */
04621         if ((conn->gnc_state == GNILND_CONN_CLOSED) && CFS_FAIL_CHECK(CFS_FAIL_GNI_FINISH_PURG)) {
04622                 rc = 1;
04623                 *intent = 1;
04624                 GOTO(did_fail_loc, rc);
04625         }
04626 
04627 did_fail_loc:
04628         RETURN(rc);
04629 }
04630 
04631 static inline void
04632 kgnilnd_send_conn_close(kgn_conn_t *conn)
04633 {
04634         kgn_tx_t        *tx;
04635 
04636         /* we are closing the conn - we will try to send the CLOSE msg
04637          * but will not wait for anything else to flush */
04638 
04639         /* send the close if not already done so or received one */
04640         if (!conn->gnc_close_sent && !conn->gnc_close_recvd) {
04641                 /* set close_sent regardless of the success of the
04642                  * CLOSE message. We are going to try once and then
04643                  * kick him out of the sandbox */
04644                 conn->gnc_close_sent = 1;
04645                 mb();
04646 
04647                 /* EP might be null already if remote side initiated a new connection.
04648                  * kgnilnd_finish_connect destroys existing ep_handles before wiring up the new connection,
04649                  * so this check is here to make sure we dont attempt to send with a null ep_handle.
04650                  */
04651                 if (conn->gnc_ephandle != NULL) {
04652                         int rc = 0;
04653 
04654                         tx = kgnilnd_new_tx_msg(GNILND_MSG_CLOSE, conn->gnc_peer->gnp_net->gnn_ni->ni_nid);
04655                         if (tx != NULL) {
04656                                 tx->tx_msg.gnm_u.completion.gncm_retval = conn->gnc_error;
04657                                 tx->tx_state = GNILND_TX_WAITING_COMPLETION;
04658                                 tx->tx_qtime = jiffies;
04659 
04660                                 if (tx->tx_id.txe_idx == 0) {
04661                                         rc = kgnilnd_set_tx_id(tx, conn);
04662                                         if (rc != 0) {
04663                                                 kgnilnd_tx_done(tx, rc);
04664                                         }
04665                                 }
04666 
04667                                 CDEBUG(D_NETTRACE, "sending close with errno %d\n",
04668                                                 conn->gnc_error);
04669 
04670                                 if (CFS_FAIL_CHECK(CFS_FAIL_GNI_CLOSE_SEND)) {
04671                                         kgnilnd_tx_done(tx, -EAGAIN);
04672                                 } else if (!rc) {
04673                                         rc = kgnilnd_sendmsg(tx, NULL, 0, NULL, GNILND_TX_FMAQ);
04674                                         if (rc) {
04675                                                 /* It wasnt sent and we dont care. */
04676                                                 kgnilnd_tx_done(tx, rc);
04677                                         }
04678                                 }
04679 
04680                         }
04681                 }
04682         }
04683 
04684         /* When changing gnc_state we need to take the kgn_peer_conn_lock */
04685         write_lock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
04686         conn->gnc_state = GNILND_CONN_CLOSED;
04687         write_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
04688         /* mark this conn as CLOSED now that we processed it
04689          * do after TX, so we can use CLOSING in asserts */
04690 
04691         mb();
04692 
04693         if (CFS_FAIL_CHECK(CFS_FAIL_GNI_RX_CLOSE_CLOSED)) {
04694                 /* simulate a RX CLOSE after the timeout but before
04695                  * the scheduler thread gets it */
04696                 conn->gnc_close_recvd = GNILND_CLOSE_INJECT2;
04697                 conn->gnc_peer_error = -ETIMEDOUT;
04698         }
04699         /* schedule to allow potential CLOSE and get the complete phase run */
04700         kgnilnd_schedule_conn(conn);
04701 }
04702 
04703 int
04704 kgnilnd_process_mapped_tx(kgn_device_t *dev)
04705 {
04706         int             found_work = 0;
04707         int             rc = 0;
04708         kgn_tx_t        *tx;
04709         int              fast_remaps = GNILND_FAST_MAPPING_TRY;
04710         int             log_retrans, log_retrans_level;
04711         static int      last_map_version;
04712         ENTRY;
04713 
04714         spin_lock(&dev->gnd_lock);
04715         if (list_empty(&dev->gnd_map_tx)) {
04716                 /* if the list is empty make sure we dont have a timer running */
04717                 del_singleshot_timer_sync(&dev->gnd_map_timer);
04718                 spin_unlock(&dev->gnd_lock);
04719                 RETURN(0);
04720         }
04721 
04722         dev->gnd_sched_alive = jiffies;
04723 
04724         /* we'll retry as fast as possible up to 25% of the limit, then we start
04725          * backing off until our map version changes - indicating we unmapped
04726          * something */
04727         tx = list_first_entry(&dev->gnd_map_tx, kgn_tx_t, tx_list);
04728         if (likely(dev->gnd_map_attempt == 0) ||
04729                 time_after_eq(jiffies, dev->gnd_next_map) ||
04730                 last_map_version != dev->gnd_map_version) {
04731 
04732                 /* if this is our first attempt at mapping set last mapped to current
04733                  * jiffies so we can timeout our attempt correctly.
04734                  */
04735                 if (dev->gnd_map_attempt == 0)
04736                         dev->gnd_last_map = jiffies;
04737         } else {
04738                 GNIDBG_TX(D_NET, tx, "waiting for mapping event event to retry", NULL);
04739                 spin_unlock(&dev->gnd_lock);
04740                 RETURN(0);
04741         }
04742 
04743         /* delete the previous timer if it exists */
04744         del_singleshot_timer_sync(&dev->gnd_map_timer);
04745         /* stash the last map version to let us know when a good one was seen */
04746         last_map_version = dev->gnd_map_version;
04747 
04748         /* we need to to take the lock and continually refresh the head of the list as
04749          * kgnilnd_complete_closed_conn might be nuking stuff and we are cycling the lock
04750          * allowing them to squeeze in */
04751 
04752         while (!list_empty(&dev->gnd_map_tx)) {
04753                 /* make sure we break out early on quiesce */
04754                 if (unlikely(kgnilnd_data.kgn_quiesce_trigger)) {
04755                         /* always break with lock held - we unlock outside loop */
04756                         break;
04757                 }
04758 
04759                 tx = list_first_entry(&dev->gnd_map_tx, kgn_tx_t, tx_list);
04760 
04761                 kgnilnd_tx_del_state_locked(tx, NULL, tx->tx_conn, GNILND_TX_ALLOCD);
04762                 found_work++;
04763 
04764                 /* sample with lock held, serializing with kgnilnd_complete_closed_conn */
04765                 if (tx->tx_conn->gnc_state != GNILND_CONN_ESTABLISHED) {
04766                         /* if conn is dying, mark tx in tx_ref_table for
04767                          * kgnilnd_complete_closed_conn to finish up */
04768                         kgnilnd_tx_add_state_locked(tx, NULL, tx->tx_conn, GNILND_TX_DYING, 1);
04769                         found_work++;
04770 
04771                         /* tx was moved to DYING, get next */
04772                         continue;
04773                 }
04774 
04775                 spin_unlock(&dev->gnd_lock);
04776                 rc = kgnilnd_send_mapped_tx(tx, 1);
04777 
04778                 /* We made it! skip error handling.. */
04779                 if (rc >= 0) {
04780                         /* OK to continue on +ve errors as it won't get seen until
04781                          * this function is called again - we operate on a copy of the original
04782                          * list and not the live list */
04783                         spin_lock(&dev->gnd_lock);
04784                         /* reset map attempts back to zero we successfully
04785                          * mapped so we can reset our timers */
04786                         dev->gnd_map_attempt = 0;
04787                         continue;
04788                 } else if (rc == -EAGAIN) {
04789                         spin_lock(&dev->gnd_lock);
04790                         mod_timer(&dev->gnd_map_timer, dev->gnd_next_map);
04791                         spin_unlock(&dev->gnd_lock);
04792                         GOTO(get_out_mapped, rc);
04793                 } else if (rc != -ENOMEM) {
04794                         /* carp, failure we can't handle */
04795                         kgnilnd_tx_done(tx, rc);
04796                         spin_lock(&dev->gnd_lock);
04797                         /* reset map attempts back to zero we dont know what happened but it
04798                          * wasnt a failed mapping
04799                          */
04800                         dev->gnd_map_attempt = 0;
04801                         continue;
04802                 }
04803 
04804                 /* time to handle the retry cases..  lock so we dont have 2 threads
04805                  * mucking with gnd_map_attempt, or gnd_next_map at the same time.
04806                  */
04807                 spin_lock(&dev->gnd_lock);
04808                 dev->gnd_map_attempt++;
04809                 if (dev->gnd_map_attempt < fast_remaps) {
04810                         /* do nothing we just want it to go as fast as possible.
04811                          * just set gnd_next_map to current jiffies so it will process
04812                          * as fast as possible.
04813                          */
04814                         dev->gnd_next_map = jiffies;
04815                 } else {
04816                         /* Retry based on GNILND_MAP_RETRY_RATE */
04817                         dev->gnd_next_map = jiffies + GNILND_MAP_RETRY_RATE;
04818                 }
04819 
04820                 /* only log occasionally once we've retried fast_remaps */
04821                 log_retrans = (dev->gnd_map_attempt >= fast_remaps) &&
04822                               ((dev->gnd_map_attempt % fast_remaps) == 0);
04823                 log_retrans_level = log_retrans ? D_NETERROR : D_NET;
04824 
04825                 /* make sure we are not off in the weeds with this tx */
04826                 if (time_after(jiffies, dev->gnd_last_map + GNILND_MAP_TIMEOUT)) {
04827                        GNIDBG_TX(D_NETERROR, tx,
04828                                "giving up on TX, too many retries", NULL);
04829                        spin_unlock(&dev->gnd_lock);
04830                        if (tx->tx_msg.gnm_type == GNILND_MSG_PUT_REQ ||
04831                            tx->tx_msg.gnm_type == GNILND_MSG_GET_REQ_REV) {
04832                                kgnilnd_nak_rdma(tx->tx_conn, tx->tx_msg.gnm_type,
04833                                                 -ENOMEM,
04834                                                 tx->tx_putinfo.gnpam_dst_cookie,
04835                                                 tx->tx_msg.gnm_srcnid);
04836                         } else {
04837                                 kgnilnd_nak_rdma(tx->tx_conn, tx->tx_msg.gnm_type,
04838                                                 -ENOMEM,
04839                                                 tx->tx_getinfo.gngm_cookie,
04840                                                 tx->tx_msg.gnm_srcnid);
04841                         }
04842                        kgnilnd_tx_done(tx, -ENOMEM);
04843                        GOTO(get_out_mapped, rc);
04844                 } else {
04845                        GNIDBG_TX(log_retrans_level, tx,
04846                                 "transient map failure #%d %d pages/%d bytes phys %u@%u "
04847                                 "virt %u@"LPU64" "
04848                                 "nq_map %d mdd# %d/%d GART %ld",
04849                                 dev->gnd_map_attempt, tx->tx_phys_npages, tx->tx_nob,
04850                                 dev->gnd_map_nphys, dev->gnd_map_physnop * PAGE_SIZE,
04851                                 dev->gnd_map_nvirt, dev->gnd_map_virtnob,
04852                                 atomic_read(&dev->gnd_nq_map),
04853                                 atomic_read(&dev->gnd_n_mdd), atomic_read(&dev->gnd_n_mdd_held),
04854                                 atomic64_read(&dev->gnd_nbytes_map));
04855                 }
04856 
04857                 /* we need to stop processing the rest of the list, so add it back in */
04858                 /* set timer to wake device when we need to schedule this tx */
04859                 mod_timer(&dev->gnd_map_timer, dev->gnd_next_map);
04860                 kgnilnd_tx_add_state_locked(tx, NULL, tx->tx_conn, GNILND_TX_MAPQ, 0);
04861                 spin_unlock(&dev->gnd_lock);
04862                 GOTO(get_out_mapped, rc);
04863         }
04864         spin_unlock(&dev->gnd_lock);
04865 get_out_mapped:
04866         RETURN(found_work);
04867 }
04868 
04869 int
04870 kgnilnd_process_conns(kgn_device_t *dev, unsigned long deadline)
04871 {
04872         int              found_work = 0;
04873         int              conn_sched;
04874         int              intent = 0;
04875         int              error_inject = 0;
04876         int              rc = 0;
04877         kgn_conn_t      *conn;
04878 
04879         spin_lock(&dev->gnd_lock);
04880         while (!list_empty(&dev->gnd_ready_conns) && time_before(jiffies, deadline)) {
04881                 dev->gnd_sched_alive = jiffies;
04882                 error_inject = 0;
04883                 rc = 0;
04884 
04885                 if (unlikely(kgnilnd_data.kgn_quiesce_trigger)) {
04886                         /* break with lock held */
04887                         break;
04888                 }
04889 
04890                 conn = list_first_entry(&dev->gnd_ready_conns, kgn_conn_t, gnc_schedlist);
04891                 list_del_init(&conn->gnc_schedlist);
04892                 spin_unlock(&dev->gnd_lock);
04893 
04894                 conn_sched = xchg(&conn->gnc_scheduled, GNILND_CONN_PROCESS);
04895 
04896                 LASSERTF(conn_sched != GNILND_CONN_IDLE &&
04897                          conn_sched != GNILND_CONN_PROCESS,
04898                          "conn %p on ready list but in bad state: %d\n",
04899                          conn, conn_sched);
04900 
04901                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "conn %p@%s for processing\n",
04902                         conn, kgnilnd_conn_state2str(conn));
04903 
04904                 found_work++;
04905                 set_mb(conn->gnc_last_sched_do, jiffies);
04906 
04907                 if (kgnilnd_check_conn_fail_loc(dev, conn, &intent)) {
04908 
04909                         /* based on intent see if we should run again. */
04910                         rc = kgnilnd_schedule_process_conn(conn, intent);
04911                         error_inject = 1;
04912                         /* drop ref from gnd_ready_conns */
04913                         if (atomic_read(&conn->gnc_refcount) == 1 && rc != 1) {
04914                                 down_write(&dev->gnd_conn_sem);
04915                                 kgnilnd_conn_decref(conn);
04916                                 up_write(&dev->gnd_conn_sem);
04917                         } else if (rc != 1) {
04918                         kgnilnd_conn_decref(conn);
04919                         }
04920                         /* clear this so that scheduler thread doesn't spin */
04921                         found_work = 0;
04922                         /* break with lock held... */
04923                         spin_lock(&dev->gnd_lock);
04924                         break;
04925                 }
04926 
04927                 if (unlikely(conn->gnc_state == GNILND_CONN_CLOSED)) {
04928                         down_write(&dev->gnd_conn_sem);
04929 
04930                         /* CONN_CLOSED set in procces_fmaq when CLOSE is sent */
04931                         if (unlikely(atomic_read(&conn->gnc_tx_in_use))) {
04932                                 /* If there are tx's currently in use in another
04933                                  * thread we dont want to complete the close
04934                                  * yet. Cycle this conn back through
04935                                  * the scheduler. */
04936                                 kgnilnd_schedule_conn(conn);
04937                         } else {
04938                                 kgnilnd_complete_closed_conn(conn);
04939                         }
04940                         up_write(&dev->gnd_conn_sem);
04941                 } else if (unlikely(conn->gnc_state == GNILND_CONN_DESTROY_EP)) {
04942                         /* DESTROY_EP set in kgnilnd_conn_decref on gnc_refcount = 1 */
04943                         /* serialize SMSG CQs with ep_bind and smsg_release */
04944                         down_write(&dev->gnd_conn_sem);
04945                         kgnilnd_destroy_conn_ep(conn);
04946                         up_write(&dev->gnd_conn_sem);
04947                 } else if (unlikely(conn->gnc_state == GNILND_CONN_CLOSING)) {
04948                        /* if we need to do some CLOSE sending, etc done here do it */
04949                         down_write(&dev->gnd_conn_sem);
04950                         kgnilnd_send_conn_close(conn);
04951                         kgnilnd_check_fma_rx(conn);
04952                         up_write(&dev->gnd_conn_sem);
04953                 } else if (atomic_read(&conn->gnc_peer->gnp_dirty_eps) == 0) {
04954                         /* start moving traffic if the old conns are cleared out */
04955                         down_read(&dev->gnd_conn_sem);
04956                         kgnilnd_check_fma_rx(conn);
04957                         kgnilnd_process_fmaq(conn);
04958                         up_read(&dev->gnd_conn_sem);
04959                 }
04960 
04961                 rc = kgnilnd_schedule_process_conn(conn, 0);
04962 
04963                 /* drop ref from gnd_ready_conns */
04964                 if (atomic_read(&conn->gnc_refcount) == 1 && rc != 1) {
04965                         down_write(&dev->gnd_conn_sem);
04966                         kgnilnd_conn_decref(conn);
04967                         up_write(&dev->gnd_conn_sem);
