04968                 } else if (rc != 1) {
04969                 kgnilnd_conn_decref(conn);
04970                 }
04971 
04972                 /* check list again with lock held */
04973                 spin_lock(&dev->gnd_lock);
04974         }
04975 
04976         /* If we are short circuiting due to timing we want to be scheduled
04977          * as soon as possible.
04978          */
04979         if (!list_empty(&dev->gnd_ready_conns) && !error_inject)
04980                 found_work++;
04981 
04982         spin_unlock(&dev->gnd_lock);
04983 
04984         RETURN(found_work);
04985 }
04986 
04987 int
04988 kgnilnd_scheduler(void *arg)
04989 {
04990         int               threadno = (long)arg;
04991         kgn_device_t            *dev;
04992         int                     busy_loops = 0;
04993         unsigned long     deadline = 0;
04994         DEFINE_WAIT(wait);
04995 
04996         dev = &kgnilnd_data.kgn_devices[(threadno + 1) % kgnilnd_data.kgn_ndevs];
04997 
04998         cfs_block_allsigs();
04999 
05000         /* all gnilnd threads need to run fairly urgently */
05001         set_user_nice(current, *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_sched_nice);
05002         deadline = jiffies + cfs_time_seconds(*kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_sched_timeout);
05003         while (!kgnilnd_data.kgn_shutdown) {
05004                 int     found_work = 0;
05005                 /* Safe: kgn_shutdown only set when quiescent */
05006 
05007                 /* to quiesce or to not quiesce, that is the question */
05008 
05009                 if (unlikely(kgnilnd_data.kgn_quiesce_trigger)) {
05010                         KGNILND_SPIN_QUIESCE;
05011                 }
05012 
05013                 /* tracking for when thread goes AWOL */
05014                 dev->gnd_sched_alive = jiffies;
05015 
05016                 CFS_FAIL_TIMEOUT(CFS_FAIL_GNI_SCHED_DEADLINE,
05017                         (*kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_sched_timeout + 1));
05018                 /* let folks know we are up and kicking
05019                  * - they can use this for latency savings, etc
05020                  * - only change if IRQ, if IDLE leave alone as that
05021                  *   schedule_device calls to put us back to IRQ */
05022                 (void)cmpxchg(&dev->gnd_ready, GNILND_DEV_IRQ, GNILND_DEV_LOOP);
05023 
05024                 down_read(&dev->gnd_conn_sem);
05025                 /* always check these - they are super low cost  */
05026                 found_work += kgnilnd_check_fma_send_cq(dev);
05027                 found_work += kgnilnd_check_fma_rcv_cq(dev);
05028 
05029                 /* rdma CQ doesn't care about eps */
05030                 found_work += kgnilnd_check_rdma_cq(dev);
05031 
05032                 /* move some RDMA ? */
05033                 found_work += kgnilnd_process_rdmaq(dev);
05034 
05035                 /* map some pending RDMA requests ? */
05036                 found_work += kgnilnd_process_mapped_tx(dev);
05037 
05038                 /* the EP for a conn is not destroyed until all the references
05039                  * to it are gone, so these checks should be safe
05040                  * even if run in parallel with the CQ checking functions
05041                  * _AND_ a thread that processes the CLOSED->DONE
05042                  * transistion
05043                  * ...should.... */
05044 
05045                 up_read(&dev->gnd_conn_sem);
05046 
05047                 /* process all conns ready now */
05048                 found_work += kgnilnd_process_conns(dev, deadline);
05049 
05050                 /* do an eager check to avoid the IRQ disabling in
05051                  * prepare_to_wait and friends */
05052 
05053                 if (found_work &&
05054                    (busy_loops++ < *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_loops) &&
05055                    time_before(jiffies, deadline)) {
05056                         found_work = 0;
05057                         if ((busy_loops % 10) == 0) {
05058                                 /* tickle heartbeat and watchdog to ensure our
05059                                  * piggishness doesn't turn into heartbeat failure */
05060                                 touch_nmi_watchdog();
05061                                 kgnilnd_hw_hb();
05062                         }
05063                         continue;
05064                 }
05065 
05066                 /* if we got here, found_work was zero or busy_loops means we
05067                  * need to take a break. We'll clear gnd_ready but we'll check
05068                  * one last time if there is an IRQ that needs processing */
05069 
05070                 prepare_to_wait(&dev->gnd_waitq, &wait, TASK_INTERRUPTIBLE);
05071 
05072                 /* the first time this will go LOOP -> IDLE and let us do one final check
05073                  * during which we might get an IRQ, then IDLE->IDLE and schedule()
05074                  * - this might allow other threads to block us for a bit if they
05075                  *   try to get the mutex, but that is good as we'd need to wake
05076                  *   up soon to handle the CQ or other processing anyways */
05077 
05078                 found_work += xchg(&dev->gnd_ready, GNILND_DEV_IDLE);
05079 
05080                 if ((busy_loops >= *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_loops) ||
05081                    time_after_eq(jiffies, deadline)) {
05082                         CDEBUG(D_INFO,
05083                                "yeilding: found_work %d busy_loops %d\n",
05084                                found_work, busy_loops);
05085                         busy_loops = 0;
05086                         /* use yield if we are bailing due to busy_loops
05087                          * - this will ensure we wake up soonish. This closes
05088                          * a race with kgnilnd_device_callback - where it'd
05089                          * not call wake_up() because gnd_ready == 1, but then
05090                          * we come down and schedule() because of busy_loops.
05091                          * We'd not be woken up until something poked our waitq
05092                          * again. yield() ensures we wake up without another
05093                          * waitq poke in that case */
05094                         atomic_inc(&dev->gnd_n_yield);
05095                         kgnilnd_data.kgn_last_condresched = jiffies;
05096                         yield();
05097                         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "awake after yeild\n");
05098                         deadline = jiffies + cfs_time_seconds(*kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_sched_timeout);
05099                 } else if (found_work == GNILND_DEV_IDLE) {
05100                         /* busy_loops is low and there is nothing to do,
05101                          * go to sleep and wait for a waitq poke */
05102                         CDEBUG(D_INFO,
05103                                "scheduling: found_work %d busy_loops %d\n",
05104                                found_work, busy_loops);
05105                         atomic_inc(&dev->gnd_n_schedule);
05106                         kgnilnd_data.kgn_last_scheduled = jiffies;
05107                         schedule();
05108                         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "awake after schedule\n");
05109                         deadline = jiffies + cfs_time_seconds(*kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_sched_timeout);
05110                 }
05111                 finish_wait(&dev->gnd_waitq, &wait);
05112         }
05113 
05114         kgnilnd_thread_fini();
05115         return 0;
05116 }
